November 2021

October 2021
Josh and Whitney are just the best and have what has to be the cleanest, most cozy and inviting airbnb out there. I loved everything about my stay, and they are so helpful, kind, and responsive. Show more', 'Alex
September 2021
We returned to New York over the summer and had an excellent stay. Josh & Whitney were fantastic hosts, and the apartment was very nicely appointed. (It does look just like the photos) It was well furnished and had everything you’d need.

The weekly maid service is also a big bonus, as it kept the place it great shape, and also helped us avoid needing the local laundromat.

Josh & Whitney were very quick to resolve any minor issues that popped us, as they live right downstairs.

Additionally, the location is fantastic, just a few blocks from the Met & Central Park, as well as 2 minutes to the train & bus lines.

Many thanks Josh & Whitney!

Cheryl
November 2021
Joshua and his family were very kind and helpful. The apartment was amazing! I recommend this apartment to anyone looking for a NYC getaway on the upper east side. Very close to restaurants, gyms, markets, Central Park, etc. I wish I could have stayed for another month :) I highly recommend this rental.
Show more
Alison
October 2021
Josh and Whitney are just the best and have what has to be the cleanest, most cozy and inviting airbnb out there. I loved everything about my stay, and they are so helpful, kind, and responsive. The location is wonderful - quiet and convenient and fun. The apartment has everything you need, is stylish and so comfortable. Don’t hesitate to stay here! I hope to be back:)
Show more
Alex
September 2021
We returned to New York over the summer and had an excellent stay. Josh & Whitney were fantastic hosts, and the apartment was very nicely appointed. (It does look just like the photos) It was well furnished and had everything you’d need.

The weekly maid service is also a big bonus, as it kept the place it great shape, and also helped us avoid needing the local laundromat.

Josh & Whitney were very quick to resolve any minor issues that popped us, as they live right downstairs.

Additionally, the location is fantastic, just a few blocks from the Met & Central Park, as well as 2 minutes to the train & bus lines.

Many thanks Josh & Whitney!
Show more
Olga
July 2021
Comfortable, stylish and clean doesn't begin to cover this apartment. The owners take a real pride in details and the comfort of the guest. The communication was flawless, questions were answered and any glitch was taken care of. The place is on a quiet block, with bright big windows, separate comfortable bedroom, modern bathroom and a walk in shower. A home away from home, truly. Thank you for the hospitality Whitney and Josh.
Show more
Xilin
May 2021
Pushes the bar for 5 star host! Always available to help with anything you need. Perfect location near the park and museums.

New York, United States

listing_name: ['Charming Astoria studio on quiet tree-lined street']
listing_type: ['Entire rental unit hosted by Anastasia\n2 guests · Studio · 1 bed · 1 bath']
review:
['Molly
October 2021
Everything about this place is excellent: excellent space, excellent location, excellent hosts, excellent price. I stayed here for over a month and loved every minute of it.

The neighborhood is one of my favorites in NYC - trees everywhere and lots of nice restaurants (also it’s easy to park if you have a car).

The apt itself is perfectly equipped for long-term stays. All the kitchen tools, plus spices/salt & pepper. Bed is comfy! Ample seating in living room & kitchen.

Anastasia & Joshua are great people in general. As hosts, they are around if you need but are also respectful of privacy.

Would 100% recommend and stay again.
Show more', "Lara
August 2021
Anastasia's place was wonderful to stay at. The kitchen and bathroom were well-stocked with essentials and the living and bedroom areas were very comfortable. It's also very close to the subway. Anastasia herself was always communicative and kind. I strongly recommend her place!
Show more", 'Tat
May 2021
Cute place in great neighborhood! Thank you!', 'Janani
April 2021
The basement studio is a beautiful space with a nod to vintage/dated furniture. The studio is in a thriving neighborhood with a ton of great local spots and is within walking distance from Astoria Park. There are several grocery stores and laundromats around.
The studio is decorated well and has ample closet space. The hosts were very responsive and helped us with things immediately.
As the chairs are vintage they have the creaking noise but they were comfortable enough. There are several large vintage trunks that add both beauty and storage solutions. Finally, the rightly placed art around the studio almost fully makes up for the lack of windows.
Show more']

Enhanced Clean

Great location

Great check-in experience
100% of recent guests gave the check-in process a 5-star rating.
Charming ground level studio apartment in a duplex building. Private entrance with outdoor seating area. Tastefully decorated with period pieces and antiques, original artwork, and folk art from travels abroad. Air conditioning unit, fan, convection oven/microwave combo, countertop electric range, under-the-counter fridge, French pressscoffee pot and hot water heater. There is a large closet for storage. Two blocks from subway. Well-trained dogs allowed. 31 day minimum stay.


This space is perfect for a couple or a solo traveler. It is comfortable and private, yet well-suited for time in residence as well as adventures in Astoria and greater NYC. Conveniently, there is a lovely coffee roaster across the street for your morning java. The restaurant scene in Astoria is notable for its quality and the diversity of cuisine. Pub/bar scene--same thing.

Molly
October 2021
Everything about this place is excellent: excellent space, excellent location, excellent hosts, excellent price. I stayed here for over a month and loved every minute of it.

The neighborhood is one of my favorites in NYC - trees everywhere and lots of nice restaurants (also it’s easy to park if you have a car).

The apt itself is perfectly equipped for long-term stays. All the kitchen tools, plus spices/salt & pepper. Bed is comfy! Ample seating in living room & kitchen.

Anastasia & Joshua are great people in general. As hosts, they are around if you need but are also respectful of privacy.

Would 100% recommend and stay again.
Show more
Lara
August 2021
Anastasia's place was wonderful to stay at. The kitchen and bathroom were well-stocked with essentials and the living and bedroom areas were very comfortable. It's also very close to the subway. Anastasia herself was always communicative and kind. I strongly recommend her place!
Show more
Tat
May 2021
Cute place in great neighborhood! Thank you!
Janani
April 2021
The basement studio is a beautiful space with a nod to vintage/dated furniture. The studio is in a thriving neighborhood with a ton of great local spots and is within walking distance from Astoria Park. There are several grocery stores and laundromats around.
The studio is decorated well and has ample closet space. The hosts were very responsive and helped us with things immediately.
As the chairs are vintage they have the creaking noise but they were comfortable enough. There are several large vintage trunks that add both beauty and storage solutions. Finally, the rightly placed art around the studio almost fully makes up for the lack of windows.
Show more
Where you’ll be
Queens, New York, United States
Astoria has always been a haven for new immigrants from all over the world. These days, this part of Astoria is known for its progressive politics (AOC is our Rep.), many bars and restaurants, most with sidewalk/garden dining venues. It also hosts a lovely park along the East River, popular with sports enthusiasts, dog-owners, yogis and families.
Show more
Hosted by Anastasia
Joined in January 2014
201 Reviews
Identity verified
\U000f0003
Superhost
My husband and I have lived and worked in New York for over twenty-five years. We love Astoria for its 'old New York' neighborhood qualities, funky restaurants and cafes, and easy access to all points on the map.
During your stay
My husband, Joshua, and I, are here to help you navigate, find what you need. We are particularly well acquainted with art events around the city.

Very bright 1-bedroom apartment fully furnished available for rent in Manhattan in a small house on the fourth floor (third floor in Europe). The house is conveniently situated in the up and coming Kips Bay area between Murray Hill and Gramercy Park. Located across a park, it is a quiet and ideal location.
The place still has its original features from early 1900s- beautiful wooden floors, wooden cupboards, bricks and double height ceilings. This apartment is fully furnished and functional.


Bright apartment with many windows on both sides facing parks. The bedroom has a double size bed and the sofa in the living room can accommodate visitors. Wonderful view to the Empire State Building from the living room.

Hi! We are renting the entire private garden level apartment within our townhouse located in the super hip Bushwick, w/ full kitchen, living room,bedroom, & huge backyard,where we provide firewood for making fires and s'mores! The Apartment is homey, cozy & clean. Bushwick is a fun, hip artistic neighborhood w/ lots to see and many great bars and restaurants! The apartment is just 3 blocks away from the J train, the supermarket and Citibike, with delis on both corners! 20 minutes to Manhattan!


This is a two family townhouse and we are renting the garden level apartment, which will not be shared w/ others. This includes a living room, full kitchen, full bathroom and a bedroom with a full sized bed that fits two comfortably. The apartment gets tons of sunlight on non cloudy days and there are shades available in the living room for privacy. The bedroom overlooks a huge private backyard which you will have full access to and will be shared only with the hosts if they happen to be there.

listing_name: ['Charming Studio in heart of the Upper East Side']
listing_type: ['Entire rental unit hosted by Jane\n2 guests · Studio · 1 bed · 1 bath']
review:
['Gioia
July 2021
Janes place is a small, sweet, authentic NYC studio apartment experience. Nothing too fancy but nicely serviceable. All our needs were met. Jane was easy to communicate with. I don’t have a younger sister but it felt like I was borrowing a younger siblings apartment. There are a few quirky things, like a very small bathroom sink, that aren’t really her problem to fix, that are just yours to deal with while you are there and then make you appreciate your normal size sink all the more once you get home. I would be willing stay here again if I had a reason once more to be in that neighborhood. Close to subways, museums, good eats, quiet at night. Enjoy!
Show more', 'Jessica
June 2021
Jane’s apartment is in the classiest part of Manhattan where the richest people live. It’s totally safe and walking distance from Central Park. I brought my toddler with me on this trip and we had an amazing time. Jane is the friendliest person I’ve ever met. She was quite helpful and flexible when I ran into some issues concerning my arrival and departure. Her energy made me feel like I knew her already, and her beauty is so striking I was convinced she was American royalty. It’s a wonderful gift she gives to the world to open up her home to travelers to give an authentic New York experience. I will be staying with her next time 100% if she will have us!
Show more', 'Meghan
June 2021
I had a wonderful stay at Jane’s place! The location was perfect, very safe, surrounded by a ton of local restaurants and bars and a ten minute walk from Central Park. I would definitely stay again.
Show more', "Glenn
June 2021
I would say that John's December 2020 review is pretty accurate. The apartment itself is not amazing - it's a typically narrow, small Manhattan efficiency apartment - and the hostess lives there when she is not subletting it via AirBnB, so her personal belongings are unavoidable. But it is an AMAZING value compared to booking a hotel room in Manhattan, especially considering it is located in the upscale Upper East Side. One could easily pay a lot more and get a lot less in NYC. While there isn't a lot of space, it is clean and reasonably tidy, and the bed is perfectly comfortable. Be aware that a single person lives here; I could only find a single mug, bowl and spoon (but plenty of plates) so my wife and I had to takes turns drinking coffee and eating cereal, LOL. You will also need to bring your own towels, and I also fortunately brought a stove-top 'moka' coffeemaker from home. The apartment faces the street and is located right near the building's main entrance on the first floor, so city noise is audible and can sometimes be intrusive. That's how people live in Manhattan and it is all part of the experience. Jane was an excellent host, extremely friendly and helpful as well as accommodating. This apartment is a terrific option for budget-minded travelers. My wife and I will likely stay here again when we return to NYC.
Show more", 'John
December 2020
Don’t book this air bnb if you staying for more than 2 days. I say that because the host lives in the space that you are staying in. She does leave and doesn’t bother you but her stuff is everywhere. No spaces to put your clothes because her clothes are in the closet and dresser. The apartment is small so had to have all my stuff on the floor. Also make sure you bring your own soap, shampoo and conditioner because there is none provided. It was a nice stay thing were everything. Like her slippers on the floor, the night stand full of stuff even had an iPad in it. The kitchen was very small so most likely going to want to eat out for every meal or do takeout. But there is no big trash bin in the apartment so trash was inconvenient. If your staying for one night and you don’t have a lot of stuff it’s perfect.
Show more', "Alexandra
September 2020
Staying at Jane's place in the Upper East Side was one of the best travel experiences I have ever had! Starting with the excellent communications with Jane where she answered all my questions to the chic styled studio in one of the best locations in the city. Everything about the experience was first class, I didn't want to leave. Thank you for a truly wonderful getaway in NYC!!
Show more"]

But it is an AMAZING value compared to booking a hotel room in Manhattan, especially considering it is located in the upscale Upper East Side. One could easily pay a lot more and get a lot less in NYC. While there isn't a lot of space, it is clean and reasonably tidy, and the bed is perfectly comfortable. Be aware that a single person lives here; I could only find a single mug, bowl and spoon (but plenty of plates) so my wife and I had to takes turns drinking coffee and eating cereal, LOL. You will also need to bring your own towels, and I also fortunately brought a stove-top 'moka' coffeemaker from home. The apartment faces the street and is located right near the building's main entrance on the first floor, so city noise is audible and can sometimes be intrusive. That's how people live in Manhattan and it is all part of the experience. Jane was an excellent host, extremely friendly and helpful as well as accommodating. This apartment is a terrific option for budget-minded travelers. My wife and I will likely stay here again when we return to NYC.
Show more
John
December 2020
Don’t book this air bnb if you staying for more than 2 days. I say that because the host lives in the space that you are staying in. She does leave and doesn’t bother you but her stuff is everywhere. No spaces to put your clothes because her clothes are in the closet and dresser. The apartment is small so had to have all my stuff on the floor. Also make sure you bring your own soap, shampoo and conditioner because there is none provided. It was a nice stay thing were everything. Like her slippers on the floor, the night stand full of stuff even had an iPad in it. The kitchen was very small so most likely going to want to eat out for every meal or do takeout. But there is no big trash bin in the apartment so trash was inconvenient. If your staying for one night and you don’t have a lot of stuff it’s perfect.
Show more
Alexandra
September 2020
Staying at Jane's place in the Upper East Side was one of the best travel experiences I have ever had! Starting with the excellent communications with Jane where she answered all my questions to the chic styled studio in one of the best locations in the city. Everything about the experience was first class, I didn't want to leave. Thank you for a truly wonderful getaway in NYC!!

The biggest room in Brooklyn, furnished with a Full-Size Bed, dresser, and wardrobes. Famous location, friendly neighborhood, bars, restaurants, and fun sites.

☆☆KEYNOTES:
1) Room is affordable to stay in (discount included).
2) Autumn season begins and there is a Fan in the room.
3) You will be sharing the bathroom with 2 other guests.
4) You have access to a living room and a kitchenette on your floor.


☆☆locales please send messages before booking instantly.☆☆


THE AREA:
This town is in a humble, safe, families oriented area with lots of ventures. Its has a historic vintage feeling, movies like "Taxi Driver" (Robert Dinero) and "Do the right thing" (Spike Lee), homes of celebrities too. There are Bars, Pubs, Cafes, and restaurants in a short distance.

TRANSPORTATION:
This place is located on the A and C train line, in Bedstuy/Clinton Hills. There are Bars, Pubs, Cafes, and restaurants in short distance. 15mins max to the City, and safer to walk around any time.

The house is huge, a vintage classic in a private lot. There are 5 people currently living there now, and you will be 6th person. There are 3 bathrooms, 1 kitchen, 2 dinning tables in a huge dinning room and 1 living room. Front yard hang out with benches outside and backyard shades space.

Room Details:
- room is located on the 2nd floor.
- Perfect for 1 person (only).
- 1 windows.
- Clean, tidy with wooden floors
- Wifi.

Welcome to the Bronx! The super spacious and Comfortable space offers two rooms with private dinner area. Recently renovated, it’s the ideal retreat for anyone visiting NYC or to catch and baseball game.
located in high Bridge neighborhood of the Bronx. We believe it’s the ultimate location to experience NYC the way it should be. Get ready to get inspired! Extremely close to some fabulous sites like
Yankee stadium, the Bronx zoo, the Botanic Garden, the famous seafoods of City island And more.


Our house is a perfect getaway. Ideal for couples looking for a “home away from home” or a romantic break. It also suits solo travelers, groups of friends & family looking togo to central Nyc location. Great for people looking for an Comfortable, calm and convenient place to stay. We love to go that extra mile so you feel like you are at home.

If you stay with us you be within walking distance of:
1. Yankees stadium 🏟️
2. Washington heights
3. High bridge
4. The up and coming south Bronx
5. Distinguished attractions
6. Restaurants

I’ll supply you with:
- Bed Linen
- Towels
- Tv
- Toiletries
- Fast & Free Wifi
- Private dining area
- A stocked kitchen upon your arrival with some essentials

["Home Away from Home-Room in Midtown
4.79

\U000f0003

New York, United States
Share

Private room in rental unit hosted by Marco
2 guests · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1.5 shared baths
Enhanced Clean
This Host committed to Airbnb's 5-step enhanced cleaning process. Show more
Great location
95% of recent guests gave the location a 5-star rating.
Great check-in experience
100% of recent guests gave the check-in process a 5-star rating.
An old room that was recently refitted into a Studio Apartment-size accommodation, equipped with its own private bathroom and shower. This location counts with its own entrance and exit to the street, guests have complete and independent access.

Surrounded by many restaurants, 24-hour minimarkets and pharmacies, bars, pubs and all major train stations.

This accommodation is optimal for couples, or single travellers. If you wish for three people, please contact me to properly accommodate.


An old room in the basement of our home that was recently refitted into a studio apartment-size room, with its own private toilet, shower, and entrance.

If you wish to book for three people, please contact me to properly accommodate.

Television, microwave, air conditioner, heating, mini-fridge, Wi-Fi, a desk, bookshelf, and guests get the only copy to door keys and locks.

Room with window, A/C and heating, and area to prepare small meals.

A perfect small, quiet, and cozy room with all the essentials and privacy in the heart of the Big Apple.

Full access to the room, guests will be able to come and go at any hour of the day (or night) as they please.

Full use of small cooking appliances (microwave, toaster, etc.).

Guest will have only copy of keys to the room along with keys to the private entrance.

We are more than happy to give any recommendations, suggestions, and tips when it comes to sightseeings in New York, or with help finding a true New York experience.

Also whenever guests are in need of certain assistances, we are more than ready to help.

Surrounded by many great Italian, Greek, Turkish, Japanese, Mexican, Thai Restaurants & American Dinners.

Bars and pubs, 24Hour stores and Open-Late restaurants.

Heart of the City, Center of Hell's Kitchen, and true origins of Midtown culture.

All major subways A/C/E, R/Q/N, 1/2/3, 7, S - 6/5/4 trains, Central Park, Times Square, Rockefeller Center, Columbus Circle, Theatre District, and Port Authority only blocks away.

Many buses that can take you around town.
Port Authority only few blocks away.

Please read the description, and discuss with me before booking.

Feel free to ask any questions.

Lucas

Great stay..nice clean room in an awesome location. Thank you!
Sophia
July 2021
This place was great, especially for the value! They provide all the amenities you could need- even with small touches like paper plates and plastic utensils. We really loved how they turned a room into a full living space with the toilet and shower and mini fridge. We truly did not need anything more. The air conditioning was a life-saver in the summer heat. The bed was very comfortable with soft sheets. Times Square is just a couple blocks away and there’s plenty of cute restaurants close by. Highly recommend!
Show more
Aaron
July 2021
Absolutely loved it! Would come back next time.
Megan
July 2021
Do you want a wonderful, inexpensive stay in the heart of Hell's Kitchen? You've found your place! Very clean and inviting, the room has any amenity you may need. Plus the owners are so nice! The only negative I could think of is that you can hear whatever is going on outside, so it can be a little difficult to sleep through the night, but you get used to it by the second night. In conclusion, why spend a fortune for a hotel when this hidden gem is available?
Show more
Jacqueline
July 2021
Marco and his family are the best hosts! They are so flexible and quick to answer questions. The room was very clean and the location was wonderful! Close to a lot of places including the subway! I hope to come back soon!

New York, United States

Room in boutique hotel hosted by Reservation Desk
2 guests · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 4 shared baths
Enhanced Clean

Self check-in

Experienced host
Reservation Desk has 65 reviews for other places.
With its old-world charm marked by European style, Hotel 17 hotel is located in lower Midtown Manhattan and places you in the center of convenience and visiting New York City attractions are accessible by walking or by public transportation.

This Double Shared Bathroom is one of Hotel 17's independent rooms. All rooms are shared bathroom in the hallways. There are 4 private bathrooms on each floor. You do have sink in the room.


As Manhattan’s best neighborhood city hotel, Hotel 17 is also the best reviewed hotel. New York Magazine and the New York Times articles defined the beauty and history of our New York City landmark building. Hotel 17 fame also appeared in the 1993 Woody Allen film ‘Manhattan Murder Mystery’ and was the site for photo shoots in Madonna’s Sex book. Fashion magazine, such as GQ, Elle, and Vogue, favored our hotel setting for fashion shoots.

review:
["Judeline
November 2021
Anna'splace was exactly what we needed for our quick visit to New York. The place is clean, easy to access, very quiet and independent.
I would definitely stay at her place again. Anna is also very nice and understanding, she responds quickly to messages and work with you if anything is needed. She left us extra towels, bedding and a space heater ( we didn't use it because the place is well heated). Thank you very much Anna.
Show more", 'Jorge
November 2021
One of the most cozy and easy places we been, very clean and Anna as a host was great by texting us and asking if everything was going well with us, loved the bathroom with roiled towels and just everything you could need. Definitely coming back.

Interior and mattresses are being exchanged frequently. The apartment is very quiet and catches plenty of daylight.
Located in Brooklyn, you will get to experience staying in a new, exciting neighborhood with artists and young families.

You are welcome to use the kitchen, all dishes included. You can have food in the fridge. I have a Microwave and a Electric water kettle for you to make coffee or tea. However, I cannot allow the use of the stove , no actual meal cooking please. Thank you!

This duplex apartment is located in a Washington Heights building , built in 1915.
The 2 floor apartment, which is on the 5th and 6th levels, has a full sized elevator/lift and is overlooking the stunning views of the Hudson River.
The first level consist of one spacious bright lounge a fully fitted kitchen, dinning room and a bathroom.
On the second level you will find your room and another full sized bathroom.


This is a 4 bedroom duplex apartment with 2 full bathrooms in a Pre War building.
The bedroom is fully furnished with a bathroom just outside the room, with towels, etc.
The bedroom includes a new Queen size bed, blackout curtains, 40 inch high definition TV with premium channels (Netflix and Amazon Prime), ultra high speed internet through out, a computer desk with wireless printer, keyboard and mouse, mutilple USB outlets for your phones etc, and a mini firdge. One large closet stocked with hangers, clothes steamer, hair dryer, steam iron and ironing board.
Also you will be able to enjoy the rest of the apt which includes the large living room (also overlooking the Hudson River), a full fitted kitchen, and separate washer machine and dryer.
You will also be given your own personal pin number to your room and internet.

review:
["Anastasia
August 2021
If you are considering staying in NYC the weekend or for a few months and are considering this place, choose it!! From the moment we arrived (my roommate and I), we loved the apartment. It's larger than the pictures show and really accommodating for two people (or two couples or a family) to live in. The AC is incredible (we worked from home during the summer at this spot/WIFI was also great) and were really grateful for such powerful AC throughout whenever needed. Another HUGE PLUS are the dishwasher and the washer/dryer in unit. These really make the difference. There was everything we could ask for in the kitchen and the rooms were fully stocked with enough blankets and linens to feel at home. The LOCATION is another 10/10. The UWS is close enough to Midtown and downtown or UES that a subway ride can get you there but far enough that you feel like you're going home from the hustle and bustle of everything every night. I had a favorite book shop all the way in the lower east side and I found it really manageable to travel there and back to the apartment. Additionally the surrounding restaurants (Amity Hall for its
bottomless brunches and great eggs benedict, Hungarian pastry shop for people watching, 1020 bar for a late drink, living thai down the street and a great sushi spot on the other corner) all make this location IDEAL. Plus you have Columbia just a short 7 - 9 minute walk. I wish I could rave more about this great Airbnb experience. OH and Jenny is great. She responds to everything and anything. She is constantly available and is really great to chat with! We loved our stay!!

owner_details:
['Entire Spacious 2 Bed Apt on UWS
4.47
(84 reviews)
·
\U000f0003
Superhost
·
New York, United States
Share
Save
Show all photos
Entire rental unit hosted by Jenny
6 guests · 2 bedrooms · 3 beds · 1 bath
Entire home
You’ll have the apartment to yourself.
Enhanced Clean
This Host committed to Airbnb's 5-step enhanced cleaning process. Show more
Self check-in
Check yourself in with the lockbox.
Great location
100% of recent guests gave the location a 5-star rating.
My place is good for couples, solo adventurers, business travellers, families (with kids), and big groups.

The space
Hi there! I am excited to be renting my 2-bedroom apartment on the Upper West Side of Manhattan, New York City. The apartment is a 2-bedroom with the rooms on opposite sides, so there is plenty of privacy. The bedroom is bright, airy, and has access to a fire escape (for anyone who smokes...). The kitchen is fully equipped, and you are more than welcome to use anything you find to cook yourself a wonderful dinner or just to grab coffee on your way out for sightseeing. 

I am a very easy-going freelance writer/editor. I love meeting new people and consider myself a sort of "ambassador" of my city. I have lived here for nearly 3 years - long enough to have some insight, but still new enough to enjoy the sights and offer any advice to travelers.

The neighborhood is great - tons of things to do but still on a quiet block so you can relax after a long day of sightseeing. Below are just a few of the many sights to see nearby my apartment: 

-2 blocks from Central Park 
-1 block from St. John's Cathedral 
-Apollo Theatre in Harlem 
-Columbia University 
-Riverside Park 
-Metropolitan Opera 
-Julliard School 
-Lincoln Center 
-New York Ballet 

These are just a few of the many sights that are all either within walking distance or only a few subway stops. I am located 2 blocks away from the 1, B, and C trains which all connect to express lines making it very easy to get anywhere in the city. 

I can't wait to hear from you and am happy to answer any questions about the apartment or neighborhood, or New York in general!

Anastasia
August 2021
If you are considering staying in NYC the weekend or for a few months and are considering this place, choose it!! From the moment we arrived (my roommate and I), we loved the apartment. It's larger than the pictures show and really accommodating for two people (or two couples or a family) to live in. The AC is incredible (we worked from home during the summer at this spot/WIFI was also great) and were really grateful for such powerful AC throughout whenever needed. Another HUGE PLUS are the dishwasher and the washer/dryer in unit. These really make the difference. There was everything we could ask for in the kitchen and the rooms were fully stocked with enough blankets and linens to feel at home. The LOCATION is another 10/10. The UWS is close enough to Midtown and downtown or UES that a subway ride can get you there but far enough that you feel like you're going home from the hustle and bustle of everything every night. I had a favorite book shop all the way in the lower east side and I found it really manageable to travel there and back to the apartment. Additionally the surrounding restaurants (Amity Hall for its
bottomless brunches and great eggs benedict, Hungarian pastry shop for people watching, 1020 bar for a late drink, living thai down the street and a great sushi spot on the other corner) all make this location IDEAL. Plus you have Columbia just a short 7 - 9 minute walk. I wish I could rave more about this great Airbnb experience. OH and Jenny is great. She responds to everything and anything. She is constantly available and is really great to chat with! We loved our stay!!
Show more
LaKeasha
December 2020
Jenny's place was a great place to stay and have a small gathering. The place was clean and in a good location. The host was great with answering all my questions and making things comfortable during these times. I will definitely recommend this location for anyone looking for a nice clean place where the host is on her job.
Show more
Abdullah
November 2020
Jenny is super cooperative.
Ivy
November 2020
Inspiring New York apartment in super convenient location, subway, markets, and restaurants nearby. Loved the fire escape, really made me feel like a part of the city!
Edgar
November 2020
Great place to stay in New York. Jennys apartment was exactly what I imagined New York apartments looked like. The location is perfect for anything. So many shops in the area and you have 2 subway entrances so close by. Not to mention Central Park is less than 3 minutes away walking. Keep in mind that in New York there’s a lot of walking and the apartment is on the 5th floor with no elevator only stair access. I would definitely want to stay here again.
Show more
Saj
November 2020
Great place! Thank you for your hospitality :) also a perfect location close to the 1 line metro with tons of food options nearby.

The nearest station, Penn Station, is a 7-minute walk from the flat.
Penn Station is serviced by one large transit hub, through which six subway lines-the A, C, E, 1, 2, and 3-travel. (the A, 2, and 3 are express trains; the C, E, and 1 are local.)
It is also a bus and Amtrak station, and the second largest in Manhattan. (the largest is the famous Grand Central Station).

***PLEASE READ DETAILS BELOW BEFORE BOOKING!!***

Location! Location! Location!

Immerse yourself into the heart of Manhattan like no other. Located in Midtown, it is the most STRATEGIC location to be in to get to the majority of tourist destinations in less than 30 minutes via subway/bus.

Walking distance to:
Time Square - 15 mins walk
Empire State Building - 8 mins
Madison Square Garden -5 mins
Flatiron Building - 9 mins
Koreatown - 5 mins


It's a 2 bedroom apartment. Maximum capacity of 2 guests in each room.

*Bunk bed in the living room is also advertised, so there might be a guest staying in the common area during your reservation.
You'll be sharing this space with other Airbnb guests both male and female.

*Located on a 3rd FLOOR walk-up, NO ELEVATOR

*Since it's centrally located there's a POTENTIAL FOR NOISE but EARPLUGS ARE PROVIDED. Not recommended for light sleepers

*Guests/outsiders NOT in the reservation are not allowed to enter the apartment (camera in the living room for everyone's safety)

*It has a kitchenette that includes a refrigerator, portable stove, microwave, toaster, dishes, pots and silverware.

review:
["Taylor
October 2021
Studio on 4th floor. While I found the studio to be in good condition, the stairs had me questioning the condition of the building. I'm guessing it's just old and has settled into it's foundation but the stairs made me leery.
As a single, female, traveler, I felt safe in the neighborhood. No issue with the shared bathroom, especially since the studio had it's own shower.
Close to multiple subway stops. Had to request exact address a couple days before trip so I could plan routes between destinations.
Show more", 'Larry
October 2021
This was a great bargain with no surprises. The apartment was small but comfortable and clean. The hallway and stairs going up to the apartment were old and a little worn but once you get to the apartment it won’t matter. We were a little concerned about the toilet being shared but it turned out to be no problem at all. The location was great especially for accessing the subway.
Show more', 'Hila
October 2021
Such a fun and easy stay! Loved the location and the accommodations :) Thank you Musa for everything!!', 'Sergio
October 2021
Clean, accurate, cozy and close to everything. This is a perfect place to spend a couple of days in the city. Literally 5 minute walking from the subway and even a supermarket around the corner of you like doing groceries for your stay. Cannot recommend it enough.
Show more', 'Amy
September 2021
Great little place to stay IF you are a low maintenance kind of person, which I thought I was. The bathroom situation here proved otherwise. I just couldn’t get over having to think about all the things required to use a communal toilet. (Have to pee in the middle of the night? Put on some shoes, grab your roll of toilet paper and go across the hallway. Then touch a doorknob that countless people have touched after using the toilet, come back and wash your hands in your kitchen sink.) All that toilet stuff aside, I still think it’s an amazing value. You can’t beat the location. Air conditioning was great at providing cold air and white noise simultaneously. Very quiet room, as the windows don’t face the street. The room was overall clean, but there were some stains on the sheets, the towels didn’t smell super fresh, and the kitchen sponge smelled moldy. Musa was wonderful with communication and wi-fi worked great. I’d definitely recommend this place to people who aren’t as germaphobic as I apparently am. :)
Show more', 'Caleb
September 2021
This is not a "beautiful, cozy" studio. The studio is located in a decrepit building that is beyond serious need of renovation. I personally did not feel safe here. Seriously, this makes my freshman dorm in college look like luxury. I feel woefully misled as the pictures and description make it seem like a reasonable place to stay.

There are pros though. Great location! Musa communicated quickly and clearly. But I cannot give this place anything above a 1 star review because of the misleading description and the uncomfortable stay.
Show more']

Taylor
October 2021
Studio on 4th floor. While I found the studio to be in good condition, the stairs had me questioning the condition of the building. I'm guessing it's just old and has settled into it's foundation but the stairs made me leery.
As a single, female, traveler, I felt safe in the neighborhood. No issue with the shared bathroom, especially since the studio had it's own shower.
Close to multiple subway stops. Had to request exact address a couple days before trip so I could plan routes between destinations.
Show more
Larry
October 2021
This was a great bargain with no surprises. The apartment was small but comfortable and clean. The hallway and stairs going up to the apartment were old and a little worn but once you get to the apartment it won’t matter. We were a little concerned about the toilet being shared but it turned out to be no problem at all. The location was great especially for accessing the subway.
Show more
Hila
October 2021
Such a fun and easy stay! Loved the location and the accommodations :) Thank you Musa for everything!!
Sergio
October 2021
Clean, accurate, cozy and close to everything. This is a perfect place to spend a couple of days in the city. Literally 5 minute walking from the subway and even a supermarket around the corner of you like doing groceries for your stay. Cannot recommend it enough.
Show more
Amy
September 2021
Great little place to stay IF you are a low maintenance kind of person, which I thought I was. The bathroom situation here proved otherwise. I just couldn’t get over having to think about all the things required to use a communal toilet. (Have to pee in the middle of the night? Put on some shoes, grab your roll of toilet paper and go across the hallway. Then touch a doorknob that countless people have touched after using the toilet, come back and wash your hands in your kitchen sink.) All that toilet stuff aside, I still think it’s an amazing value. You can’t beat the location. Air conditioning was great at providing cold air and white noise simultaneously. Very quiet room, as the windows don’t face the street. The room was overall clean, but there were some stains on the sheets, the towels didn’t smell super fresh, and the kitchen sponge smelled moldy. Musa was wonderful with communication and wi-fi worked great. I’d definitely recommend this place to people who aren’t as germaphobic as I apparently am. :)
Show more
Caleb
September 2021
This is not a "beautiful, cozy" studio. The studio is located in a decrepit building that is beyond serious need of renovation. I personally did not feel safe here. Seriously, this makes my freshman dorm in college look like luxury. I feel woefully misled as the pictures and description make it seem like a reasonable place to stay.

There are pros though. Great location! Musa communicated quickly and clearly. But I cannot give this place anything above a 1 star review because of the misleading description and the uncomfortable stay.

Located on the 3rd fl, Suite C is a spacious corner studio with windows facing both North & West. The private bathroom has a claw foot bathtub. Although there's no cooking, there is a fridge, microwave, coffee maker and a sink.
Situated in Crown Heights, we're walking distance to many restaurants and pubs, museums, parks and libraries. We're also convenient to 4 bus lines and 2 subway systems, midtown Manhattan is just 30 minutes away. There's even a local stop for the Long Island Railroad!


Studio C is a favorite for many, with its high ceilings and shiny hardwood floors. 4 windows face 2 directions and allow a generous amount of natural light. The original bathroom features a claw foot tub and marble sink.
For your convenience there's a work station where you can plug in your devices to catch up on some work, or just gaze out the window to a western view.
This spacious studio can be adjoined with the adjacent studio, via an interior doorway, to accommodate parties up to 4 guests. Each studio has its own private entrance, bathroom, and kitchen. See "Comfy, Cozy Studio at the Grand Old Mansion".

Welcome to the Bronx! The super spacious and Comfortable space offers two rooms with private dinner area. Recently renovated, it’s the ideal retreat for anyone visiting NYC or to catch and baseball game.
located in high Bridge neighborhood of the Bronx. We believe it’s the ultimate location to experience NYC the way it should be. Get ready to get inspired! Extremely close to some fabulous sites like
Yankee stadium, the Bronx zoo, the Botanic Garden, the famous seafoods of City island And more.


Our house is a perfect getaway. Ideal for couples looking for a “home away from home” or a romantic break. It also suits solo travelers, groups of friends & family looking togo to central Nyc location. Great for people looking for an Comfortable, calm and convenient place to stay. We love to go that extra mile so you feel like you are at home.

If you stay with us you be within walking distance of:
1. Yankees stadium 🏟️

Highly rated Host
Alvaro has received 5-star ratings from 95% of recent guests.
This duplex apartment is located in a Washington Heights building , built in 1915.
The 2 floor apartment, which is on the 5th and 6th levels, has a full sized elevator/lift and is overlooking the stunning views of the Hudson River.
The first level consist of one spacious bright lounge a fully fitted kitchen, dinning room and a bathroom.
On the second level you will find your room and another full sized bathroom.


This is a 4 bedroom duplex apartment with 2 full bathrooms in a Pre War building.
The bedroom is fully furnished with a bathroom just outside the room, with towels, etc.
The bedroom includes a new Queen size bed, blackout curtains, 40 inch high definition TV with premium channels (Netflix and Amazon Prime), ultra high speed internet through out, a computer desk with wireless printer, keyboard and mouse, mutilple USB outlets for your phones etc, and a mini firdge. One large closet stocked with hangers, clothes steamer, hair dryer, steam iron and ironing board.
Also you will be able to enjoy the rest of the apt which includes the large living room (also overlooking the Hudson River), a full fitted kitchen, and separate washer machine and dryer.
You will also be given your own personal pin number to your room and internet.

listing_type: ['Entire rental unit hosted by Edgar\n2 guests · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath']
review:
['Amy
October 2021
Excellent host and place. Edgar responds quickly and his place is easy to find, great location so close to the park. Keep in mind his note about construction - it really startled me the first morning right on the dot at 7am. If you’re planning on being out to start your day early this isn’t a problem but if you want to sleep in you won’t be able to.
Show more', "Laura
October 2021
Edgar was very responsive and helpful before and during our stay. He generously let us check out late, as our flight wasn't until 6pm. The apartment is immaculate and covered with Edgar's beautiful art work. Yes, there is construction noise next door, but not on Sat and Sunday... and not after 5. It really wasn't big deal.
The apt is very convenient to all flavors of food, grocery, subway, bus and drugstores. We give the highest recommendation possible!
Show more", 'Lori
September 2021
Edgar’s apt was great! I was concerned about the location, having never been to New York before, however it worked out great. It is one block away from the subway, so that was awesome. The apt was very clean, and Edgar was a great host. He went out of his way to help us out with some transportation things we needed to work out. He also came to the parking garage when we first arrived to help us with our luggage and take us to the apartment. The only drawback is that there is virtually no outside view, so if you want to see the light of day, you’ll need to go outside, which is where you spend most of the time in New York City anyway!
Show more', "Janet
September 2021
The apartment was super clean and comfortable. Great location, well stocked with all the necessities. Very responsive to our need to change our check-in time at the last minute. The noise was not such a big deal, mostly because it was pretty quiet over the weekend, but even week days were not so bad. The only reason for 4 stars and not 5 was beyond the host's control because with the construction, windows were closed and shades were drawn of necessity. Regardless, we still recommend the stay because everything else was outstanding.
Show more", 'Alexis
September 2021
Great location, loved the neighborhood and proximity to the park. The bedroom windows stayed dark, which was nice for naps! Felt clean and no bugs, the only thing was some of the surfaces had dirt when I wiped them down when we first arrived. But I would absolutely stay again and loved the location so much! Make sure to check out The Painted Lady tavern!!
Show more', 'Paul
August 2021
Great place! Excellent location (easy access to east side trains and walking distance to museums, etc.), clean, and well-appointed. There was great communication throughout our stay, and Edgar and Andre were even able to accommodate our luggage on our departure date. The construction noise wasn’t so bad—just a little here and there in the morning. Overall, this is a stellar place to stay, and I highly recommend it to single folks and couples visiting NYC!
Show more']

Edgar was very responsive and helpful before and during our stay. He generously let us check out late, as our flight wasn't until 6pm. The apartment is immaculate and covered with Edgar's beautiful art work. Yes, there is construction noise next door, but not on Sat and Sunday... and not after 5. It really wasn't big deal.
The apt is very convenient to all flavors of food, grocery, subway, bus and drugstores. We give the highest recommendation possible!
Show more
Lori
September 2021
Edgar’s apt was great! I was concerned about the location, having never been to New York before, however it worked out great. It is one block away from the subway, so that was awesome. The apt was very clean, and Edgar was a great host. He went out of his way to help us out with some transportation things we needed to work out. He also came to the parking garage when we first arrived to help us with our luggage and take us to the apartment. The only drawback is that there is virtually no outside view, so if you want to see the light of day, you’ll need to go outside, which is where you spend most of the time in New York City anyway!
Show more
Janet
September 2021
The apartment was super clean and comfortable. Great location, well stocked with all the necessities. Very responsive to our need to change our check-in time at the last minute. The noise was not such a big deal, mostly because it was pretty quiet over the weekend, but even week days were not so bad. The only reason for 4 stars and not 5 was beyond the host's control because with the construction, windows were closed and shades were drawn of necessity. Regardless, we still recommend the stay because everything else was outstanding.
Show more
Alexis
September 2021
Great location, loved the neighborhood and proximity to the park. The bedroom windows stayed dark, which was nice for naps! Felt clean and no bugs, the only thing was some of the surfaces had dirt when I wiped them down when we first arrived. But I would absolutely stay again and loved the location so much! Make sure to check out The Painted Lady tavern!!
Show more
Paul
August 2021
Great place! Excellent location (easy access to east side trains and walking distance to museums, etc.), clean, and well-appointed. There was great communication throughout our stay, and Edgar and Andre were even able to accommodate our luggage on our departure date. The construction noise wasn’t so bad—just a little here and there in the morning. Overall, this is a stellar place to stay, and I highly recommend it to single folks and couples visiting NYC!

owner_details:
["Bright, Modern, Cozy Room in Brooklyn Artist's Apt
4.93
(227 reviews)
·
\U000f0003
Superhost

New York, United States

Private room in rental unit hosted by Kaitlyn
1 guest · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 shared bath
Enhanced Clean
This Host committed to Airbnb's 5-step enhanced cleaning process. Show more
Self check-in
Check yourself in with the lockbox.
Great check-in experience
100% of recent guests gave the check-in process a 5-star rating.
NYC Is back! Be my guest in this new era. My cozy & stylish Brooklyn apartment is laptop friendly with a full kitchen, laundry in the building, and rooftop access.

The space is great for both long & short term stays-- a solo vacation, a staycation, a business trip, a work-from-home-alternative, and if you want to get a glimpse of authentic Brooklyn living!

You’ll love the peaceful ambiance, central heating and A/C, comfy bed, quick commute, vibrant neighborhood & Empire State Building views.


My home is a bright & charming 2 bedroom/1 bathroom apartment. You will be staying in a private guest room. I live in the 2nd bedroom.

The living room, kitchen, and bathroom are shared with me. I am very considerate and accommodating to guests’ needs. I am also fully vaccinated!

Located on a quiet, residential street, the atmosphere is calm and inviting. The building is over 100 years old, but the apartment is newly renovated.

Getting around is super convenient— just 7 minutes walking to 3 subway lines! The unique location at the intersection of 3 iconic Brooklyn neighborhoods-- Bed Stuy, Williamsburg, and Bushwick-- allowing for easy walking exploration and a quick commute to Downtown Manhattan.

There are fantastic views of the Empire State Building from the guest room. The bed is very comfortable!

The kitchen is fully equipped— stove, fridge, dishwasher, toaster oven, french press, pans, utensils, spices, olive oil, tea & coffee. You are welcome to use all of this! (Please note I do not have a microwave.)

The shower is nice and warm with good water pressure.

Laundry is conveniently located in the basement.

The building allows rooftop access if you would like to check out the view and enjoy the fresh air.

I am well-located in Brooklyn near the Broadway Triangle with easy access to Williamsburg, Bushwick, Greenpoint, Bed Stuy, Clinton Hill, the Lower East Side and other parts of Manhattan.

5-10 min walk to: Winona's, Marcy & Myrtle Cafe, Bushwick Grind Cafe, Sally's Restaurant, Starbucks, Chipotle, Supermarkets, Gentle Perch Korean, Bagelnaitor, Walgreens Pharmacy, Mirakuya Sushi, Milly's Pizza

10-15 min walk to: Win Son Taiwanese, Bushwick Open Studios, Koda, Burly Coffee, SKYTOWN and more.

20 min walk to: Roberta's Pizza, Saraghina, Momo Sushi Shack, Bossa Nova Social Club, Lone Wolf, Happyfun Hideaway, and more.

We welcome all guests but
if at all you are not feeling well, it is recommend that you visit a health center. Wear gloves and face masks and please kindly adhere to the covid 10 social distancing, wash hands frequently and please remember that there will be at least 3 other people in the house.

Entire home

Self check-in

Great check-in experience
90% of recent guests gave the check-in process a 5-star rating.
Located on the 3rd fl, Suite C is a spacious corner studio with windows facing both North & West. The private bathroom has a claw foot bathtub. Although there's no cooking, there is a fridge, microwave, coffee maker and a sink.
Situated in Crown Heights, we're walking distance to many restaurants and pubs, museums, parks and libraries. We're also convenient to 4 bus lines and 2 subway systems, midtown Manhattan is just 30 minutes away. There's even a local stop for the Long Island Railroad!


Studio C is a favorite for many, with its high ceilings and shiny hardwood floors. 4 windows face 2 directions and allow a generous amount of natural light. The original bathroom features a claw foot tub and marble sink.
For your convenience there's a work station where you can plug in your devices to catch up on some work, or just gaze out the window to a western view.
This spacious studio can be adjoined with the adjacent studio, via an interior doorway, to accommodate parties up to 4 guests. Each studio has its own private entrance, bathroom, and kitchen. See "Comfy, Cozy Studio at the Grand Old Mansion".

owner_details:
['Lovely Micro Studio in Murray Hill NYC
4.44
(39 reviews)
·
New York, United States
Share
Save
Show all photos
Entire rental unit hosted by Ignacio
2 guests · Studio · 1 bed · 1 bath
Entire home
You’ll have the apartment to yourself.
Location, location, location! Live like a local at this cozy studio apartment. Located inside a historic NYC brownstone nestled in one of Manhattan's greatest neighborhoods, Murray Hill. The apartments are small but well designed to maximize the usage of the space. The units re equipped with a private bathroom, comfortable bed, Cable TV, a work space, a fully loaded micro-kitchen, and some closet space. It is the perfect place for a single guest looking for full privacy.


Our studios offers our guests the perfect solution to all of New York City's lodging hassles... Price, location, & privacy. With us you can have your own place, in a Manhattan's upscale and central location, at an affordable price!

The Apartments
The units are small (which NYC apartment isn't right?) but well equipped with all the amenities needed for a comfortable long stay. The Micro-Kitchen may be tiny but it is fully loaded to bring the inner chef out of you. The comfortable bed will guarantee a good night sleep after a long day out on the city. We provide free Wi-Fi and basic cable TV for you to stay connected with the outside world and the private bathroom has an eclectic feel to it and will provide full privacy to feel comfortable with added open closet space to keep you organized.

The building
Our unit is located in a beautiful 1930's historic building that will provide you with a true New York experience. So please keep in mind that this classic building, which is a better word for older, is well maintained but lacks certain amenities that became more popular years after its creation. The Building has an elevator and stairs so you can choose whether to get some extra exercise or not.

The Neighborhood
One of the best features of our studio is its location. Step out of the door and enjoy the beautiful tree-lined streets of Murray Hill. With plenty of cute cafes, restaurants, bars, and local shops to suit any needs you may have. This upscale but young and hip neighborhood puts you within walking distance of pretty much anywhere you may need to be, or at most a fast subway trip away from it.

***PLEASE READ DETAILS BELOW BEFORE BOOKING!!***

Location! Location! Location!

Immerse yourself into the heart of Manhattan like no other. Located in Midtown, it is the most STRATEGIC location to be in to get to the majority of tourist destinations in less than 30 minutes via subway/bus.

Walking distance to:
Time Square - 15 mins walk
Empire State Building - 8 mins
Madison Square Garden -5 mins
Flatiron Building - 9 mins
Koreatown - 5 mins


It's a 2 bedroom apartment. Maximum capacity of 2 guests in each room.

*Bunk bed in the living room is also advertised, so there might be a guest staying in the common area during your reservation.
You'll be sharing this space with other Airbnb guests both male and female.

*Located on a 3rd FLOOR walk-up, NO ELEVATOR

*Since it's centrally located there's a POTENTIAL FOR NOISE but EARPLUGS ARE PROVIDED. Not recommended for light sleepers

*Guests/outsiders NOT in the reservation are not allowed to enter the apartment (camera in the living room for everyone's safety)

*It has a kitchenette that includes a refrigerator, portable stove, microwave, toaster, dishes, pots and silverware.

listing_name: ['1 Bedroom in convenient Chinatown / Little Italy!']
listing_type: ['Entire rental unit hosted by Annique\n2 guests · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1 bath']
review:
['Chris
October 2021
Annique’s place is great. Located right in the middle of Old Chinatown and Little Italy just a couple blocks away, it’s an exciting place to visit. There are many wonderful restaurants and stores just steps away as well as street vendors selling fresh produce during the day. Nights were quiet. A women in my 60s, I travel alone and I never felt unsafe in this neighborhood or apartment. The apartment is small, but I was in New York to do things in the City not to laze around a big luxurious apartment. The subway is just a few blocks away and the walk to it, past the fish markets and street vendors was fun.
Show more', 'Luke
October 2021
Right in the heart of Chinatown great location', 'Diego
September 2021
This place is place is very nice and would recommend to anyone staying in the area. It’s location is perfect as there is plenty of activities to do close by as well as being a close walk to any of the stations. Being next to Little Italy was a huge plus also as it added to the food and evening activities that were available. I would definitely stay again and would recommend this place to anyone. The host is attentive and communication was perfect.
Show more', "Anuraag
September 2021
Great value and great location. Don't hesitate to book!", 'Noah
September 2021
My gf and I stayed here and it was everything we could have asked for. Location was great in the heart of Chinatown which is very busy early in the day but fairly calm (by NY standards) at night so when we went to sleep it was very quiet. Little Italy was nearby which was a party every night with amazing food. We even walked to Central Park and back to Annique’s place but that was a little ambitious, there are subways located nearby. Paul waited up for us to let us in even though we got in late. We had our own key to the building AND apartment so we felt safe leaving our stuff. I would definitely stay here again! Thanks Annique and Paul!
Show more', 'Robert
September 2021
Very clean, great value, and excellent location in China Town.']

This place is place is very nice and would recommend to anyone staying in the area. It’s location is perfect as there is plenty of activities to do close by as well as being a close walk to any of the stations. Being next to Little Italy was a huge plus also as it added to the food and evening activities that were available. I would definitely stay again and would recommend this place to anyone. The host is attentive and communication was perfect.

Noah
September 2021
My gf and I stayed here and it was everything we could have asked for. Location was great in the heart of Chinatown which is very busy early in the day but fairly calm (by NY standards) at night so when we went to sleep it was very quiet. Little Italy was nearby which was a party every night with amazing food. We even walked to Central Park and back to Annique’s place but that was a little ambitious, there are subways located nearby. Paul waited up for us to let us in even though we got in late. We had our own key to the building AND apartment so we felt safe leaving our stuff. I would definitely stay here again! Thanks Annique and Paul!

The subway is just a few blocks away and the walk to it, past the fish markets and street vendors was fun.

review:

Great location, beautiful building, amazing management! Definitely recommend!', 'Julio
July 2020
Exceptional, convenient and safe...', "Douglas
March 2020
I enjoyed my time at Jeniffer's place. It is exactly as marketed. The location was very nice. It was close to lots of restaurants and grocery stores. I only had two issues. First, I found that the apartment got very cold very quickly. I did not find that the windows provided any insulation whatsoever. This meant that I had to turn on my heater a lot (and the utilities are not included in the price but separate). Next, the keypad to get into the apartment itself sticks and can be a real pain. For me, this was frustrating after long days of work when I just wanted to get back home but had to stand at my door in the hallway typing in a very long code that I would have to re-enter because the key pad would stick.

Apart from these two issues, I think this is a nice place if you are visiting NYC alone and for short stays. I think the space would feel cramped for a couple spending more than one week in NYC. Overall, I would recommend this place--especially for the location.
Show more", 'Spencer

The host canceled this reservation 8 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.', 'Crystal

I highly recommend this location for anyone looking for a great place to stay in NYC. The apartment I stayed in was pristine, had all of the amenities you’d want, lovely furnishing and a large bathroom (with a tub) which is a rarity in the city! There are tons of great restaurants, shops and public transportation are all close by!
Show more']

Great looking furnished studio in Midtown Area . Fully Furnished

The space
Great looking studio in a brand new building in Midtown West. Terrific location! Tons of fun stuff to do right outside your door.

The building has a modern lobby, high speed elevator, laundry facilities and a mind blowing furnished roof deck with views of all of Midtown and the Hudson River.

This beautiful studio has a full-sized kitchen and a nice sized living area.

Kitchen comes equipped with pots, pans, serving ware, flatware, cooking utensils, etc. Bathroom comes with towels.

This unit is fully furnished with everything you will need to feel right at home. Fine linens on the bed and high end modern touches throughout. Large windows with tons of light.

Douglas
March 2020
I enjoyed my time at Jeniffer's place. It is exactly as marketed. The location was very nice. It was close to lots of restaurants and grocery stores. I only had two issues. First, I found that the apartment got very cold very quickly. I did not find that the windows provided any insulation whatsoever. This meant that I had to turn on my heater a lot (and the utilities are not included in the price but separate). Next, the keypad to get into the apartment itself sticks and can be a real pain. For me, this was frustrating after long days of work when I just wanted to get back home but had to stand at my door in the hallway typing in a very long code that I would have to re-enter because the key pad would stick.

Apart from these two issues, I think this is a nice place if you are visiting NYC alone and for short stays. I think the space would feel cramped for a couple spending more than one week in NYC. Overall, I would recommend this place--especially for the location.

review:
['Harry
July 2021
It’s a non-elevator, non-wheelchair accessible property. If you’re not fit enough for going up several flights of stairs, ask which floor will you stay. The studios are an unbeatable value, and I wholly recommend them for long stays in the city.
Show more', 'Gokhan
May 2021
Nice', 'Pedro
September 2021
Excellent location, extremely close to subway B and C lines and the Central Park. Room much larger than I imagined it would be. Mandatory cleaning is a plus for those who do not stay in the room but can be a downside for those working at the room. Also, and this is very important, it should definitely be informed in the announcement that it is located in the 5th floor and that the building does not have elevator. We had 6 pieces of luggage and it was terrible to take it up and down stairs. I cannot even imagine how terrible it would be dor somebody with disabilities. Finally, one of the bathroom photos in the announcement does not belong to this room. Gabriel is a very good host by the way, very easygoing.
Show more']

Come experience unmatched luxury and hospitality at Aum. The space was designed by an award winning ex-WeWork interior designer with focus on holistic living which includes memory foam mattress bed, ergonomically designed workspace, Smart TV, high speed internet, fully loaded kitchen, free breakfast, lavish shared bathroom, 2 minutes from subway and steps away from riverside park and Hudson river.


Relax:

· Highest Quality Memory foam mattress

· Finest cotton linens, plush pillows, and blankets to ensure you sleep like a baby. We also provide complimentary ear plugs to keep out New York City noise

Work:

· AumWorkspace designed workspace which includes top of the line ergonomic chair, spacious table with storage, naturally elements such as paintings and plants to make the space lively and spark creativity

· Ultra-high-speed optical fiber internet

Play:

· Big Screen Smart TV with optimal placement in the room for effortless binge watching from the comfort of your bed

· FREE continental breakfast, tea and coffee

Communal:

· Well equipped kitchen with spacious dinning space. All essential utensils, spices, oils, etc. available for free if you wish to cook.

· Fully renovated restroom with high pressure shower, wooden toilet seat for temperature control, hair dryer

· Complimentary organic shampoo, conditioner, and body wash

· Washer and dryer in the basement of the building (charges apply)

Extras:

· Large closet in the room to store your luggage, belongings and more, leaving the room space free of clutter

· Body length mirror to make sure you check out your outfit and get ready to vow New York City

Sunny, clean, and cozy apt in the heart of Lower East Side. 6 min walk to Delancey-Essex station. Close to East Village, Chinatown and Soho. Easy access to most of NYC's tourist attractions including Brooklyn. Surrounded by nice affordable restaurants, cafes, and bars. 3rd floor walk up. Recently painted walls and bathtub. Street facing windows. Queen size bed with 13 inch mattresses, Air condition, steam/electric heater, free WiFi and Netflix.


Clean linens and towels, HD TV, humidifier, electric heater, vanity mirror, hangers, cooking tools, dishes, refrigerator, oven toaster, micro wave, electric kettle, rice cooker, coffee maker, free coffee beans, free tea bags, soaps, shampoos, and conditioners are all provided. There is a closet in your bed room where you can store your suit cases and jackets. It also has two chests where you can store your clothes and other stuff. Clean bathtub for bathing lovers.

Grace
November 2021
Awesome place!
Alex
October 2021
The place is beautifully decorated and as advertised: a gem. This really is a great place to stay for a couple people. Location is great. 5/5 would definitely stay again.
Anne Therese
October 2021
Takeshi was a very accommodating host! We would highly recommend. He’s very hospitable and always checks if we needed something. He even let us leave our luggage to a later time because our flight was not until 6:30pm. :) Also, the aesthetics of the room (and bathroom as well) are on point, very minimalist style (which I love!). Plus, he has complete amenities and a back massager that really soothed my sore body after a long day of walking in NYC. The location is near the Delancey Subway station which is a plus as well! Would come back here definitely. :)
Show more
Davina
October 2021
My husband and I stayed at Takeshi's place this past weekend for his 50th birthday surprise! In the past visits, we have only stayed at hotels in Midtown. Venturing out and staying in the Lower East Side was a great way to experience the city like a local. I will say that there are some homeless folks right outside the front stoop and they do congregate on the sidewalk. I don't recommend venturing out alone at night, but if you have someone with you it will be fine. As far at the accommodations, they were really fantastic! The place was extremely clean and well appointed with essentials. There was even fresh creamer in the fridge for coffee! The bed is VERY comfortable too. Takeshi is probably the easiest host I have ever worked with for Airbnb or (Hidden by Airbnb) . I would highly recommend this place to anyone and next time we go to NYC will most definitely stay at Takeshis!
Show more
Toby
October 2021
Takeshi’s place was exactly what we were looking for! When visiting New York, you don’t intend to spend much time at the apartment, but he has really made great use of the space for when you are there. The subway is within walking distance, but it’s far enough away from the hustle and bustle to feel like you’ve gotten away from the noise. If you’re looking for a cheap place to stay that is easy to commute to and from, this is the place for you.
Show more
Stephanie
October 2021
This is my second time staying with Takeshi and it was just as wonderful as the first time! Super flexible, easy to get to and close to the train. I can’t wait to stay again.

listing_name: ['Central Park Nest, High Above The Trees!']
listing_type: ['Entire rental unit hosted by Stuart & Joel\n2 guests · Studio · 1 bed · 1 bath']
review:
['Paige
October 2021
Perfect from start to finish. Stuart had great communication from start to finish and the place was just as advertised. The view is fabulous. If you’re lucky like me you’ll wake up to a rainbow over the park. ❤️ I’ve already booked my next trip. Subway and bus are super convenient. Loved it.
Show more', "Anahid
October 2021
Stuart & Joel's apartment is an art lovers dream come true! The paintings, and how they are very carefully displayed makes it so satisfying to look at, but nothing beats the view! The view is AMAZING! They made checking in and checking out so effortless. Their communication is amazing, my husband and I truly appreciated the suggestions and how they went above and beyond to make sure that we were comfortable. We hope to be back one day.
Show more", 'Emma
October 2021
Amazing place with amazing views! The artwork makes it feel cozy. Will definitely be back here if I come to NYC again! Sunrise and sunset views are to die for!', 'Terri
October 2021
Even better than we were expecting! Fabulous view and the apartment itself was beautifully decorated. We felt like we were living in an art gallery. Great communication for check-in and checkout. Highly recommend! We hope to be back on our next trip to NYC.
Show more', 'Valerie
September 2021
Just a wonderful, beautiful place in a prime location with a gorgeous view of Central Park and walking distance to the subway. This place actually looks like a mini gallery! One of the best views we have ever had before in any places we’ve ever stayed! The hosts were very nice and communicative throughout our stay. The only suggestion I would have is to bring ear plugs, most nights are quiet, nice and peaceful but weekends obviously tend to be more eventful in the city that never sleeps. Accommodations were wonderful, access to the apartment was nice and easy, the hosts generously provide coffee (Keurig), access to water (Brita), a lovely bottle of champagne (yum!), shampoo, conditioner, hand sanitizer, etc. Highly recommend this place, we would come back in a heartbeat! Book your trip! Thank you for making our NYC trip memorable in this beautiful place!
Show more', 'Brennan
September 2021
Stayed with my partner for a couple of days and wish it could have been longer. The place is covered in intriguing art, the view is spectacular, and Stuart and Joel are incredible, communicative hosts. Hope to be back soon.
Show more']

Anahid
October 2021
Stuart & Joel's apartment is an art lovers dream come true! The paintings, and how they are very carefully displayed makes it so satisfying to look at, but nothing beats the view! October 2021
Amazing place with amazing views! The artwork makes it feel cozy. Will definitely be back here if I come to NYC again! Sunrise and sunset views are to die for!

October 2021
Even better than we were expecting! Fabulous view and the apartment itself was beautifully decorated. We felt like we were living in an art gallery. Great communication for check-in and checkout. Highly recommend! We hope to be back on our next trip to NYC.
Show more
Valerie
September 2021
Just a wonderful, beautiful place in a prime location with a gorgeous view of Central Park and walking distance to the subway. This place actually looks like a mini gallery! One of the best views we have ever had before in any places we’ve ever stayed! The hosts were very nice and communicative throughout our stay. The only suggestion I would have is to bring ear plugs, most nights are quiet, nice and peaceful but weekends obviously tend to be more eventful in the city that never sleeps. Accommodations were wonderful, access to the apartment was nice and easy, the hosts generously provide coffee (Keurig), access to water (Brita), a lovely bottle of champagne (yum!), shampoo, conditioner, hand sanitizer, etc. Highly recommend this place, we would come back in a heartbeat! Book your trip! Thank you for making our NYC trip memorable in this beautiful place!

Brennan

owner_details:
["Sonder | Battery Park | Studio Apartment
4.65
(663 reviews)
·
New York, United States
Share
Save
Show all photos
Entire rental unit hosted by Sonder (NYC)
2 guests · Studio · 1 bed · 1 bath
Entire home
You’ll have the apartment to yourself.
Enhanced Clean
This Host committed to Airbnb's 5-step enhanced cleaning process. Show more
Self check-in
Check yourself in with the keypad.
Great location
95% of recent guests gave the location a 5-star rating.
Fill your New York City experience with color at Battery Park. See a different view of the ever-changing city in every direction at every season. Catch a glimpse of green to golden to white-covered trees amidst the shimmering skyscrapers of FiDi. From the midnight waters of the Hudson River to the aquamarine of the seasonal rooftop pool, this isn't the Big Apple — it's a feast for the eyes. Step from the terrace into the co-working space or either of the two lounges, where pops of sunflower, mint, and blood orange glass are grounded by warm wooden fittings. Work up a sweat on your very own Peloton bike in our select apartments or with free access to New York Sports Clubs FiDi. Take a moment to rest and refresh in your colorfully accented space. And then venture out to sample the city offerings up close.


Working, relaxing, living. Our spaces have all the other essentials you need for your stay.

- Contact-free check-in
- 24/7 virtual support
- Super-fast WiFi
- Fresh towels and bathroom essentials
- Pre-cleaning before your arrival
- Fully equipped kitchen
- Chromecast and HDMI cord for streaming
- Daily garage parking nearby
- Co-working space
- 2 lounge spaces
- Rooftop terrace with views
- Free access to nearby gym
- Seasonal rooftop pool


- 5 minute walk to Antica Ristorante (tableside preparations of classic Italian dishes)
- 8 minute walk to The Dead Rabbit (Redbreast 12, neat, at this iconic Irish bar)
- 10 minute subway to Takahachi Bakery (try the matcha crepe, thank us later)
- 10 minute walk to One World Trade Center (stunning 360-degree views from the observation deck)

We have multiple spaces at this property, each designed to give you a beautiful place to stay — while our style is consistent, the view, layout, and design may vary.

Sitting along the East River, flaunting sleek high-rises juxtaposed with narrow cobbled streets, the Financial District is one of New York City's most historic areas. Home to bustling Wall Street, the neighborhood is more than just the city's financial hub and boasts iconic monuments as well as stunning architectural examples of the Art Deco and Gilded Age eras. Catch a ferry from The Battery for stunning views of local landmarks like the Statue of Liberty and the Brooklyn Bridge. For a taste of local life, have a cozy coffee at a sidewalk cafe, dip into a dive bar on Stone Street, or delight in the gourmet offerings at one of FiDi's many renowned restaurants.
