['Eric
November 2021
Great value for Manhattan - hosts are very nice, the place is clean and comfy, and the location is very central. Would definitely return!', 'Jacqueline
October 2021
The hosts were awesome! We had everything we needed and they were super easy to communicate with and very willing to help us with everything! Best option for the price and location!
Show more', "Annemarie
October 2021
This is a great Airbnb I would definitely stay in again! The location for the price is excellent - it's walking distance from major sights, the metro and bus stops. I'm especially glad for Diego, who made the process from preparing to arrive, checking in, my stay, and my departure so easy. It was a huge help to be able to have my bags at the apartment even before my official check in time or after I checked out, for those few hours between travel and my Airbnb stay. With it's central location, like any central NYC Airbnb, just expect less square footage and minor street noise - but it was above and beyond what I was expecting, and would recommend it to others!
Show more", 'Jonathan
October 2021
First the good: Very basic accommodation. Good neighborhood, well to the heart of the action in NYC. Easy to access, and certainly not expensive by NY standards.
What needs improvement: the pictures in the listing don’t reflect the actual conditions. The apartment/ room were the dirtiest I have been in, and the includes a former sheep barn in Iceland. The floors were filthy. The walls need a good cleaning at least, and could probably benefit from a coat of paint.
We found black hair in the bed, indicating that the comforter/duvet had not been laundered . We took it on faith that the sheets had been changed.
The pillows were sad and worn to the point of being so thin I needed three to sleep on. The refrigerator was not cleaned, and smelled badly.
I offer this review not to be overly critical, but to point out the exact shortcomings and disappointments we noticed. If you are looking for a cheap room, without a lot of expectation, this may be good for you. I expect that the places I stay will at least be clean, and match or exceed the photos and description as they appear on the site. We enjoyed our stay despite the shortcomings, but we are also very pleased to go on to our next BnB and find it much closer to our expectations.
Show more', 'Alanna
September 2021
Great location, great price and zaamen was very nice and hospitable!! Will definitely be back.', 'Rei
August 2021
Place is a bit smaller than it looks, not as new and clean as the pictures, but it is a very good location to get around the city. There is a train station only a few minutes away.
Show more']

This cozy queen size private bedroom has a true city feeling, only a few minutes walk to the Empire State Building! The apartment is right in the heart of Manhattan, near Grand Central, Korea Town, Murray Hill, Madison Square Park and much more. (PLEASE read the entire description of the place before messaging host)


This is a private room in a shared apartment. The apartment is in the center of New York City, near the subway station and near the empire state, lots of restaurants and shops around. The building has a lovely rooftop space in which you can go to relax with a view of the famous Chrysler Building. Two people per room, but if there's more than two then I can offer sleeping bags ($30 per extra person), the room may be big enough to fit more; or they can sleep in the living room if needed. I also rent other extra rooms on this platform, same apartment. (Check my profile for a link in case you need to bring an extra friend).

This is a great Airbnb I would definitely stay in again! The location for the price is excellent - it's walking distance from major sights, the metro and bus stops. I'm especially glad for Diego, who made the process from preparing to arrive, checking in, my stay, and my departure so easy. With it's central location, like any central NYC Airbnb, just expect less square footage and minor street noise - but it was above and beyond what I was expecting, and would recommend it to others!
Show more
Jonathan
October 2021
First the good: Very basic accommodation. Good neighborhood, well to the heart of the action in NYC. Easy to access, and certainly not expensive by NY standards.
What needs improvement: the pictures in the listing don’t reflect the actual conditions. The apartment/ room were the dirtiest I have been in, and the includes a former sheep barn in Iceland. The floors were filthy. The walls need a good cleaning at least, and could probably benefit from a coat of paint.
We found black hair in the bed, indicating that the comforter/duvet had not been laundered . We took it on faith that the sheets had been changed.
The pillows were sad and worn to the point of being so thin I needed three to sleep on. The refrigerator was not cleaned, and smelled badly.
I offer this review not to be overly critical, but to point out the exact shortcomings and disappointments we noticed. If you are looking for a cheap room, without a lot of expectation, this may be good for you. I expect that the places I stay will at least be clean, and match or exceed the photos and description as they appear on the site. We enjoyed our stay despite the shortcomings, but we are also very pleased to go on to our next BnB and find it much closer to our expectations.

This room is intriguing, spacious, warm, characteristic with lots of sunlight, & an enriching design. It's a newly renovated bedroom with a European classic house. Open to everyone!!!

☆☆KEYNOTES:
1) Room is affordable to stay in (discount included).
2) Autumn season begins and there is a Fan in the room.
3) You will be sharing the bathroom with 2 other guests.
4) You have access to a living room & kitchenette.


THE AREA:
This town is in a humble, safe, families oriented area with lots of ventures. It has a historic vintage feeling, movies like "Taxi Driver" (Robert Dinero) and "Do the right thing" (Spike Lee), homes of celebrities too. There are Bars, Pubs, Cafes, and restaurants within a short distance.

TRANSPORTATION:
This place is located on the A and C train line, in Bedstuy/Clinton Hills. There are Bars, Pubs, Cafes, and restaurants within a short distance. 15mins max to the City and safer to walk around any time.

The house is huge, a vintage classic in a private lot. There are 5 people currently living there now, and you will be the 6th person. There are 3 bathrooms, 1 kitchen, 2 dining tables in a huge dining room and 1 living room. The front yard hangs out with benches outside and backyard shades space.

Room Details:
- room is located on the 2nd floor.
- Perfect for 1 person (only).
- 3 windows.
- Clean, tidy with wooden floors
- Wifi, heat supply with hot water (based on weather).
- Plenty of sheets, towels, blankets, pillows

Come experience unmatched luxury and hospitality at Aum. The space was designed by an award winning ex-WeWork interior designer with focus on holistic living which includes memory foam mattress bed, ergonomically designed workspace, Smart TV, high speed internet, fully loaded kitchen, free breakfast, lavish shared bathroom, 2 minutes from subway and steps away from riverside park and Hudson river.


Relax:

· Highest Quality Memory foam mattress

· Finest cotton linens, plush pillows, and blankets to ensure you sleep like a baby. We also provide complimentary ear plugs to keep out New York City noise

Work:

· AumWorkspace designed workspace which includes top of the line ergonomic chair, spacious table with storage, naturally elements such as paintings and plants to make the space lively and spark creativity

· Ultra-high-speed optical fiber internet

Play:

· Big Screen Smart TV with optimal placement in the room for effortless binge watching from the comfort of your bed

· FREE continental breakfast, tea and coffee

Communal:

· Well equipped kitchen with spacious dinning space. All essential utensils, spices, oils, etc. available for free if you wish to cook.

· Fully renovated restroom with high pressure shower, wooden toilet seat for temperature control, hair dryer

· Complimentary organic shampoo, conditioner, and body wash

· Washer and dryer in the basement of the building (charges apply)

Extras:

· Large closet in the room to store your luggage, belongings and more, leaving the room space free of clutter

· Body length mirror to make sure you check out your outfit and get ready to vow New York City

You'll love this spacious studio with high ceilings and hardwood floors, located in Crown Heights Brooklyn. Convenient to 4 bus routes and 2 subway lines, putting downtown Brooklyn and midtown Manhattan minutes away. There's even a local stop on the Long Island Railroad a few blocks away. Many new restaurants, pubs and shopping are just 1 block away. There are 3 museums, libraries, parks and the post office, all within walking distance.
We welcome the opportunity to invite you to our home.


The space is a completely private studio apartment comes with its own private entrance, full bathroom with a shower and a full kitchen.
The ceilings are 11 ft high, 4 windows providing plenty of natural light, and shiny hardwood floors. Cable tv and powerful WiFi are also included for your convenience. There is also a work area where you can plug in your favorite devices.
This spacious studio can also be adjoined with the adjacent studio, via an interior doorway, to accommodate parties up to 4 guests. See: "Air B and B at the Grand Old Mansion".

Elaine
October 2021
William is a great host! He was quick to respond and was kind enough to let me drop off my luggage and even check in earlier than the listed time. The lodging itself is in a great location - less than a 10 minute walk to the nearest subway station, many food options and stores nearby, and it's not too noisy. The lodging itself is in an older building (which I enjoyed for its personality) so expect there to be some creaking and not everything to be in perfect condition. The kitchen has some cookware/cutlery/dinnerware, which is really nice to be able to make some simple meals. The bedding was quite comfortable and the bathroom had what I needed (towels, bar soap). I will definitely stay here the next time I'm in the neighborhood.

Where you’ll be
Brooklyn, New York, United States
You'll love walking around Crown Heights and taking in some of the diverse architecture: churches, homes, schools and other buildings that date back well over a century.
Prospect Park (and zoo), The Brooklyn Botanical Gardens, The Brooklyn Museum, The Children's Museum, the Jewish Children's Museum, and Cony Island are only a few of the attractions Brooklyn has to offer. Like to eat? Brooklyn has restaurants from around the world!
The house is conveniently located within walking distance to 2 major subway lines and 4 bus routes. We even have a local stop on the Long Island Railroad just a few blocks away. Our post office is also just minutes away.

review:
['Seongju
October 2021
Neida is amazing. She is kind and the place was clean and neat.', 'Brandi
October 2021
Great location from the subway and all around nice place to stay. Nedia is very nice and her place is very clean and comfy.', 'Jed
September 2021
Great spot! Very clean and comfortable', "Dahir
September 2021
Loved the place, such a great hostess. If I'm ever back there, I would definitely stay there.", 'John
September 2021
When I arrived late in the evening, drenched by Ida, I was met by an unmasked host who told me, in the course of casual conversation, that she had not been vaccinated. This led me, during my three night stay, to isolate myself in my room as much as possible. The room itself is barren, furnished only with a bed and a tiny night stand, with the floor the only place for a suitcase. The internet service is very flaky, and the neighbors on the other side of the wall are noisy. I was simply too busy to look for another place, but I never would have stayed here if I had known about the vaccination situation.

I would hope Airbnb would have a policy requiring vaccination for resident hosts, as well as for guests..
Show more', 'Kenice
August 2021
Neida’s place was absolutely divine! So cozy, comfortable, and the perfect place for a quick getaway to the city to visit friends. I absolutely love the neighborhood, and if it’s your first time to NYC, it’s the perfect place to find delicious eats!

Neida herself is an absolute gem, and if you get to chat with her during your stay, I’m sure your conversations will make your stay even better!

Thank you again, Neida!
Show more']

John
September 2021
When I arrived late in the evening, drenched by Ida, I was met by an unmasked host who told me, in the course of casual conversation, that she had not been vaccinated. This led me, during my three night stay, to isolate myself in my room as much as possible. The room itself is barren, furnished only with a bed and a tiny night stand, with the floor the only place for a suitcase. The internet service is very flaky, and the neighbors on the other side of the wall are noisy. I was simply too busy to look for another place, but I never would have stayed here if I had known about the vaccination situation.

I would hope Airbnb would have a policy requiring vaccination for resident hosts, as well as for guests..
Show more
Kenice
August 2021
Neida’s place was absolutely divine! So cozy, comfortable, and the perfect place for a quick getaway to the city to visit friends. I absolutely love the neighborhood, and if it’s your first time to NYC, it’s the perfect place to find delicious eats!

Neida herself is an absolute gem, and if you get to chat with her during your stay, I’m sure your conversations will make your stay even better!

Thank you again, Neida!
Show more
Show all 186 reviews
Where you’ll be
New York, United States
Hamilton Heights is where Columbia University is building its new campus in west Harlem...with many students and workers at all hours, it is a very safe neighborhood.
The architecture is century-old brownstone and brick townhouses, with limestone five and sixth story buildings.
There are wonderful neighborhood restaurants like Bono Trattoria and the Grange Bar & Grill. Great coffee shops like The Chipped Cup & Hamilton Bakery, with fresh baked pastries and breads.
For the young & drunk, Harlem Public, the Honeywell and Uptown Bourbon are our faves.

review:
['Stacy
January 2021
Fantastic place for the location/ budget!', 'Maria
November 2020
Great host', 'Maria
August 2020
Very nice', 'George
May 2020
The place qualifies as underwhelming, and a disappointment for the price, which is a bit ludicrous for what you get. I’ve had a place almost double the size on the LES — with more accoutrements — for the same monthly fees, if not a tad less.

The neighborhood is nice; the location is very convenient. Rooftop is lovey for a coffee in the morning. Close to the subway and Whole Foods. Walk to Trader Joe’s a nice bit of exercise on a weekend.

But, it was quite dirty when I arrived. Dust everywhere, and even an old blouse covered in hair left by a previous tenant.

The shower curtain rod is held up by a piece of paper slipped between the bar and the wall. It fell once and cut my foot while I was standing next to the toilet.

Somehow my electricity bills for the first and second month were basically identical, despite the fact I arrived 8 days late. Did they even read the meter? That’s on top of it bring a bit insulting to even ask you to cover electricity given the price they ask you for what you get

The only plugs in the kitchen are located behind the faucet, and directly behind the gas stove. So, essentially useless for anything while one is cooking. Cupboards were covered in grease from a previous tenants cooking habits, and some sort of adhesive I couldn’t remove even with an hours scrubbing with a new sponge and hot water.

Listing says “basic kitchen essentials,” though they left no soap (nor salt, pepper, oil etc), even in the middle of the covid pandemic.

Closet smelled like cat litter, and the shelves were so dirty they left smudges on shirts. I could go on, but you get the idea.

Overall, though the location was perfect, you can find a much nicer place for the same ask.
Show more', "Bill
March 2020
The apartment is on such a great block in the heart of Hell's Kitchen with incredible window views of midtown Manhattan and a beautiful rooftop! I highly recommend this place.
Show more", 'Lindsay
January 2020
I stayed here for about 40 days, as I transitioned into my new job, in a new state, and then my permanent lease. This was a great location and stay for my start here. Close walk to subway stations, all the food options right on 9th you can imagine. Very quick in response to any questions from host. Great stay!
Show more']

The place qualifies as underwhelming, and a disappointment for the price, which is a bit ludicrous for what you get. I’ve had a place almost double the size on the LES — with more accoutrements — for the same monthly fees, if not a tad less.

The neighborhood is nice; the location is very convenient. Rooftop is lovey for a coffee in the morning. Close to the subway and Whole Foods. Walk to Trader Joe’s a nice bit of exercise on a weekend.

But, it was quite dirty when I arrived. Dust everywhere, and even an old blouse covered in hair left by a previous tenant.

The shower curtain rod is held up by a piece of paper slipped between the bar and the wall. It fell once and cut my foot while I was standing next to the toilet.

Somehow my electricity bills for the first and second month were basically identical, despite the fact I arrived 8 days late. Did they even read the meter? That’s on top of it bring a bit insulting to even ask you to cover electricity given the price they ask you for what you get

The only plugs in the kitchen are located behind the faucet, and directly behind the gas stove. So, essentially useless for anything while one is cooking. If you're looking for an affordable place to stay in the Big Apple right in the center of Manhattan then welcome to my home! This cozy queen size private bedroom has a true city feeling, only a few minutes walk to the Empire State Building! The apartment is right in the heart of Manhattan, near Grand Central, Korea Town, Murray Hill, Madison Square Park and much more. (PLEASE kindly read the entire description of the place before messaging host)


This is a private room in a shared apartment. The apartment is in the center of New York City, near the subway station, bus stops, and near the empire state, lots of restaurants and shops around to explore and enjoy. Two people per room, but if there's more than two then I can offer sleeping bags ($30 per extra person), the room may be big enough to fit more; or they can sleep in the living room if needed. I also rent other extra rooms on this platform, same apartment. (Check my profile for a link in case you need to bring an extra friend).

review:
['Ben
October 2021
Good stay overall. Great location and clean comfortable room.

Be sure to read the fine print about how this place has **shared bathrooms/showers** though. I totally did not notice this when I originally booked and was a pretty surprised about this fact when I checked in.
Show more', 'Nora
August 2019
Great place. Rented for my 20 year old while on internship in nyc this summer. Place was as advertised. Safe and clean.', 'Yingzi
August 2018
The day before you check out, go to the front desk to confirm the time for the refund of cash deposit.', 'Elio
June 2018
The location is very neat. The staff are super friendly and helpful and are always ready to help. The hotel is not a big brand so they care about the comfort of their guests. The shared bathroom was almost always perfectly clean and neat with very rare exceptions but they were very minor like long hair in the shower and they happened like 3 times throughout my 5 week stay. The price is very acceptable though I had wished to have a refrigerator like I saw some guests have. Aside from that, it was very pleasant, very calm and excellent price for value in a very close distance to the busy city but also very calm place and safe to hang. Very much recommended!
Show more', "Diego
May 2018
I stayed at this hotel for 45 days

LOCATION: this is the best of this hotel, it is in a privileged location in Manhattan, close to two subway stations at 3 AV (take the L route) and 14 street- Union Square where you can go almost anywhere easily and fast.

ROOMS: I stayed in a double shared bathroom, the size is barely adequate, it is comfortable, my room had a small fridge where I could easily accommodate drinks and food, I found the bed comfortable, it also has a safe deposit box You can assign your own passwor without problem, also has a small sink for your personal cleanliness, Every week on Thursdays the cleaning staff performs cleaning, they change the sheets and towels as well as new soap and a small shampoo.
I was from the end of March to the middle of May, so I got a part of the winter. Each room has its own heater and in hot periods it also has its own air conditioning. It also has a small television and a desk with a chair to work on.

BATHROOM the rooms come without their own bathroom and at first I was not sure about this, but I must say that in 45 days I did not have a single problem with the bathrooms, I always found them available and neat, there are 4 bathrooms per floor, I also constantly saw staff of cleaning, checking and cleaning the bathrooms.

FOOD / HEATING FOOD: on the first floor next to the reception there is a microwave where you can easily heat food without problem, the sector is full of restaurants and supermarkets, I recommend joe's trader and whole food are cheap and sell everything.

BUILDING is an old building but it is well maintained and clean, the elevator is also something old but I never had problems with it.

SECURITY: the hotel is located in a very safe area, you can walk quietly through its streets, in the hotel there is always someone at the reception, the rooms have their own electronic key and as I mentioned a safe box in each room

STAFF: the staff was always very kind, from the moment of my arrival as well as during the entire stay, I want to thank especially Karim, who always helped me with any questions or needs. The staff also behaved very well when ordering something online and they received it without problem in the reception.

PRICE is not cheap, but I think that for all the above it's worth it, it has many benefits especially the location that ultimately helps you save a lot of time (and money) if you're going to move in Manhattan.

It was a very good experience with the hotel, it is for bookings of at least 30 days, it is the only thing that would change, but in general I am very happy and I recommend it 100%.
Show more"]

Ben
October 2021
Good stay overall. Great location and clean comfortable room.

Be sure to read the fine print about how this place has **shared bathrooms/showers** though. I totally did not notice this when I originally booked and was a pretty surprised about this fact when I checked in.
Show more
Nora
August 2019
Great place. Rented for my 20 year old while on internship in nyc this summer. Place was as advertised. Safe and clean.
Yingzi
August 2018
The day before you check out, go to the front desk to confirm the time for the refund of cash deposit.
Elio
June 2018
The location is very neat. The staff are super friendly and helpful and are always ready to help. The hotel is not a big brand so they care about the comfort of their guests. The shared bathroom was almost always perfectly clean and neat with very rare exceptions but they were very minor like long hair in the shower and they happened like 3 times throughout my 5 week stay. The price is very acceptable though I had wished to have a refrigerator like I saw some guests have. Aside from that, it was very pleasant, very calm and excellent price for value in a very close distance to the busy city but also very calm place and safe to hang. Very much recommended!
Show more
Diego
May 2018
I stayed at this hotel for 45 days

LOCATION: this is the best of this hotel, it is in a privileged location in Manhattan, close to two subway stations at 3 AV (take the L route) and 14 street- Union Square where you can go almost anywhere easily and fast.

ROOMS: I stayed in a double shared bathroom, the size is barely adequate, it is comfortable, my room had a small fridge where I could easily accommodate drinks and food, I found the bed comfortable, it also has a safe deposit box You can assign your own passwor without problem, also has a small sink for your personal cleanliness, Every week on Thursdays the cleaning staff performs cleaning, they change the sheets and towels as well as new soap and a small shampoo.
I was from the end of March to the middle of May, so I got a part of the winter. Each room has its own heater and in hot periods it also has its own air conditioning. It also has a small television and a desk with a chair to work on.

BATHROOM the rooms come without their own bathroom and at first I was not sure about this, but I must say that in 45 days I did not have a single problem with the bathrooms, I always found them available and neat, there are 4 bathrooms per floor, I also constantly saw staff of cleaning, checking and cleaning the bathrooms.

FOOD / HEATING FOOD: on the first floor next to the reception there is a microwave where you can easily heat food without problem, the sector is full of restaurants and supermarkets, I recommend joe's trader and whole food are cheap and sell everything.

BUILDING is an old building but it is well maintained and clean, the elevator is also something old but I never had problems with it.

SECURITY: the hotel is located in a very safe area, you can walk quietly through its streets, in the hotel there is always someone at the reception, the rooms have their own electronic key and as I mentioned a safe box in each room

STAFF: the staff was always very kind, from the moment of my arrival as well as during the entire stay, I want to thank especially Karim, who always helped me with any questions or needs. The staff also behaved very well when ordering something online and they received it without problem in the reception.

PRICE is not cheap, but I think that for all the above it's worth it, it has many benefits especially the location that ultimately helps you save a lot of time (and money) if you're going to move in Manhattan.

It was a very good experience with the hotel, it is for bookings of at least 30 days, it is the only thing that would change, but in general I am very happy and I recommend it 100%.

Come experience unmatched luxury and hospitality at Aum. The space was designed by an award winning ex-WeWork interior designer with focus on holistic living which includes memory foam mattress bed, ergonomically designed workspace, Smart TV, high speed internet, fully loaded kitchen, free breakfast, lavish shared bathroom, 2 minutes from subway and steps away from riverside park and Hudson river.


Relax:

· Highest Quality Memory foam mattress

· Finest cotton linens, plush pillows, and blankets to ensure you sleep like a baby. We also provide complimentary ear plugs to keep out New York City noise

Work:

· AumWorkspace designed workspace which includes top of the line ergonomic chair, spacious table with storage, naturally elements such as paintings and plants to make the space lively and spark creativity

· Ultra-high-speed optical fiber internet

Play:

· Big Screen Smart TV with optimal placement in the room for effortless binge watching from the comfort of your bed

· FREE continental breakfast, tea and coffee

Communal:

· Well equipped kitchen with spacious dinning space. All essential utensils, spices, oils, etc. available for free if you wish to cook.

· Fully renovated restroom with high pressure shower, wooden toilet seat for temperature control, hair dryer

· Complimentary organic shampoo, conditioner, and body wash

· Washer and dryer in the basement of the building (charges apply)

Extras:

· Large closet in the room to store your luggage, belongings and more, leaving the room space free of clutter

· Body length mirror to make sure you check out your outfit and get ready to vow New York City

review:
['Amy
October 2021
Excellent host and place. Edgar responds quickly and his place is easy to find, great location so close to the park. Keep in mind his note about construction - it really startled me the first morning right on the dot at 7am. If you’re planning on being out to start your day early this isn’t a problem but if you want to sleep in you won’t be able to.
Show more', "Laura
October 2021
Edgar was very responsive and helpful before and during our stay. He generously let us check out late, as our flight wasn't until 6pm. The apartment is immaculate and covered with Edgar's beautiful art work. Yes, there is construction noise next door, but not on Sat and Sunday... and not after 5. It really wasn't big deal.
The apt is very convenient to all flavors of food, grocery, subway, bus and drugstores. We give the highest recommendation possible!
Show more", 'Lori
September 2021
Edgar’s apt was great! I was concerned about the location, having never been to New York before, however it worked out great. It is one block away from the subway, so that was awesome. The apt was very clean, and Edgar was a great host. He went out of his way to help us out with some transportation things we needed to work out. He also came to the parking garage when we first arrived to help us with our luggage and take us to the apartment. The only drawback is that there is virtually no outside view, so if you want to see the light of day, you’ll need to go outside, which is where you spend most of the time in New York City anyway!
Show more', "Janet
September 2021
The apartment was super clean and comfortable. Great location, well stocked with all the necessities. Very responsive to our need to change our check-in time at the last minute. The noise was not such a big deal, mostly because it was pretty quiet over the weekend, but even week days were not so bad. The only reason for 4 stars and not 5 was beyond the host's control because with the construction, windows were closed and shades were drawn of necessity. Regardless, we still recommend the stay because everything else was outstanding.
Show more", 'Alexis
September 2021
Great location, loved the neighborhood and proximity to the park. The bedroom windows stayed dark, which was nice for naps! Felt clean and no bugs, the only thing was some of the surfaces had dirt when I wiped them down when we first arrived. But I would absolutely stay again and loved the location so much! Make sure to check out The Painted Lady tavern!!
Show more', 'Paul
August 2021
Great place! Excellent location (easy access to east side trains and walking distance to museums, etc.), clean, and well-appointed. There was great communication throughout our stay, and Edgar and Andre were even able to accommodate our luggage on our departure date. The construction noise wasn’t so bad—just a little here and there in the morning. Overall, this is a stellar place to stay, and I highly recommend it to single folks and couples visiting NYC!
Show more']

4.9', "Amy
October 2021
Excellent host and place. Edgar responds quickly and his place is easy to find, great location so close to the park. Keep in mind his note about construction - it really startled me the first morning right on the dot at 7am. If you’re planning on being out to start your day early this isn’t a problem but if you want to sleep in you won’t be able to.
Show more
Laura
October 2021
Edgar was very responsive and helpful before and during our stay. He generously let us check out late, as our flight wasn't until 6pm. The apartment is immaculate and covered with Edgar's beautiful art work. Yes, there is construction noise next door, but not on Sat and Sunday... and not after 5. It really wasn't big deal.
The apt is very convenient to all flavors of food, grocery, subway, bus and drugstores. We give the highest recommendation possible!
Show more
Lori
September 2021
Edgar’s apt was great! I was concerned about the location, having never been to New York before, however it worked out great. It is one block away from the subway, so that was awesome. The apt was very clean, and Edgar was a great host. He went out of his way to help us out with some transportation things we needed to work out. He also came to the parking garage when we first arrived to help us with our luggage and take us to the apartment. The only drawback is that there is virtually no outside view, so if you want to see the light of day, you’ll need to go outside, which is where you spend most of the time in New York City anyway!
Show more
Janet
September 2021
The apartment was super clean and comfortable. Great location, well stocked with all the necessities. Very responsive to our need to change our check-in time at the last minute. The noise was not such a big deal, mostly because it was pretty quiet over the weekend, but even week days were not so bad. The only reason for 4 stars and not 5 was beyond the host's control because with the construction, windows were closed and shades were drawn of necessity. Regardless, we still recommend the stay because everything else was outstanding.
Show more
Alexis
September 2021
Great location, loved the neighborhood and proximity to the park. The bedroom windows stayed dark, which was nice for naps! Felt clean and no bugs, the only thing was some of the surfaces had dirt when I wiped them down when we first arrived. But I would absolutely stay again and loved the location so much! Make sure to check out The Painted Lady tavern!!
Show more
Paul
August 2021
Great place! Excellent location (easy access to east side trains and walking distance to museums, etc.), clean, and well-appointed. There was great communication throughout our stay, and Edgar and Andre were even able to accommodate our luggage on our departure date. The construction noise wasn’t so bad—just a little here and there in the morning. Overall, this is a stellar place to stay, and I highly recommend it to single folks and couples visiting NYC!

Enhanced Clean

Self check-in
Check yourself in with the lockbox.
Great check-in experience
100% of recent guests gave the check-in process a 5-star rating.
Welcome to Brooklyn!
Great location! Short walking distance to buses and J, M, Z, L subway lines, 15 minutes to Manhattan. Located near supermarkets, restaurants, bars, public parks, vintage shops.
Private apartment with private entrance. Bedroom sleeps 2 guests, futon opens to sleep 2 more guests.
Amenities include: 2 Spacious closets, workspace, Wifi, Kitchenette, hot plate, microwave, full-size refrigerator, full bathroom, hair dryer.
As a host, we're available 24/7.


This Airbnb is located on the lower level of a small walk-up on a quiet tree-lined street in Bushwick.
Young families with babies, small children and dogs live on this block which makes for a friendly experience in the neighborhood.

Please observe House Rules:

*Please communicate
*Please fully read self check-in and check-out instructions so you have a smooth and pleasant stay
*Be respectful of the space
*Be mindful of noise after 11PM

Walking distances to Subway lines:
M train: 5 minute walk
J, Z trains: 7 minute walk
L train: 14 minute walk

Laundry service available by hosts for additional fee.

review:
["Nova
October 2021
We had a great one night! The part of NYC it's in is actually quieter than my apartment in So Cal, which was pleasantly surprising. It's also only a 4 min walk from the metro. The host is excellent at communicating. She was there when we arrived to let us in and left the keys in the room. No locks from the outside on the room doors, but she keeps an eye with apartment cameras to make sure it's always a safe place, and it feels like it is. I was stressed about parking, which is free on the street if you get lucky and can find a spot. The host was able to have her friend save our rental car a spot right outside the front door for $5. She also let us leave our stuff in the room and come back in the afternoon before our evening flight, which was super helpful. Wifi is good, rooms are very white and could use some artwork and color, but they certainly get the job done and are still comfortable spaces! Would definitely stay here again.

Nova

The host is excellent at communicating. She was there when we arrived to let us in and left the keys in the room. No locks from the outside on the room doors, but she keeps an eye with apartment cameras to make sure it's always a safe place, and it feels like it is. I was stressed about parking, which is free on the street if you get lucky and can find a spot. The host was able to have her friend save our rental car a spot right outside the front door for $5. She also let us leave our stuff in the room and come back in the afternoon before our evening flight, which was super helpful. Wifi is good, rooms are very white and could use some artwork and color, but they certainly get the job done and are still comfortable spaces! Would definitely stay here again.

Sunny, clean, and cozy apt in the heart of Lower East Side. 6 min walk to Delancey-Essex station. Close to East Village, Chinatown and Soho. Easy access to most of NYC's tourist attractions including Brooklyn. Surrounded by nice affordable restaurants, cafes, and bars. 3rd floor walk up. Recently painted walls and bathtub. Street facing windows. Queen size bed with 13 inch mattresses, Air condition, steam/electric heater, free WiFi and Netflix.


Clean linens and towels, HD TV, humidifier, electric heater, vanity mirror, hangers, cooking tools, dishes, refrigerator, oven toaster, micro wave, electric kettle, rice cooker, coffee maker, free coffee beans, free tea bags, soaps, shampoos, and conditioners are all provided. There is a closet in your bed room where you can store your suit cases and jackets. It also has two chests where you can store your clothes and other stuff. Clean bathtub for bathing lovers.

Grace
November 2021
Awesome place!
Alex
October 2021
The place is beautifully decorated and as advertised: a gem. This really is a great place to stay for a couple people. Location is great. 5/5 would definitely stay again.
Anne Therese
October 2021
Takeshi was a very accommodating host! We would highly recommend. He’s very hospitable and always checks if we needed something. He even let us leave our luggage to a later time because our flight was not until 6:30pm. :) Also, the aesthetics of the room (and bathroom as well) are on point, very minimalist style (which I love!). Plus, he has complete amenities and a back massager that really soothed my sore body after a long day of walking in NYC. The location is near the Delancey Subway station which is a plus as well! Would come back here definitely. :)
Show more
Davina
October 2021
My husband and I stayed at Takeshi's place this past weekend for his 50th birthday surprise! In the past visits, we have only stayed at hotels in Midtown. Venturing out and staying in the Lower East Side was a great way to experience the city like a local. I will say that there are some homeless folks right outside the front stoop and they do congregate on the sidewalk. I don't recommend venturing out alone at night, but if you have someone with you it will be fine. As far at the accommodations, they were really fantastic! The place was extremely clean and well appointed with essentials. There was even fresh creamer in the fridge for coffee! The bed is VERY comfortable too. Takeshi is probably the easiest host I have ever worked with for Airbnb or (Hidden by Airbnb) . I would highly recommend this place to anyone and next time we go to NYC will most definitely stay at Takeshis!
Show more
Toby
October 2021
Takeshi’s place was exactly what we were looking for! When visiting New York, you don’t intend to spend much time at the apartment, but he has really made great use of the space for when you are there. The subway is within walking distance, but it’s far enough away from the hustle and bustle to feel like you’ve gotten away from the noise. If you’re looking for a cheap place to stay that is easy to commute to and from, this is the place for you.
Show more
Stephanie
October 2021
This is my second time staying with Takeshi and it was just as wonderful as the first time! Super flexible, easy to get to and close to the train. I can’t wait to stay again.

review:
['Christina
October 2021
Exactly as described- clean, great location. Being in living room gave me easy access to common areas. There isn’t a lot of running into other guests either (even though sharing common area) so overall pretty good and would stay again!
Show more', 'Rajni
October 2021
Kalani was really helpful, communicative and kind. She even let me drop my stuff before my checkin time. It’s a small space but you got everything you need under a budget and the location is really great. Close to all the train stops. Perfect for crashing for a night or two if you are visiting this side of the city. Times Square, Bryant park, Central Park etc are all walking distance from here. Would stay here again.
Show more', 'Joanne
October 2021
Very clean. At times the host came in to clean without notice.', 'Nattha
September 2021
I have to give this 10 stars, this is not sugar coated do you wanna know why ?? Not much of the place , not crazy about bed , not too picky about sharing but it’s a LOCATION LOCATION AND THE LOCATION !!!! Yes it’s the best of the best. So close to time square, Bryant park, NYC public library, Korean town , top of the greatest of the greatest is grocery just downstairs. I am not kidding , this is for real.

2. Cleanliness : Kris is the best. She’s really sweet , humble , friendly and she clean things right !!! I appreciated it a lot ( alcohol spray for surface cleaning on your own just to make you feel at peace ✌️.

3. Eating and light cooking utensil , they have pot , coffee cup, boiling pot , bowl , dishes just perfect if you have left over or light cooking meal to save money

4. Bed , it was super horrible , my back got screwed for 2 days sleep on the very thin 2 1/2 inches Mattress so I got contacted with Ian and he responded right away and he ritually find the solution for me even bring me extra pad if I need extra comfort.
So for the customer service I would give Ian and his helper 5 stars love it
The best thing is that Ian worked with my schedule. I have to catch the train at 3 pm but his check out time is 11 am so I asked if I could leave my luggage at the sofa and he said yes. Wow how could you find someone much like him in NYC. At least my last host wasn’t give me much of help.

This is my home in NYC
Show more', 'Alex
September 2021
The room was clean and smelled good. The location is amazing and close to everything. Communication with the host is really good and fast at responding.', 'Marcela
September 2021

Self check-in

Great location
90% of recent guests gave the location a 5-star rating.
***PLEASE READ DETAILS BELOW BEFORE BOOKING!!!***

Location! Location! Location!

Immerse yourself into the heart of Manhattan like no other. Located in Midtown, it is the most STRATEGIC location to be in to get to the majority of tourist destinations in less than 30 minutes via subway/bus.

Walking distance to:
Time Square - 15 mins walk
Empire State Building - 8 mins
Madison Square Garden -5 mins
Flatiron Building - 9 mins
Koreatown - 5 mins


*It's a 2 bedroom apartment. Maximum capacity of 2 guests in each room. THIS LISTING IS FOR THE BUNK BED IN THE LIVING ROOM. This is a COMMON AREA so other guests will be passing by whenever they use the bathroom or kitchenette.
There are curtains installed around the bed so you will still have your privacy. You won't be sharing the bunk bed with anyone, you can store your belongings on the top bunk.

*You'll be sharing this apartment with other airbnb guests, MALE/FEMALE

*Located on a 3rd floor walk-up, NO ELEVATOR

*Since it's centrally located there's a POTENTIAL FOR NOISE but EARPLUGS ARE PROVIDED.

*Guests/outsiders NOT in the reservation are not allowed to enter the apartment (camera in the living room for everyone's safety)

*It has a kitchenette that includes a refrigerator, portable stove, microwave, toaster, dishes, pots and silverware.

I have to give this 10 stars, this is not sugar coated do you wanna know why ?? Clean and beautifully furnished studio apartment. Easy access to a lot of NYC’s famous tourist attractions, best restaurants and shops.

The space
- Stay in beautiful, cozy and fully furnished studio apartment.
- Beautiful neighborhood steps away from the subway, bus stops, sight seeing and tours.
- Enjoy free WiFi and Netflix during your stay.
- The kitchen equipped with stove, oven, full fridge, microwave, coffee maker with free keurig coffee kcups , toaster, dish ware, pots/pans, utensils etc.
- Enjoy the dining area.
- The bathroom features shower, bathtub, toilet, with clean towels, shampoo, conditioner, soap, bathroom tissue provided.
- Enjoy the very comfy luxury queen size bed with clean linens.
- Apartment has flat screen TV, lounge and relax in the sofa bed.
- Heat and AC provided.
- Keep in mind it’s 2nd floor walk up but it’s a great way to burn off all the delicious NYC treats you’ll be enjoying.

September 2021
Great little studio apartment centrally located in Manhattan. It was actually pretty quiet as well compared to what I was expecting staying in the city. Lots of places to eat within walking distance as well. The only thing negative I would say is it was a little confusing trying to locate the lock box and apartment, but Marie gave detailed instructions and photos so once we found the right orientation based on the photos everything went smoothly from there.
Show more
Scott
September 2021
If you're looking to explore Midtown Manhattan, this is a great location to do it. A short walk up 53rd and there's several places you can hit in a day's adventure. The apartment itself is an easy one-story walk up (using keys to enter). It's well-equipped with a fully functional kitchen--gas stove, Keurig coffee maker, large refrig, plenty of pots and pans so cooking meals is no sweat. Grocery stores, restaurants/bars are all within walking distance. There's no view and the place receives little natural sunlight as it backs to another building. The mattress is on the soft side.

The apartment was very clean and very easy to get to. We had a great weekend!

Please be advise that the room faces a busy street. Where it can be a bit disturbing at times. If you’re aren’t use to the city it can be annoying. However, the place itself is comfortable making the noise a minor annoyance when the windows are closed and curtains drawn .

Lastly, the communication could’ve been better with the host. I had some inquiries that I wish was answered in a decent amount of time. All in all, I would stay here again.I am happy I found this place to stay.
Show more
Sophie
October 2020
More like a hotel room than an apartment, but it was very spacious and a great location!', '593 Reviews

If you're looking for an affordable place to stay in the Big Apple right in the center of Manhattan then welcome to my home! This cozy queen size private bedroom has a true city feeling, only a few minutes walk to the Empire State Building! The apartment is right in the heart of Manhattan, near Grand Central, Korea Town, Murray Hill, Madison Square Park and much more. (PLEASE kindly read the entire description of the place before messaging host)


This is a private room in a shared apartment. The apartment is in the center of New York City, near the subway station, bus stops, and near the empire state, lots of restaurants and shops around to explore and enjoy. Two people per room, but if there's more than two then I can offer sleeping bags ($30 per extra person), the room may be big enough to fit more; or they can sleep in the living room if needed. I also rent other extra rooms on this platform, same apartment. (Check my profile for a link in case you need to bring an extra friend).

review:
['Stacy
January 2021
Fantastic place for the location/ budget!', 'Maria
November 2020
Great host', 'Maria
August 2020
Very nice', 'George
May 2020
The place qualifies as underwhelming, and a disappointment for the price, which is a bit ludicrous for what you get. I’ve had a place almost double the size on the LES — with more accoutrements — for the same monthly fees, if not a tad less.

The neighborhood is nice; the location is very convenient. Rooftop is lovey for a coffee in the morning. Close to the subway and Whole Foods. Walk to Trader Joe’s a nice bit of exercise on a weekend.

But, it was quite dirty when I arrived. Dust everywhere, and even an old blouse covered in hair left by a previous tenant.

The shower curtain rod is held up by a piece of paper slipped between the bar and the wall. It fell once and cut my foot while I was standing next to the toilet.

Somehow my electricity bills for the first and second month were basically identical, despite the fact I arrived 8 days late. Did they even read the meter? That’s on top of it bring a bit insulting to even ask you to cover electricity given the price they ask you for what you get

The only plugs in the kitchen are located behind the faucet, and directly behind the gas stove. So, essentially useless for anything while one is cooking. Cupboards were covered in grease from a previous tenants cooking habits, and some sort of adhesive I couldn’t remove even with an hours scrubbing with a new sponge and hot water.

Listing says “basic kitchen essentials,” though they left no soap (nor salt, pepper, oil etc), even in the middle of the covid pandemic.

Closet smelled like cat litter, and the shelves were so dirty they left smudges on shirts. I could go on, but you get the idea.

Overall, though the location was perfect, you can find a much nicer place for the same ask.
Show more', "Bill
March 2020
The apartment is on such a great block in the heart of Hell's Kitchen with incredible window views of midtown Manhattan and a beautiful rooftop! I highly recommend this place.
Show more", 'Lindsay
January 2020
I stayed here for about 40 days, as I transitioned into my new job, in a new state, and then my permanent lease. This was a great location and stay for my start here. Close walk to subway stations, all the food options right on 9th you can imagine. Very quick in response to any questions from host. Great stay!
Show more']

review:
['Dillon
August 2021
Clean apartment in a great location. Easily walkable to most subway lines and restaurants/bars.

Lightly stocked for longer stays - only had 1 small bar of soap, 2 towels, 2 rolls of toilet paper, and 2 garbage can liners for a 6 week stay so expect to stock up yourself.
Show more', 'Emily
March 2021
Clean, modern, beautiful space in amazing location. Excellent customer service, fast response and comfortable stay !! The best', "Kimberly
August 2017
If you are planning to stay long term, be aware that there are a LOT of people on this street all the time who are mostly tourists that are slowly walking or stopped, taking pictures and looking all around. During times when people typically eat, it was hard to get out of there navigating around all the people. Getting to work in the morning was easy though because it's nearly empty at 7am. Prince street pizza nearby and Taim are the best! Make sure Jeniffer uploads the right pictures for you in advance and tells you the exact square feet so you know what to expect (we didn't know because she never directly answered this question, and also accidentally uploaded the wrong pictures and told us about it right before our move in, even though we booked months in advance.) I think this is a great place for a short term stay. For a long term stay I would opt for something else.
Show more", "Liam
December 2016
This apartment is a great place for visitors to the city, right in the heart of Little Italy. Little Italy is of course very busy, but it's exciting and buzzy as well.

The apartment building has been especially geared for short term travel, with easy check-in and check-out, and everything you need in the building including a roof terrace and a laundry downstairs.

The apartment itself is a studio, so not huge, but was the right size for what we needed, and it was clean and new, so very happy. It was also quiet, even with Little Italy just downstairs.

Jeniffer was very flexible and accommodating, and made it really simple for me to stay there, which is exactly what I needed.

If you want to eat good food, head north up Mulberry, rather than the restaurants directly around the apartment. Gelso & Grand, Pasquale Jones, The Chefs Club, there are plenty of great spots there.


Show more", 'Catherine
August 2016
I was given all the information I needed and had no problems at all! Any questions I had about the building/space/location were answered immediately. It was clean and just as described. Would definitely stay here again!!
Show more', "Robbie
September 2016
Great location, very busy at weekends. Studios are basic but comfortable. Check out the rooftop, it's great. Laundry services in the basement."]

Lightly stocked for longer stays - only had 1 small bar of soap, 2 towels, 2 rolls of toilet paper, and 2 garbage can liners for a 6 week stay so expect to stock up yourself.
Show more
Emily
March 2021
Clean, modern, beautiful space in amazing location. Excellent customer service, fast response and comfortable stay !! The best
Kimberly
August 2017
If you are planning to stay long term, be aware that there are a LOT of people on this street all the time who are mostly tourists that are slowly walking or stopped, taking pictures and looking all around. During times when people typically eat, it was hard to get out of there navigating around all the people. Getting to work in the morning was easy though because it's nearly empty at 7am. Prince street pizza nearby and Taim are the best! Make sure Jeniffer uploads the right pictures for you in advance and tells you the exact square feet so you know what to expect (we didn't know because she never directly answered this question, and also accidentally uploaded the wrong pictures and told us about it right before our move in, even though we booked months in advance.) I think this is a great place for a short term stay. For a long term stay I would opt for something else.
Show more
Liam
December 2016
This apartment is a great place for visitors to the city, right in the heart of Little Italy. Little Italy is of course very busy, but it's exciting and buzzy as well.

The apartment building has been especially geared for short term travel, with easy check-in and check-out, and everything you need in the building including a roof terrace and a laundry downstairs.

The apartment itself is a studio, so not huge, but was the right size for what we needed, and it was clean and new, so very happy. It was also quiet, even with Little Italy just downstairs.

Jeniffer was very flexible and accommodating, and made it really simple for me to stay there, which is exactly what I needed.

If you want to eat good food, head north up Mulberry, rather than the restaurants directly around the apartment. Gelso & Grand, Pasquale Jones, The Chefs Club, there are plenty of great spots there.


Show more
Catherine
August 2016
I was given all the information I needed and had no problems at all! Any questions I had about the building/space/location were answered immediately. It was clean and just as described. Would definitely stay here again!!
Show more
Robbie
September 2016
Great location, very busy at weekends. Studios are basic but comfortable. Check out the rooftop, it's great. Laundry services in the basement.", '751 Reviews

Location! Location! Location!

Immerse yourself into the heart of Manhattan like no other. Located in Midtown, it is the most STRATEGIC location to be in to get to the majority of tourist destinations in less than 30 minutes via subway/bus.

Walking distance to:
Time Square - 15 mins walk
Empire State Building - 8 mins
Madison Square Garden -5 mins
Flatiron Building - 9 mins
Koreatown - 5 mins


It's a 2 bedroom apartment. Maximum capacity of 2 guests in each room.

*Bunk bed in the living room is also advertised, so there might be a guest staying in the common area during your reservation.
You'll be sharing this space with other Airbnb guests both male and female.

*Located on a 3rd FLOOR walk-up, NO ELEVATOR. Since it's centrally located there's a potential for noise but earplugs are provided.

*Guests/outsiders NOT in the reservation are not allowed to enter the apartment (camera in the living room for everyone's safety)

*It has a kitchenette that includes a refrigerator, portable stove, microwave, toaster, dishes, pots and silverware.

Self check-in

Great check-in experience
95% of recent guests gave the check-in process a 5-star rating.
***PLEASE READ DETAILS BELOW BEFORE BOOKING!!***

Location! Location! Location!

Immerse yourself into the heart of Manhattan like no other. Located in Midtown, it is the most STRATEGIC location to be in to get to the majority of tourist destinations in less than 30 minutes via subway/bus.

Walking distance to:
Time Square - 15 mins walk
Empire State Building - 8 mins
Madison Square Garden -5 mins
Flatiron Building - 9 mins
Koreatown - 5 mins


*This is a HOSTEL type apartment, it consists of 3 private rooms and shared living quarters.

*Room is smaller than average and since it's centrally located there's a potential for noise in this area, but earplugs are provided in the front desk/table.

*Room is private and won't be shared with anyone else. But the rest of the amenities such as shower, toilet, living room are shared with other guests both male and female.

*Majority of the guests staying are young adults/backpackers therefore it's not suitable to parents with kids nor it's handicapped accessible

*Shoes must be left on the rack by the front entrance so please bring your own slippers

*Wooden bunk bed is rated to support 220lbs max weight/sleeping level

2 guests · Studio · 1 bed · 1 bath
Entire home
You’ll have the apartment to yourself.
Enhanced Clean
This Host committed to Airbnb's 5-step enhanced cleaning process. Show more
Location, location, location! Live like a local at this cozy studio apartment. Located inside a historic NYC brownstone nestled in one of Manhattan's greatest neighborhoods, Murray Hill. The apartments are small but well designed to maximize the usage of the space. The units re equipped with a private bathroom, comfortable bed, basic cable TV, a micro-kitchen, and plenty of open closet space. It is the perfect place for a single guest looking for full privacy.


Our studios offers our guests the perfect solution to all of New York City's lodging hassles... Price, location, & privacy. With us you can have your own place, in a Manhattan's upscale and central location, at an affordable price!

The Apartments
The units are small (which NYC apartment isn't right?) but well equipped with all the amenities needed for a comfortable long stay. The Micro-Kitchen may be tiny but it is loaded to bring the inner chef out of you. The comfortable bed will guarantee a good night sleep after a long day out on the city. We provide free Wi-Fi and basic cable TV for you to stay connected with the outside world and the private bathroom has an eclectic feel to it and will provide full privacy to feel comfortable with added open closet space to keep you organized.

The building
Our unit is located in a beautiful 1930's historic building that will provide you with a true New York experience. So please keep in mind that this classic building, which is a better word for older, is well maintained but lacks certain amenities that became more popular years after its creation. Stairs are a must, as there is not an elevator in the building and the A/C's are located on the windows.

The Neighborhood
One of the best features of our studio is its location. Step out of the door and enjoy the beautiful tree-lined streets of Murray Hill. With plenty of cute cafes, restaurants, bars, and local shops to suit any needs you may have. This upscale but young and hip neighborhood puts you within walking distance of pretty much anywhere you may need to be, or at most a fast subway trip away from it.

Dominic
March 2021
A lovely little haven in the heart of East Midtown - though I stayed for five months during the height of the pandemic, the apartment was a cozy refuge from long days at work. There's a 24 grocery store right at the corner - and tons of local bars and restaurants a stone's throw away - Central Park is a pretty short twenty minute walk away - as well as Times Square and Bryant Park - really, this location is gold!
Show more
Nicole
October 2020
I had a great 6 week stay at Evan and Maria's place. The apartment is completely renovated, as per the photos, and actually bigger than I expected it to be. It feels like staying in a hotel, but it's nice having the kitchen and dining area if you are planning a longer stay and want to feel more at home. The only negative of the apartment is that there is not much natural light since I spent the weekdays working from home, but if you're a tourist and spending most of the time out, this isn't a drawback at all. There is a grocery store a block away and tons of great bars and restaurants nearby. There is also a cross town bus on the corner and the ferry is just a quick 15 minute walk to get to downtown Manhattan or Brooklyn. The neighborhood and building is quiet and very safe. Evan was always available to answer any questions or concerns I had via text and addressed any minor issues promptly. Would definitely recommend and would book this place again!
Show more
Lily
June 2020
This place is great, clean, nice area and great hostess. Will definitely book again.
Monefah
June 2020
I really loved staying here! The place was super clean and we just loved the apartment overall. Communication was amazing. They responded to all our questions and concerns. Even accommodated is checking in early due to an early flight. They are super understanding and knows what their doing. You guys are the perfect host. I would recommend this place to anyone!
Show more
Serena
May 2020
The apartment is charming and sparkling clean! The kitchenette has everything you need to prep meals. The free coffee and kisses chocolate was a nice touch. The communication with the hosts was great and they can be flexible with check in/out time if the schedule allows so just ask. I enjoy my stay there!
Show more
Dawn
January 2020
Everything was perfect. The checkin & checkout was easy. The apartment is spotless & exactly as described. Location is great. Neighborhood is safe.

New York, United States
The area is extremely safe with five 24 hour doorman buildings on the block. Only a seven minute walk to the metro / subway and 2 blocks from the United Nations.

Located at the crossroads of some of NYC's finest and most convenient neighborhoods including Turtle Bay, Beekman, Sutton and Midtown East. Prime location, safe and accessible to everything. In walking distance, you will find some of the finest restaurants and shopping in NYC. The ease of access to Broadway Shows and Times Square just across town makes this unit a wonderful starting and ending point for any holiday or business trip.


Whole Foods is just 7 blocks away and 2 local supermarkets are within 2 blocks. The East River Promenade is 1 block away, having one of the city's best dog runs, water views and running paths. We look forward to your stay!

review:
["Kelsey
October 2021
Jackie's AirBnb is perfectly located, close to everything, in one of the most idyllic neighborhoods in the city. It's a 5 minute walk to the subway, and you can be just about anywhere in 15-20 minutes. Jackie was extremely responsive and helpful with anything we needed. I highly recommend!
Show more", 'Christine
October 2021
Perfect stay for former New Yorkers! Jackie was kind and a great communicator. Complimentary Snacks, drinks, and coffee waiting for us. Great rate for the quality and central location, very comfortable, it couldn’t have been better. Will come back next year!!
Show more', 'Jill
October 2021
The apartment was exactly as described and made for a perfect location for my week long stay. Conveniently located and everything you need or want is only a short walk away. Jackie is a great hostess and provided a quick response to every question I had, both pre-arrival and once I was situated. I would definitely stay here again.
Show more', 'Meera
October 2021
Jackie’s apt. is located on a lovely quiet street in the East Village. Fine restaurants and shops abound within a 5 minute walk. This studio apt. is super clean, beautifully appointed, comfortable and well equipped.
My husband and I would definitely choose to stay there again.
Show more', 'Jill
October 2021
Great comfy studio apartment with all the amenities needed on beautiful tree lined street at great location central between Union square and Washington square', "Ariana
September 2021
I wish I could give Jackie and her beautiful apartment 10 stars! This apartment is equipped with high-end toiletries, appliances, and finishes. The location can't be beaten, we were walking distance from so many great restaurants, bars, and parks. Jackie is a wonderful host who wants her guests to have the best stay. When we checked in, the fridge was stocked with sparkling water and beer. Jackie even provided a carrot loaf, biscottis, and coffee. We needed a sponge, dish towels, and dishwasher pods, so Jackie sent some via Amazon straight to the apartment right away, without any hesitation. She is so thoughtful and great at communication. The apartment was the perfect place to come back to after a long day of exploring the city. The bed is extremely comfortable as well. If you're looking to stay in Lower Manhattan and are lucky enough to book Jackie's place, do it!!

When we checked in, the fridge was stocked with sparkling water and beer. Jackie even provided a carrot loaf, biscottis, and coffee. Where you’ll be
New York, United States
“The Village” is a beloved mix of the best that New York has to offer, including the iconic Washington Square Park. A diverse group of residents all contribute to the energy of this lively yet well-behaved slice of Manhattan.

What to Expect:
Those looking to live in a bustling, centrally located neighborhood.

The Lifestyle:
Well-balanced. Active days blend into fun, relaxing nights.

What Not to Expect:
A neighborhood that's far removed from typical NYC to-and-fro.

The Market:
Generally expensive, but plenty of options across a diverse blend of walkups, brownstones, and doorman buildings.

You’ll Fall In Love With:
The communal culture of this down-to-earth, embracing neighborhood.

Well-placed high-rise in a prime Midtown spot on 45th between 5th and 6th Aves – a 7-minute stroll from the spectacle that is Times Square, with its neighboring Broadway theaters, shops and eateries galore. Plus an easy 14-minute jaunt from the equally famous Empire State Building.

Ascott Cares covers 9 commitments to maintaining high levels of hygiene and cleanliness standards as well as safe distancing to continue providing our guests and staff a safe environment.


Serene and tasteful, the rooms all star white oak hardwood floors and a modern, minimalist aesthetic. The muted palette has a refined vibe, and furnishings have an updated mid-century flair. Newly remodeled bathrooms are done in classic New York subway tile, and well-appointed with New York based C.O. Bigelow bath amenities.

Your room will include:
Free WiFi
Flat-screen TV
Coffeemaker
Complimentary C.O. Bigelow bath amenities

In-room dining

Mineiry
October 2021
It was a great experience starting at the Citadines spending my boyfriend birthday. Great weekend at NYC only thing was the picture of the bathroom was not what we received and I was really looking forward to it.
Show more
Frank
October 2021
Honestly the worst experience I’ve ever had with a hotel. First of all checkin is at 3 and at 4 they still had no room for me. I asked to talk to a manager and they totally ignored my request. The place didn’t tell us we needed a stamp for parking spot and I can list countless reasons why you’re better off paying an extra $20, $50 or even more to stay some place else. Do not book this place.
Show more
Jessica
October 2021
Great place to stay in New York! The rooms are small, but it’s worth it for the location. You really can’t beat it! Close to Times Square and lots of shopping on 5th Ave. Would stay here again.
Show more
Jonet
October 2021
Great location and super clean room! Only draw back was the bedding. The pillows were really thin and flat plus they were pretty much out of small wash towels. Other than that my stay was pretty good.
Show more
Annabelle
October 2021
Front desk had us wait 20-25 mins in the lobby upon check in to see if the room was ready which was a little inconvenient after traveling all day. Front desk was very friendly otherwise and we had a great stay! Would stay again. Be mindful the walls are thin though- I would wake up to neighbors slamming their hotel doors and I’m a pretty light sleeper. Location is also perfect!!!
Show more
Clint
October 2021
Super accommodating to changing travel schedule. All in all, a great stay overall. Recommend.

['Luxury Studio style room in Manhattan Brownstone
4.96

Private room in rental unit hosted by Andrew
2 guests · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 shared bath
Enhanced Clean
This Host committed to Airbnb's 5-step enhanced cleaning process. Show more
Self check-in
Check yourself in with the lockbox.
Great location
95% of recent guests gave the location a 5-star rating.
Tastefully decorated large room with impressive high ceilings and a beautiful street view.

Relax in this private sanctuary with a very comfortable queen size bed, your own couch and dining space, fridge, microwave, coffee maker and many other comforts more reminiscent of an upscale hotel.

Perfectly located away from the crowds and congestion of Midtown yet only a 15 minute subway ride to Times Square. An abundance of shops and restaurants all within three minutes walking distance.


Experience true comfort in one of the most beautiful areas of Manhattan. This apartment is located in a historic listed brownstone building right on Lenox Avenue, the widest and arguably the best looking avenue in Manhattan.


The Room

This newly renovated bedroom is big by New York standards. The room includes a queen bed with comfortable memory foam mattress, cable TV, sofa, dining table and chairs, refrigerator, microwave, Keurig. Newly listed so many of the furnishings and appliances are brand new.

What is included in the room:

- Queen size bed with brand new comfortable memory foam mattress.
- Nightstands with modern alarm clock/USB charging stand.
- Samsung flat screen smart TV
- Cable and high speed Internet access
- Large sofa and coffee table
- Dining room table/workspace with chairs
- Kitchenette area with your own Fridge/Freezer, Microwave and Keurig coffee maker.
- Selection of coffees, hot chocolate, teas, snacks as well as teapot
- Fresh towels and linen
- Two clean white bath robes
- Extra blankets and throw
- Luggage rack for your suitcase
- Haidryer
- First aid kit
- Yoga mat
- Iron and ironing board
- Large closet space and hangers
- Selection of books including NYC guide book.


The Bathroom

The bathroom is on the same floor and shared inly with the other guest room. It is cleaned every day and kept well stocked woth supplies.
The bathroom has free soap gel, shampoo and conditioner.


Extras

There is a coin operated laundromat in the basement of the building

Apartment access

The room is up only one flight of stairs and the entire floor consists of only two guest rooms and a bathroom. Guests enter through a separate front entrance on the floor which allows them to discretely come and go directly to their rooms without disturbing anybody else in the building.

Delaney
October 2021
Perfect Spot!!! The historic neighborhood is a wander to walk around in! the is within two blocks and Central Park North is only two stops away! If you love seeing the non-tourist-centric side of New York this spot is a must-see!!
Show more
Megan
October 2021
Great location next to a metro stop. Andrew responded quickly to any questions.
Sandra
October 2021
Andrew’s place is amazing-meticulously maintained. He is so helpful and accommodating.. We will be back whenever we are in NYC. Coffee is provided and we were so impressed with the cleanliness. There is a Whole Foods Market close, Harlem Shake, bars, coffee shops, bagels, a wonderful location. We loved it there.
Show more
Erin
October 2021
Andrew was a phenomenal host, he really made you feel welcomed and was always available if we had any questions or concerns. The information he gave us about the neighborhood before our trip was handy and we appreciated all the recommendations! The location was fantastic as well, a short walk to the subway is all you needed to get downtown quickly, and if you feel up for a walk it is easy to walk down to the north entrance of Central Park. The room was cozy and welcoming, plenty of space to rest or take it easy once you are done exploring the city! We would absolutely stay here again.
Show more
Clarissa
October 2021
My friend and I had a great experience staying here! The room is exactly the same as the pictures, and there’s lots of natural lighting. Check in was easy, and Andrew was super helpful with answering my questions and giving recommendations. It’s a nice location with Central Park being a few blocks down. Overall, a great place to stay in NY!
Show more
Jack
October 2021
Andrew was very helpful and responsive from start to finish. He showed me around the unit at check-in and provided a long list of recommendations for NYC and the neighborhood. The room was clean and spacious and the bed was comfortable and plenty large for someone who is 6'2". The only downside of the location is that lots of noise comes in through the window from Malcolm X Boulevard. But Andrew provided earplugs and this ultimately didn't bother me too much.
Show more
Show all 151 reviews
Where you’ll be
New York, United States
The apartment is in a historic brownstone located on Lenox Avenue in the Mount Morris Park historic district.

You will be 2-4 minutes walk to Whole Foods, Starbucks, Dunkin Donuts, Staples, Marshalls, Olive Garden, Burlington, CVS, Mcdonalds, Burger King, Golden Crust, Chipotle.

There are three gyms nearby– Blink, Planet Fitness and NYSC. You are also easy walking diistance to countless other shops, including H&M, TJMaxx, Victoria secret, Bed Bath & Beyond all the banks.

There is also a burgeoning restaurant and cafe scene in the area with places such as Red Rooster by celebrity Chef Marcus Samuelsson only two blocks away. The casual-chic soul food restaurant BLVD Bistro is only steps away from the apartment. Other restaurants that are very close by include Harlem Shake, Sottocase Pizzeria, Barawine, Settepani, Il cafe Latte, Sushi Inoue, Corner Social and the famous soul food classic Sylvia's.

There are two parks nearby, Marcus Garvey park is steps aways and it is only a 12 minute walk to Central Park.

The building is in a very safe, well-lit area on the widest street in Manhattan. It is unlike other listings that may look beautiful inside, but are down dark side streets or in the less developed areas above 125th street.
Show more

4.5', "Nova
October 2021
We had a great one night! The part of NYC it's in is actually quieter than my apartment in So Cal, which was pleasantly surprising. It's also only a 4 min walk from the metro. The host is excellent at communicating. She was there when we arrived to let us in and left the keys in the room. No locks from the outside on the room doors, but she keeps an eye with apartment cameras to make sure it's always a safe place, and it feels like it is. I was stressed about parking, which is free on the street if you get lucky and can find a spot. The host was able to have her friend save our rental car a spot right outside the front door for $5. She also let us leave our stuff in the room and come back in the afternoon before our evening flight, which was super helpful. Wifi is good, rooms are very white and could use some artwork and color, but they certainly get the job done and are still comfortable spaces! Would definitely stay here again.
Show more

Really close form here you can find The Cloisters, is located on four acres overlooking the Hudson River, is a museum dedicated to the art, architecture, and gardens of medieval Europe. Located in Bowery – historically the most unique streetscape of New York with over 400 years of history and culture – this place is right around the corner of Grand St subway. Super convenient as you can be anywhere in Manhattan in just a few minutes. Steps away from SoHo, NoHo and major subway lines (6,J,Z,N,Q,B,D). Its unbeatable location puts the best of downtown.


Modern unit in an elevator building. This unit is illuminated by floor to ceiling industrial style windows, flooding the home with brilliant light. The room has a hot plate, mini fridge, microwave, closet, spacious bathroom, smart TV and heat/air conditioning.

*Majority of the guests staying are young adults/backpackers therefore it's not suitable to parents with kids nor it's handicapped accessible

*Shoes must be left on the rack by the front entrance so please bring your own slippers

Newly renovated 1 bedroom apt in private townhouse in historic Prospect Lefferts Gardens on the block that won the title of "Brooklyn's Greenest Block" in 2018. We, the owners, live in the ground floor apartment. This is located on the cultural side of Prospect Park (2 blocks away) including the Botanic Garden and Brooklyn Museum. Manhattan is easy to get to by metro (the Q, 2 and 5 trains get you to most major destinations without changing trains in around 30 min)


Your private apartment is the rear half of the second floor of a 1904 French Renaissance Revival rowhouse. The apartment has been completely renovated, and features restored original hardwood floors, radiant heat (in the living room), and a bathroom with spa-like shower and skylight. The quiet, comfort and charm of this apartment make it a perfect base for exploring Brooklyn and Manhattan.

We don't charge a cleaning fee, and instead ask that guests leave the apartment in the same clean condition we provide it. We make this easy by providing all necessary cleaning supplies.
