Tina
November 2021
The apartment was a perfect place to hang out after a long day of exploring Brooklyn. Walking distance to Prospect Park (lovelier, wilder, less crowded than Central Park), Botanic Gardens, Brooklyn Museum, restaurants/bars and subway line if you care to venture further, which we did. The apartment itself has character…beautiful wooden floors, tall ceilings, windows to let the light in. Kitchen is well stocked with a dishwasher (yay!) and also a washer/dryer in the apartment. And great books about Brooklyn and all that it has to offer, including several suggested self-walking tours, which we did. All in all a lovely place. We highly recommend this apartment for a truly authentic Brooklyn visit.
Show more
Pamela
October 2021
A cute, bright, comfortable apartment. Great bed and pillows. Just about all you need, even if you decide to eat in and cook. Hosts are very helpful and friendly. Best if you are using public transportation-very convenient. I had a car, so a little more inconvenient, but manageable. Have Uber, will travel!
I would definitely recommend and hope to be back in the spring.

Where you’ll be
Brooklyn, New York, United States
Welcome to Lefferts Avenue! - Our block was recognized by the Brooklyn Botanic Garden as being one of the Greenest Blocks in Brooklyn, and is part of the Prospect Lefferts Gardens historic district.

Our immediate neighborhood is called Prospect Lefferts Gardens, and is part of Flatbush, the heart and soul of Brooklyn. Our community is racially and economically diverse, with many longtime residents coming to live here from throughout the Caribbean. Neighbors try to maintain the Caribbean tradition of civility, so feel free to greet people you pass with a friendly "good morning", "good afternoon" or "good evening." Visitors can enjoy restaurants specializing in food from Trinidad, Jamaica (including both jerk chicken and also Rastafarian vegetarian), Barbados and Haiti - in addition to newer restaurants of all types.

Located along the East Side of Prospect Park, we are within a 20 minute walk of the Brooklyn Botanic Garden, Zoo, Museum and Public Library., as well as Grand Army Plaza.

Every Sunday from April through September Prospect Park hosts the weekly Smorgasburg Food Truck festival, with over 100 food vendors participating. Enter via the Lincoln Road Prospect Park entrance, five minutes away.

Gone but not forgotten, the Brooklyn Dodgers ballpark (Ebbets Field) was three blocks from our home until the team moved to Los Angeles in 1958.
Brooklyn's Franklin Avenue restaurant scene is also nearby (a 15-20 minute walk.)

review:
["Dominic
March 2021
A lovely little haven in the heart of East Midtown - though I stayed for five months during the height of the pandemic, the apartment was a cozy refuge from long days at work. There's a 24 grocery store right at the corner - and tons of local bars and restaurants a stone's throw away - Central Park is a pretty short twenty minute walk away - as well as Times Square and Bryant Park - really, this location is gold!
Show more", "Nicole
October 2020
I had a great 6 week stay at Evan and Maria's place. The apartment is completely renovated, as per the photos, and actually bigger than I expected it to be. It feels like staying in a hotel, but it's nice having the kitchen and dining area if you are planning a longer stay and want to feel more at home. The only negative of the apartment is that there is not much natural light since I spent the weekdays working from home, but if you're a tourist and spending most of the time out, this isn't a drawback at all. There is a grocery store a block away and tons of great bars and restaurants nearby. There is also a cross town bus on the corner and the ferry is just a quick 15 minute walk to get to downtown Manhattan or Brooklyn. The neighborhood and building is quiet and very safe. Evan was always available to answer any questions or concerns I had via text and addressed any minor issues promptly. Would definitely recommend and would book this place again!

Dominic
March 2021
A lovely little haven in the heart of East Midtown - though I stayed for five months during the height of the pandemic, the apartment was a cozy refuge from long days at work. There's a 24 grocery store right at the corner - and tons of local bars and restaurants a stone's throw away - Central Park is a pretty short twenty minute walk away - as well as Times Square and Bryant Park - really, this location is gold!
Show more
Nicole
October 2020
I had a great 6 week stay at Evan and Maria's place. The apartment is completely renovated, as per the photos, and actually bigger than I expected it to be. It feels like staying in a hotel, but it's nice having the kitchen and dining area if you are planning a longer stay and want to feel more at home. The only negative of the apartment is that there is not much natural light since I spent the weekdays working from home, but if you're a tourist and spending most of the time out, this isn't a drawback at all. There is a grocery store a block away and tons of great bars and restaurants nearby. There is also a cross town bus on the corner and the ferry is just a quick 15 minute walk to get to downtown Manhattan or Brooklyn. The neighborhood and building is quiet and very safe. Evan was always available to answer any questions or concerns I had via text and addressed any minor issues promptly. Would definitely recommend and would book this place again!
Show more
Lily
June 2020
This place is great, clean, nice area and great hostess. Will definitely book again.
Monefah
June 2020
I really loved staying here! The place was super clean and we just loved the apartment overall. Communication was amazing. They responded to all our questions and concerns. Even accommodated is checking in early due to an early flight. They are super understanding and knows what their doing. You guys are the perfect host. I would recommend this place to anyone!
Show more
Serena
May 2020
The apartment is charming and sparkling clean! The kitchenette has everything you need to prep meals. The free coffee and kisses chocolate was a nice touch. The communication with the hosts was great and they can be flexible with check in/out time if the schedule allows so just ask. I enjoy my stay there!
Show more
Dawn
January 2020
Everything was perfect. The checkin & checkout was easy. The apartment is spotless & exactly as described. Location is great. Neighborhood is safe.
Show all 162 reviews
Where you’ll be
New York, United States
The area is extremely safe with five 24 hour doorman buildings on the block. Only a seven minute walk to the metro / subway and 2 blocks from the United Nations.

Located at the crossroads of some of NYC's finest and most convenient neighborhoods including Turtle Bay, Beekman, Sutton and Midtown East. Prime location, safe and accessible to everything. In walking distance, you will find some of the finest restaurants and shopping in NYC. The ease of access to Broadway Shows and Times Square just across town makes this unit a wonderful starting and ending point for any holiday or business trip.


Whole Foods is just 7 blocks away and 2 local supermarkets are within 2 blocks. The East River Promenade is 1 block away, having one of the city's best dog runs, water views and running paths. We look forward to your stay!

review:
['Andrea
November 2021
Very nice! Andrew gave a lot of recommendations of things to do and see and eat. I would 100 percent stay there again. Host kept to himself but was quick to respond with any questions. The apartment was very clean, host would change out the shower mat daily. Felt very safe! Thank you Andrew!
Show more', 'Eunice
October 2021
Roomy and good host!', 'Stephanie
October 2021
This spot is exactly as pictured. Very clean and Andrew has thought of all the little details. Umbrella in case it rains, guide books (English and Spanish), coffee and tea, etc. The location is close to the 125th St. subway so getting around the city is easy.
Show more', 'Cecilia
October 2021
Andrew was a great host. From beginning to end he was great! Definitely recommend staying here if you visit the north end of Manhattan.', 'Grant
October 2021
The metro station was very close along with a large Whole Foods grocery store. The shared bathroom was cleaned daily and we never had any problems with the other tenant down the hall. Overall our short stay was enjoyable, thank you Andrew!
Show more', "Ganda

owner_details:
["Huge Studio style room in Manhattan
4.99
(140 reviews)
·
\U000f0003
Superhost
·
New York, United States
Share
Save
Show all photos
Private room in rental unit hosted by Andrew
2 guests · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 shared bath
Enhanced Clean
This Host committed to Airbnb's 5-step enhanced cleaning process. Show more
Great check-in experience
100% of recent guests gave the check-in process a 5-star rating.
Highly rated Host
Andrew has received 5-star ratings from 100% of recent guests.
Tastefully decorated lavish 280 square foot room with impressive high ceilings and natural light.

Relax in this private sanctuary with a very comfortable queen size bed, your own couch and dining space, fridge, microwave, coffee maker and many other comforts more reminiscent of an upscale hotel.

Perfectly located away from the crowds and congestion of Midtown yet only a 15 minute subway ride to Times Square. An abundance of shops and restaurants all within three minutes walking distance.


Experience true luxury in one of the most beautiful areas of Manhattan. This apartment is located in a historic listed brownstone building right on Lenox Avenue, the widest and arguably the best looking avenue in Manhattan.

The Room

At 280 sqft this newly renovated bedroom is huge by New York standards. It is twice the size of the average “’large”’ bedroom in the area. The room includes a queen bed with comfortable memory foam mattress, cable TV, sofa, dining table and chairs, refrigerator, microwave, Keurig.

What is included in the room:

- Large queen size bed with oversized contemporary headboard and brand new comfortable memory foam mattress.
- Oversized Ethan Allen nightstands with modern alarm clock/USB charging stand.
- 50 inch Samsung flat screen smart TV
- Cable and high speed Internet access
- Large modern sofa and coffee table
- Dining room table/workspace with three chairs
- Ethan Allen Dresser with mirror and stool
- Kitchenette area with your own Fridge/Freezer, Microwave and Keurig coffee maker.
- Selection of coffees, hot chocolate, teas, snacks as well as teapot and french press
- Fresh towels and linen
- Extra blankets and throw
- Two clean white bath robes
- Luggage rack for your suitcase
- Haidryer
- First aid kit
- Yoga mat and roller
- Iron and ironing board
- Drying rack
- Large closet space and hangers
- Selection of books including NYC guide book


The Bathroom

The bathroom is directly outside the room.
The classic New York-style bathroom, features black and white subway tile accents. The bathroom has free soap gel, shampoo and conditioner.

Extras

There is a coin operated laundromat in the basement of the building

Apartment access

The apartment is up only one flight of stairs and the entire floor has two guest rooms and a shared bathroom. (private if the other room is not booked). Guests enter through a separate front entrance which allows them to discretely come and go directly to their rooms without disturbing anybody else in the building.

Where you’ll be
New York, United States
The apartment is in a historic brownstone located on Lenox Avenue in the Mount Morris Park historic district.

You will be 2-4 minutes walk to Whole Foods, Starbucks, Dunkin Donuts, Staples, Marshalls, Olive Garden, Burlington, CVS, Mcdonalds, Burger King, Golden Crust, Chipotle.

There are three gyms nearby– Blink, Planet Fitness and NYSC. You are also easy walking diistance to countless other shops, including H&M, TJMaxx, Victoria secret, Bed Bath & Beyond all the banks.

There is also a burgeoning restaurant and cafe scene in the area with places such as Red Rooster by celebrity Chef Marcus Samuelsson only two blocks away. The casual-chic soul food restaurant BLVD Bistro is only steps away from the apartment. Other restaurants that are very close by include Harlem Shake, Sottocase Pizzeria, Barawine, Settepani, Il cafe Latte, Sushi Inoue, Corner Social and the famous soul food classic Sylvia's.

There are two parks nearby, Marcus Garvey park is steps aways and it is only a 12 minute walk to Central Park.

The building is in a very safe, well-lit area on the widest street in Manhattan. It is unlike other listings that may look beautiful inside, but are down dark side streets or in the less developed areas above 125th street.

review:
["Carlos

Show more', 'Charlyn
October 2021

listing_type: ['Private room in rental unit hosted by Tiffany\n2 guests · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 shared bath']
review:
["Nova
October 2021
We had a great one night! The part of NYC it's in is actually quieter than my apartment in So Cal, which was pleasantly surprising. It's also only a 4 min walk from the metro. The host is excellent at communicating. She was there when we arrived to let us in and left the keys in the room. No locks from the outside on the room doors, but she keeps an eye with apartment cameras to make sure it's always a safe place, and it feels like it is. I was stressed about parking, which is free on the street if you get lucky and can find a spot. The host was able to have her friend save our rental car a spot right outside the front door for $5. She also let us leave our stuff in the room and come back in the afternoon before our evening flight, which was super helpful. Wifi is good, rooms are very white and could use some artwork and color, but they certainly get the job done and are still comfortable spaces! Would definitely stay here again.
Show more", 'Sigrun
October 2021
Great location - a key drop box would have been nice.
Nice and clean', 'Brandon
September 2021
G.O.A.T!', 'Shaira
September 2021
Great place and stay for my first time in NY. Tiffany was very responsive and helpful. I didn’t know it was a shared bathroom as it wasn’t states on the listing but overall its fine.
Show more']

listing_type: ['Entire guest suite hosted by Willi\n2 guests · Studio · 1 bed · 1 bath']
review:
['Yumi
November 2021
The place is very cute, a bit small but very convenient!
Will definitely come back when visit nyc again.', "Aleena
October 2021
This place is a great stay for anyone visiting New York!

The host is very accommodating and quick at responding, which I really appreciate. Checking-in was simple and easy, and contactless.

The location is great! I didn't have any trouble getting to the MTR - less than a 5 min walk. I also felt very safe walking around the area, even at night.

The stay itself was comfy! Perfect for two people. It was stacked with supplies such as shampoo, tooth paste, towels; pretty much everything you can think of in case you were to forget anything at home. Everything was clean and tidy. The only thing that was a little disappointment was the TV. There wasn't any signal or connection to watch anything, nor was it a smart TV to log into any TV subscriptions. But it wasn't too much of an issue since we were not staying in for a majority of the trip.

If you're looking for some place budget friendly, clean, and comfy for you and a friend or significant other, this is a great place for you!
Show more", 'Vinay
October 2021
I had a terrific stay at Willi’S. The place is upper clean and well located. The apartment has everything you need for a comfortable stay. Willi is an attentive host - easy to communicate and address any issues you might have.
Show more', 'Lewis
October 2021
A wonderful AirBnB.
Clean, many nice touches, soaps, coffee machine with coffee, fridge, microwave, bottled waters, a few snacks.

A really nice experience. Place felt very well loved and cared for. Oh, and a super big TV! Willi even let us borrow two umbrellas.

All around great time.
Show more', 'Megan
September 2021
Wonderful! Willi was an excellent host. The apartment is in a good location. I love the neighborhood and very easy to get to the city! I didn’t realize that it wasn’t a full kitchen when I booked, but it turned out to be totally doable for the week we had there with just a refrigerator and microwave. Willi also went above and beyond with lots of snacks available in the apartment. Thanks, Willi!
Show more', "Nicholas
August 2021
Can't say enough good things about my stay! Willi helped out with our luggage when we arrived and offered tips about the neighborhood. The complementary snacks and water in the room were a very much appreciated touch. We will be coming back!
Show more"]

Yumi
November 2021
The place is very cute, a bit small but very convenient!
Will definitely come back when visit nyc again.
Aleena
October 2021
This place is a great stay for anyone visiting New York!

The host is very accommodating and quick at responding, which I really appreciate. Checking-in was simple and easy, and contactless.

The location is great! I didn't have any trouble getting to the MTR - less than a 5 min walk. I also felt very safe walking around the area, even at night.

The stay itself was comfy! Perfect for two people. It was stacked with supplies such as shampoo, tooth paste, towels; pretty much everything you can think of in case you were to forget anything at home. Everything was clean and tidy. The only thing that was a little disappointment was the TV. There wasn't any signal or connection to watch anything, nor was it a smart TV to log into any TV subscriptions. But it wasn't too much of an issue since we were not staying in for a majority of the trip.

If you're looking for some place budget friendly, clean, and comfy for you and a friend or significant other, this is a great place for you!
Show more
Vinay
October 2021
I had a terrific stay at Willi’S. The place is upper clean and well located. The apartment has everything you need for a comfortable stay. Willi is an attentive host - easy to communicate and address any issues you might have.
Show more
Lewis
October 2021
A wonderful AirBnB.
Clean, many nice touches, soaps, coffee machine with coffee, fridge, microwave, bottled waters, a few snacks.

A really nice experience. Place felt very well loved and cared for. Oh, and a super big TV! Willi even let us borrow two umbrellas.

All around great time.
Show more
Megan
September 2021
Wonderful! Willi was an excellent host. The apartment is in a good location. I love the neighborhood and very easy to get to the city! I didn’t realize that it wasn’t a full kitchen when I booked, but it turned out to be totally doable for the week we had there with just a refrigerator and microwave. Willi also went above and beyond with lots of snacks available in the apartment. Thanks, Willi!
Show more
Nicholas
August 2021
Can't say enough good things about my stay! Willi helped out with our luggage when we arrived and offered tips about the neighborhood. The complementary snacks and water in the room were a very much appreciated touch. We will be coming back!

Great place, super convenient to the train and restaurants. I was able to work remote everyday and it was nice seeing the garden across the street out the window. I would recommend this place 100%.

A true Harlem experience. I will never forget the several months I spent at this brownstone. One of the best periods of my life.', "Asha
April 2020
I rented the apartment for months. PROS: Great location. Two blocks from Whole Foods, great restaurants, and 2/3 subway station. Spacious one-bedroom apartment, especially for Manhattan. Lots of closet space. Comfortable bed. All the basic essentials for a long-term stay. CONS: 1.) The entire apartment would often smell like weed since it sits on the top floor and there's central air, so weed smoke coming from bottom floors would rise to the top. 2.) The buzzer doesn't work, and it's not labeled. UPS and FedEx delivery men often don't have keys to the brownstone, so it was difficult getting packages delivered. It was frustrating when UPS or FedEx would deliver my packages while I'm home in the apartment, but because they had no way of contacting me or accessing the building, they would just leave with my packages. 3. The host Romeo is nice but not always very responsive. I made a few requests which he said he would do but never did. 4.) Wifi is weak in the bedroom.

Michael
June 2021
Great place, super convenient to the train and restaurants. I was able to work remote everyday and it was nice seeing the garden across the street out the window. I would recommend this place 100%.
Show more
Ja’sean
January 2021
A true Harlem experience. I will never forget the several months I spent at this brownstone. One of the best periods of my life.
Asha
April 2020
I rented the apartment for months. PROS: Great location. Two blocks from Whole Foods, great restaurants, and 2/3 subway station. Spacious one-bedroom apartment, especially for Manhattan. Lots of closet space. Comfortable bed. All the basic essentials for a long-term stay. CONS: 1.) The entire apartment would often smell like weed since it sits on the top floor and there's central air, so weed smoke coming from bottom floors would rise to the top. 2.) The buzzer doesn't work, and it's not labeled. UPS and FedEx delivery men often don't have keys to the brownstone, so it was difficult getting packages delivered. It was frustrating when UPS or FedEx would deliver my packages while I'm home in the apartment, but because they had no way of contacting me or accessing the building, they would just leave with my packages. 3. The host Romeo is nice but not always very responsive. I made a few requests which he said he would do but never did. 4.) Wifi is weak in the bedroom.
Show more
Wen
September 2019
Great Apartment! It has all the things you need for a long stay. Clean, tidy, and it is very close to Subway and Whole food. Highly recommended!
Billy
July 2019
Great spacious apartment very close to the subway and grocery store. Had all the essentials. Felt safe in the apartment. Would definitely stay here again.
Kendra
May 2019
I stayed in this Airbnb for about 3 months and it was a home away from home. Verna is an amazing air bnb host, truly a beam of light. Beautiful brownstone and very clean living space. It was an amazing experience from check in to check out. Great hospitality! This brownstone is located conveniently to the 2, 3, and D trains and is close to a Whole Foods, plenty restaurants, shopping, and laundromat. What a gem! When I’m back in New York I’ll be booking again. Thank you!

review:
['Carrielee
November 2021
This was a great stay! They were wonderful hosts and the place was as described. Small rooms, but great value and location!', 'Katy
November 2021
SUCH a great deal for the price and location! Shared bathroom was never a problem. The room itself is smaller than expected, but it’s all you really need to keep luggage during the day and sleep at night. Would stay here again!
Show more', 'Andrea
October 2021
This is a bare bones place. Decor is minimal, but cleanliness was excellent. The manager was very helpful and friendly.', "Dorothy
October 2021
Location is unbeatable! Room was clean and comfortable, and although the window is facing the street it wasn't loud and it didn't bother me. Would stay here again!
Show more", 'Tristan
September 2021
Clean place, easy to check in, well located close to public transport', 'Ruben
September 2021
It was OK. I would have liked to have a cover sheet for the bed, which I requested, but wasn’t available. They did provide quick communication and gave me a second cover. Also the toiletries were a bit disorganized, given that some people are staying longer terms in the unit.

The room smelled a bit bad, but served my needs for one night, once I turned the AC on the smell wasn’t perceived. There is a camera inside the apartment on the common area, which provides safety. Overall I felt safe in the apartment and the neighborhood is great.

I thought the place was quiet at night, but the mattress feels more like a tatami, thin and slightly hard. Perfect for young hitchhikers I guess.

Would probably not stay here again.
Show more']

owner_details:
["PRIME Tourist Location! Private room 2 in Midtown
4.70
(70 reviews)
·
\U000f0003
Superhost
·
New York, United States
Share
Save
Show all photos
Private room in rental unit hosted by Kapsun
2 guests · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1 shared bath
Self check-in
Check yourself in with the lockbox.
Great communication
95% of recent guests rated Kapsun 5-star in communication.
***PLEASE READ DETAILS BELOW BEFORE BOOKING!!***

Location! Location! Location!

Immerse yourself into the heart of Manhattan like no other. Located in Midtown, it is the most STRATEGIC location to be in to get to the majority of tourist destinations in less than 30 minutes via subway/bus.

Walking distance to:
Time Square - 15 mins walk
Empire State Building - 8 mins
Madison Square Garden -5 mins
Flatiron Building - 9 mins
Koreatown - 5 mins


*This is a HOSTEL type apartment, it consists of 3 private rooms and shared living quarters.

*Room is smaller than average and since it's centrally located there's a potential for noise in this area, but earplugs are provided in the front desk/table.

*Room is private and won't be shared with anyone else. But the rest of the amenities such as shower, toilet, living room are shared with other guests both male and female.

*Majority of the guests staying are young adults/backpackers therefore it's not suitable to parents with kids nor it's handicapped accessible

*Shoes must be left on the rack by the front entrance so please bring your own slippers

*Wooden bunk bed is rated to support 220lbs max weight/sleeping level

review:
["Jenn
October 2021
We recently just got home from staying at Jase's place; if you are looking for a great location that's accessible to a lot, this is the place! The location is very close to Times Square and next to quite a few subway stops that are easy to access. The apartment overall was very cozy and comfortable and worked well for two people, and Jase was very good at communicating back and forth. The only two cons I would say are that the door to get in the building can be a little finicky (we had to jiggle the door/latch a few times, but then other times it would open no problem), and it can get a little loud at night due to the hustle and bustle of the area, but other than that we greatly enjoyed our stay!
Show more", 'Stephen
September 2021
Nice place! Incredibly clean. Conveniently located. Be sure to arrive before 9pm in order to check in successfully.', 'Gabrielle
September 2021
Exceptionally clean !!! Only stayed one night but was pleasantly surprised with the top notch cleanliness.', 'Kathryn
September 2021
Great location for the price! Jase was also super responsive and helpful and had a hand dandy notebook with the lowdown on the apartment as well as happenings close by. Would definitely stay here again. Thanks for the great time in NYC!
Show more', 'Herb Brosbe
September 2021
I would not rent this apartment until Jase has new keys that actually work. It's a real pain to be praying for success as you gently jiggle the key to get it to work. Meanwhile other tenants enter seamlessly with their keys. The building is very old and with a lot of "delayed maintenance ". It's a 4 story walk up with narrow steep steps, so pack lightly. It is a very noisy location, so, if you're not city folks, bring ear plugs. On the positive side, Jase is very good at communication. It's a cozy nest for two and a great location if you like to walk and enjoy the people watching.
Show more', 'Kate
August 2021
Great place to stay - truly in the heart of everything. Easy communication with the host.']

Jenn
October 2021
We recently just got home from staying at Jase's place; if you are looking for a great location that's accessible to a lot, this is the place! The location is very close to Times Square and next to quite a few subway stops that are easy to access. The apartment overall was very cozy and comfortable and worked well for two people, and Jase was very good at communicating back and forth. The only two cons I would say are that the door to get in the building can be a little finicky (we had to jiggle the door/latch a few times, but then other times it would open no problem), and it can get a little loud at night due to the hustle and bustle of the area, but other than that we greatly enjoyed our stay!

We recently just got home from staying at Jase's place; if you are looking for a great location that's accessible to a lot, this is the place! The location is very close to Times Square and next to quite a few subway stops that are easy to access. The apartment overall was very cozy and comfortable and worked well for two people, and Jase was very good at communicating back and forth. The only two cons I would say are that the door to get in the building can be a little finicky (we had to jiggle the door/latch a few times, but then other times it would open no problem), and it can get a little loud at night due to the hustle and bustle of the area, but other than that we greatly enjoyed our stay!
Show more
Stephen
September 2021
Nice place! Incredibly clean. Conveniently located. Be sure to arrive before 9pm in order to check in successfully.
Gabrielle
September 2021
Exceptionally clean !!! Only stayed one night but was pleasantly surprised with the top notch cleanliness.
Kathryn
September 2021
Great location for the price! Jase was also super responsive and helpful and had a hand dandy notebook with the lowdown on the apartment as well as happenings close by. Would definitely stay here again. Thanks for the great time in NYC!
Show more
Herb Brosbe
September 2021
I would not rent this apartment until Jase has new keys that actually work. It's a real pain to be praying for success as you gently jiggle the key to get it to work. Meanwhile other tenants enter seamlessly with their keys. The building is very old and with a lot of "delayed maintenance ". It's a 4 story walk up with narrow steep steps, so pack lightly. It is a very noisy location, so, if you're not city folks, bring ear plugs. On the positive side, Jase is very good at communication. It's a cozy nest for two and a great location if you like to walk and enjoy the people watching.
Show more
Kate
August 2021
Great place to stay - truly in the heart of everything. Easy communication with the host.', '659 Reviews

['1 Bedroom in a Bed Stuy Brownstone
5.0

Brooklyn, New York, United States

Self check-in

Great check-in experience
100% of recent guests gave the check-in process a 5-star rating.
Post up in my cozy 1 bedroom apartment for a true Brooklyn Experience. Conveniently located on the edge of BedStuy and Crown Heights, this 3rd floor apartment is a perfect home base for you time in Brooklyn.

The space
This lovely 1 bedroom has an open plan kitchen and living room with a separate bedroom.

The living room has a couch, electric keyboard, dining table with seating for 4, and two beautiful windows overlooking a large tree in the inner court yard.

There is a full kitchen with everything you need to cook: pots, pans, dishes, spices, oils, coffee maker, electric kettle, stove, oven, microwave, frig/freezer, and dishwasher. There is also a lovely skylight, and overhead ventilation.

The bathroom has a tub/shower deep enough to really soak and good water pressure.

The bedroom has a full bed with all the linens provided. Guests have access to the closet and dresser for clothing storage. There is a full length mirror. The window looks out onto the same beautiful tree which makes the space feel extra peaceful and private.

listing_name: ['Great apartment with private bathroom and entrance']
listing_type: ['Private room in rental unit hosted by Jenny\n2 guests · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 private bath']
review:
["Anton
October 2021
Ted and Jenny are great! Ted is really knowledgeable and sweet. He was always willing to help and suggest places to go. Great place to stay. Clean, tidy and near the subway. Note there is no TV but come on, you're in NYC. There is literally something to do every hour of every day!
Show more", 'Megann
October 2021
Jennys place was clean and spacious. Very close to two subway lines for easy travel. The hosts communicate quickly, and are willing offer help navigating the subway system if needed, as well as offer places to go or eat. We had such a great stay!
Show more', 'Jessica
September 2021
In East Harlem near the 6 train. Great location to be away from the city but close enough to be up all hours of the night for travel. I felt safe even coming back 11pm or midnight. Walking in the other direction more towards Harlem you could catch the 2 or 3 train and lots of good options for food that way. We enjoyed having a home away from home that was less busy than a hotel would be in the city. Close to Central Park and La Guardia. We took the M60 to the airport with plenty of time. I say explore past the typical Manhattan experience and visit Ted & Jenny- very nice and helpful for our first NY trip.
Show more', 'Michael
September 2021
This was the perfect accommodation for my girl and I. Located near the 6 line made it easy to go up and down NY. The hosts were very respectful with privacy ( I think I only ran into them once) and they were kind enough to refill our water jugs every time we ran out. The location is perfect to go out and explore, get a good nights sleep and do it all over again. I would definitely recommend this Airbnb to anyone! Cheers!
Show more', 'Alexander
August 2021
Amazing stay and definitely recommend to anyone who needs an apartment in Manhattan.

Jenny and Tom accommodated me for very late hours on the day of arrival. Tom is extremely welcoming; going above and beyond by offering baked goods and coffee. The room is spacious allowing you to do your work if needed or just to relax. The place was very clean with a lot of convenient appliances available to you (mini-fridge, kettle, microwave).
Show more', 'May
August 2021
Jenny’s place located in a new townhouse, very safe community, the room is sparkling clean, walking distance to subway and bus station. Jenny’s husband Ted provided us nice fresh coffee every morning when we needed, very sweet and wonderful hospitality.
Definitely a Gem for New York visitors. Highly recommend!
Show more']

owner_details:
["Great apartment with private bathroom and entrance
4.85
(244 reviews)
·
\U000f0003
Superhost
·
New York, United States
Share
Save
Show all photos
Private room in rental unit hosted by Jenny
2 guests · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 private bath
Enhanced Clean
This Host committed to Airbnb's 5-step enhanced cleaning process. Show more
Great check-in experience
100% of recent guests gave the check-in process a 5-star rating.
Highly rated Host
Jenny has received 5-star ratings from 100% of recent guests.
The space
Completely private room in newer townhouse with it's own separate entrance and bathroom, a bay window, 1/2 kitchen with small refrigerator, coffee maker, toaster and microwave oven. Close to east and west subways: 2, 3, 6, and MetroNorth. Easy walk to Central Park. Sunny, clean and comfortable. Wireless internet in room. It's an easy walking distance to Red Rooster, Amy Ruth's, Sylvia's, Patsy's, Orbit, Harlem Tavern, the Apollo and the Studio Museum. In three minutes you can walk to La Marqueta and get the best bread in the city. The Townhouse is on tree lined street, all townhouses on the block are owner occupied. The room gets a lot of light. There's a locked door which connects to the owner's apartment. If you want to have linens washed just unlock the door and put laundry in the provided basket.

There's an olympic size outdoor pool, free, a few blocks away. It's open summers only, from July 4th until the end of August.

Minimum stay of 5 nights.

- Private studio apartment with private bathroom and half-kitchen (sm. refrigerator, coffee maker, convection oven)
- Second floor of brownstone building
- Clean and secure
- Harlem neighborhood close to Central Park
- Fresh bed linens and towels included
- Internet wifi
- Air Conditioning
- Quiet tree lined street
- Queen size mattress
- Close to express trains 2,3 and local 6, markets, and restaurants
- Coffee maker, small refrigerator, microwave, dishes and utensils

There is no tv in the room.

.Rate includes utilities: heat, hot water, electric, wifi internet, linens
.Owner lives in building for immediate assistance
.All questions answered


We try not to overbook, however occasionally it happens so we have added check-in and check-out times. Check out time is 12:00 noon. Of course, we will work with our guests as we can to accommodate travel plans, especially later departure times. Just let us know. If somehow another guest overlaps we can keep your luggage safe until you need it. Check in time is anytime after 3:00 p.m. Earlier check-in can be accommodated, as long as the previous guests have departed the day before and it is arranged a few days ahead of time.

review:
["Eugenia
June 2021
place is as described and very conveniently located. it's a bit loud at night being above a bar, and room is clean but small. overall a good place to stay if you're planning to be out most of the day and just need a place to store your things and sleep.
Show more", 'Cameron
May 2021
I really enjoyed my stay at Kyle and gave it 4 stars.
The location was BEYOND amazing. so close to everything and there was a deli right downstairs!
The room is small but they use the space well so there is room for storage and your things.

I took one star off because I don't think it' s mentioned in the listing but the room is over a bar Taboo with a backyard area that can become very noisy. The bar shut down the backyard at 11pm on weekdays 12 midnight on weekends.
I don't know if that is set in stone or a response to de Blasio's pandemic guidelines but the fact is you can easily hear voices scream-singing "happy birthday" even 6 floors up.

If you are deeply sensive to noise you might want to consider bringing ear plugs or a white noise machine.
Show more', 'Suraj
July 2020
Very nice place and location. Super clean and the AC rocks.

Great price for a month stay.
Show more']

The room is small but they use the space well so there is room for storage and your things.

I took one star off because I don't think it' s mentioned in the listing but the room is over a bar Taboo with a backyard area that can become very noisy. The bar shut down the backyard at 11pm on weekdays 12 midnight on weekends.
I don't know if that is set in stone or a response to de Blasio's pandemic guidelines but the fact is you can easily hear voices scream-singing "happy birthday" even 6 floors up.

If you are deeply sensive to noise you might want to consider bringing ear plugs or a white noise machine.
Show more
Suraj
July 2020
Very nice place and location. Super clean and the AC rocks.

Great price for a month stay.

Here are some things we noted that may help future visitors.

Rhonda is an amazing host. She was very communicative and made sure we were comfortable for our stay.

Here are some things we noted that may help future visitors.

1. Heat. it got pretty hot with the heat on. Rhonda informed us that the temperature was controlled for all levels in the basement so we kept our window open and it helped with keeping it cooler. Plus the ceiling fan circulated the cool air.
2. The neighbors have a dog, it barks whenever you come close to the bathroom and when you initially walk into the apartment.
3. It had just snowed when we got there and parking was pretty tough. I’m assuming when there isn’t a foot of snow on the ground there will be more spaces
4. We didn’t hear any trains but there were a lot of sirens at night that were pretty close to the area
5. The sink in the bathroom is very small. We used the kitchen sink to wash and brush our teeth.
6. No dishwasher, have to hand wash all dishes
7. Very clean! Smelt amazing!
8. Location was decent. About 20-30 min to city and Brooklyn bridge park.
9. The couch/futon is not very comfortable. There are a couple rods that run in it and make it very tough to get comfortable when sitting to watch tv.
10. Tv has fire stick, Netflix, and sling Tv. Tons of movie options!
Show more

review:
['Emily
October 2021
I had a great experience staying at Jolly’s place. Everything was very clean and it is right around the corner from the subway station. I felt safe walking around and there are a ton of great restaurants nearby. The stairs to get to the fifth floor were a solid mini workout everyday.
Show more', 'Lucas
October 2021
This place was a great value! I really enjoyed staying here.', 'Kamil
September 2021
Great room. Host is super nice and helpful. He even helped me to carry my super heavy suitcase as it’s 5th floor walk up. I could also check out late as I had evening flight. Thanks a lot! Highly recommended!
Show more', 'Danya
August 2021
Jolly’s place was the most perfect home base for my week of gallery visits in NY. So peaceful, cozy, and thoughtfully put together. Felt so warm & welcomed! Location is exceptional in East Harlem, right off the 6 subway with lots of local businesses to eat at and great bodega around the corner.
Show more', 'Michelle
August 2021
Jolly’s place is an amazing find! It is furnished with a true designer’s eye. The flights of stairs are certainly quite the workout, but the hosts are great about helping you carry any luggage. They were also very accommodating to my circumstances; I was able to store a suitcase for 2 days after I left their place! One of the hosts was living there while I was staying, and they were super friendly. But they also gave me space, and I noticed and appreciated thet. The subway station nearby is also super convenient for taking the 6 train down to the city! I’m super happy with my stay, and you will be too!
Show more', "Clayton
June 2021
This is a great spot for anyone who wants the NYC experience. Located in what people like to call Spanish Harlem, the location offers many Latin American restaurants and stores. Ideal Market is the store i bought my groceries from and is just a short 2 minute walk from the apartment. Subway station is just a minute from the apartment as well and gets you to downtown super quick. Central park is also a quick walk away. Apartment room is very nice and has a good view, doesn't face the street, and is keeps cool when AC is on. Bathroom is also nice and clean and you even get city view while bathing. overall great place to stay. Jolly is very responsive.
Show more"]

August 2021
Jolly’s place was the most perfect home base for my week of gallery visits in NY. So peaceful, cozy, and thoughtfully put together. Felt so warm & welcomed! Location is exceptional in East Harlem, right off the 6 subway with lots of local businesses to eat at and great bodega around the corner.

August 2021
Jolly’s place is an amazing find! It is furnished with a true designer’s eye. The flights of stairs are certainly quite the workout, but the hosts are great about helping you carry any luggage. One of the hosts was living there while I was staying, and they were super friendly. But they also gave me space, and I noticed and appreciated thet. The subway station nearby is also super convenient for taking the 6 train down to the city! I’m super happy with my stay, and you will be too!

review:
['Jeanne
September 2021
My stay at Joshua’s place was FANTASTIC. It exceeded my expectations and honestly I don’t think I would want to stay anywhere else in NYC unless it was one of their other units. August 2021
Fantastic location, extremely clean and well-serviced apartment, Josh was extremely helpful during check-in and also provided flexibility around the dates of my stay. listing_name: ['Manhattan Cute Cozy Beach-themed Room on Hudson']
listing_type: ['Private room in condominium (condo) hosted by Chip\n1 guest · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1.5 shared baths']
review:
['Keely
June 2021
Due to unforeseen circumstances I never got the chance to stay at this Airbnb - though I did pay in full for the month of May.

However, because my host was very understanding and patient while I was trying to figure out whether to stay in NY or move back to Pa, I feel compelled to give them a favorable review.

The apartment itself is located on the top floor of a small-ish apartment building on Riverside Drive in Hamilton Heights. There’s an elevator and Chip offered to help me with my suitcase if I needed it. You will be situated right across from the Hudson River and the one time I visited the park I found it to be one of the few quiet places in the city where you can actually relax and enjoy nature for a few minutes.

Chip and his wife Kathy go out of their way to make you feel at home. I was given a set of keys (which I never used) to the downstairs front door and the mailbox, and was told to make myself at home in the kitchen. There were two other Airbnb guests along with the hosts and their two young adult children. Kathy cooks every night and this Airbnb has much more of an inclusive family vibe than any other ones that I’ve stayed at!

The room itself is small, but clean and cozy. You’ll have plenty of room for clothing and Kathy even put the bed on risers for me to create some additional storage underneath. If you’re looking to stay in the Hamilton Heights area, I completely recommend this room! There’s also parking nearby and tons of stores and restaurants on Broadway!
Show more', 'Aria
October 2019
I enjoyed my stay with Chips and his family. I found Chip, Cathy and their family members very nice and friendly. They put me in the room with additional amenities: fridge, microwave in the room. There were other airbnb guests staying in the apartment, but everyone was nice and friendly. The neighborhood was also nice and safe. Everything was in walking distance. There were lots of good Latin American food in the neighborhood + 24/7 Deli stores. Overall, it was a great stay.
Show more', 'Solomon
September 2019
Super cute space in beautiful West Side Harlem! Hosts are super friendly and helpful! Would definitely stay again!', 'Haley
May 2018
So great I decided to stay an extra month!! Kathy really makes the place a home <3', "Sophie
January 2018
Chip and Kathy are great host. They are attentive and generous. I got sick while here and Kathy provided tea and soup. Chip also gave me a ride to my new apartment. The other people living there are also very friendly and kind. Great hospitality shown by everyone. Just keep in mind that the room is as small but if you're traveling on your own it's fine. They also have other rooms in the same apartment up as airbnb listings. Check those place first if you require a larger room.
Show more", 'Sara
January 2018
Great stay, great friendly host!!! Loved the stay']

5 stars!! Very small private room (55 sq ft) in large apartment. Bright and sunny space. Practical for traveler or student. Full kitchen, 1.5 bathrooms shared with other guests. Free wifi. Washer/dryer in kitchen. Elevator in building. Use the kitchen to cook whatever you like.

The space
All of our guests love this space! It’s very small but extremely comfortable and cozy. Read the reviews.

Cute, clean, light, functional and airy space.
Raised twin XL bed with comfortable memory foam mattress, bedside table, small dresser, shelves, hanging clothes rack, under bed storage bins, storage stool/table, full-length mirror, pastel floral decor, indirect lighting, huge north-east facing window for maximum sunlight.

Everything is included (electricity, wifi, kitchen washer/dryer and laundry detergent, cable in the kitchen, window fan, hangers, towels, linens, pillows, blankets, etc.).

Fantastic view of the GWB, Hudson River, Riverside Park, Little Red Lighthouse; directly across the street from the new Hudson River pedestrian overpass to the river.

4.6', "Keely
June 2021
Due to unforeseen circumstances I never got the chance to stay at this Airbnb - though I did pay in full for the month of May.

However, because my host was very understanding and patient while I was trying to figure out whether to stay in NY or move back to Pa, I feel compelled to give them a favorable review.

The apartment itself is located on the top floor of a small-ish apartment building on Riverside Drive in Hamilton Heights. There’s an elevator and Chip offered to help me with my suitcase if I needed it. You will be situated right across from the Hudson River and the one time I visited the park I found it to be one of the few quiet places in the city where you can actually relax and enjoy nature for a few minutes.

Chip and his wife Kathy go out of their way to make you feel at home. I was given a set of keys (which I never used) to the downstairs front door and the mailbox, and was told to make myself at home in the kitchen. There were two other Airbnb guests along with the hosts and their two young adult children. Kathy cooks every night and this Airbnb has much more of an inclusive family vibe than any other ones that I’ve stayed at!

The room itself is small, but clean and cozy. You’ll have plenty of room for clothing and Kathy even put the bed on risers for me to create some additional storage underneath. If you’re looking to stay in the Hamilton Heights area, I completely recommend this room! There’s also parking nearby and tons of stores and restaurants on Broadway!
Show more
Aria
October 2019
I enjoyed my stay with Chips and his family. I found Chip, Cathy and their family members very nice and friendly. They put me in the room with additional amenities: fridge, microwave in the room. There were other airbnb guests staying in the apartment, but everyone was nice and friendly. The neighborhood was also nice and safe. Everything was in walking distance. There were lots of good Latin American food in the neighborhood + 24/7 Deli stores. Overall, it was a great stay.
Show more
Solomon
September 2019
Super cute space in beautiful West Side Harlem! Hosts are super friendly and helpful! Would definitely stay again!

So great I decided to stay an extra month!! Kathy really makes the place a home <3

Chip and Kathy are great host. They are attentive and generous. I got sick while here and Kathy provided tea and soup. Chip also gave me a ride to my new apartment. The other people living there are also very friendly and kind. Great hospitality shown by everyone. Just keep in mind that the room is as small but if you're traveling on your own it's fine. They also have other rooms in the same apartment up as airbnb listings. Check those place first if you require a larger room.

great place to stay me and my daughter felt like true New Yorkers so close to the subway and safe clean and very cozy and comfortable the bed was so comfortable.

February 2021
The apt was very clean. There was a wonderful bed set up and lots of kitchen appliances.

Rhonda communicated very quickly and thoroughly throughout the stay.

I highly recommend.
Show more', 'Natalie
February 2021
Rhonda is an amazing host. She was very communicative and made sure we were comfortable for our stay.

Here are some things we noted that may help future visitors.

1. Heat. it got pretty hot with the heat on. Rhonda informed us that the temperature was controlled for all levels in the basement so we kept our window open and it helped with keeping it cooler. Plus the ceiling fan circulated the cool air.
2. The neighbors have a dog, it barks whenever you come close to the bathroom and when you initially walk into the apartment.
3. It had just snowed when we got there and parking was pretty tough. I’m assuming when there isn’t a foot of snow on the ground there will be more spaces
4. We didn’t hear any trains but there were a lot of sirens at night that were pretty close to the area
5. The sink in the bathroom is very small. We used the kitchen sink to wash and brush our teeth.
6. No dishwasher, have to hand wash all dishes
7. Very clean! Smelt amazing!
8. Location was decent. About 20-30 min to city and Brooklyn bridge park.
9. The couch/futon is not very comfortable. There are a couple rods that run in it and make it very tough to get comfortable when sitting to watch tv.
10. Tv has fire stick, Netflix, and sling Tv. Tons of movie options!

February 2021
I liked the apartment, but it is located on the top floor (I have an injured (Website hidden by Airbnb) that wasn’t too ideal. There isn’t any parking on the block which sucked. Rhonda was great with communication, everything else was nice.

Natalie
February 2021
Rhonda is an amazing host. She was very communicative and made sure we were comfortable for our stay.

Here are some things we noted that may help future visitors.

1. Heat. it got pretty hot with the heat on. Rhonda informed us that the temperature was controlled for all levels in the basement so we kept our window open and it helped with keeping it cooler. Plus the ceiling fan circulated the cool air.
2. The neighbors have a dog, it barks whenever you come close to the bathroom and when you initially walk into the apartment.
3. It had just snowed when we got there and parking was pretty tough. I’m assuming when there isn’t a foot of snow on the ground there will be more spaces
4. We didn’t hear any trains but there were a lot of sirens at night that were pretty close to the area
5. The sink in the bathroom is very small. We used the kitchen sink to wash and brush our teeth.
6. No dishwasher, have to hand wash all dishes
7. Very clean! Smelt amazing!
8. Location was decent. About 20-30 min to city and Brooklyn bridge park.
9. The couch/futon is not very comfortable. There are a couple rods that run in it and make it very tough to get comfortable when sitting to watch tv.
10. Tv has fire stick, Netflix, and sling Tv. Tons of movie options!
Show more

listing_name: ['LONG TERM RENTAL,STUDIO N8 IN THE VILLAGE']
listing_type: ['Entire rental unit hosted by Gaia&Pietro\n2 guests · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath']
review:
["Marnet
October 2019
Tidy studio on a quiet street in THE BEST LOCATION in NYC..the West Village. Great water pressure for long hot shower, wonderful Egyptian cotton sheets on comfortable double bed. Good heat when needed. Plenty of closet & drawer space. Small well equipped kitchen. One block from Health & Harmony for natural foods and near Brooklyn Fare supermarket. Great eateries like The Butcher's Daughter on Hudson, best vegan French restaurant ever at 20 Christopher St. called Delice & Sarrasin, charming coffee/tea place called Oslo nearby and yummy bagels at Murray's, 13th & 6th Ave. Get a great inexpensive massage(and nails) at the Chinese place on Hudson St. one block past Charles St. Close to bus, subway and The Whitney Museum for modern art. Wish I could live here. Prompt response from housekeeper for any issues. Safe, charming, vibrant area. One should know there are 33 steps up to the apartment but well worth the climb! You feel part of the real NYC staying here rather than a hotel and the building itself is quiet with a little place to sit in the back. A REALLY GOOD DEAL!
Show more", "Alexander
September 2019
Didn't receive check-in instructions and the host was unresponsive so we were locked out. Major inconvenience and a huge bummer, as the location was absolutely perfect.
Show more", 'Rebecca
December 2019
We enjoyed a lot staying at this place. It was in a very nice neighborhood and the check-in went very well due to the code given in advance. Even though we asked quite late for a late check-out, it was made possible with fast responses.

We can highly recommend this place for your stay in New York!
Show more', 'Molly
October 2019
great location! great apartment!', 'Scott
September 2019
Amazing location and access to Citibikes and subway. Great communication and the apartment was nicely set-up with a small but very functional kitchen and good refrigerator and freezer. Great stay and would highly recommend it - the location is awesome if you want to enjoy nyc in a different way away from the lights of Times Square.
Show more', 'Roy
September 2019
Great apartment in great a location, just few meters from "freinds" apartment, awesome restaurants and bars, quick walk to all main stations.
Quick walk to Soho center, little Italy, Chelsea market and a lot more.
Highly recommended!

Thank u so much Gaia and Pietro!
Show more']

Marnet
October 2019
Tidy studio on a quiet street in THE BEST LOCATION in NYC..the West Village. Great water pressure for long hot shower, wonderful Egyptian cotton sheets on comfortable double bed. Good heat when needed. Plenty of closet & drawer space. Small well equipped kitchen. One block from Health & Harmony for natural foods and near Brooklyn Fare supermarket. Great eateries like The Butcher's Daughter on Hudson, best vegan French restaurant ever at 20 Christopher St. called Delice & Sarrasin, charming coffee/tea place called Oslo nearby and yummy bagels at Murray's, 13th & 6th Ave. Get a great inexpensive massage(and nails) at the Chinese place on Hudson St. one block past Charles St. Close to bus, subway and The Whitney Museum for modern art. Wish I could live here. Prompt response from housekeeper for any issues. Safe, charming, vibrant area. One should know there are 33 steps up to the apartment but well worth the climb! You feel part of the real NYC staying here rather than a hotel and the building itself is quiet with a little place to sit in the back. A REALLY GOOD DEAL!
Show more
Alexander
September 2019
Didn't receive check-in instructions and the host was unresponsive so we were locked out. Major inconvenience and a huge bummer, as the location was absolutely perfect.
Show more
Rebecca
December 2019
We enjoyed a lot staying at this place. It was in a very nice neighborhood and the check-in went very well due to the code given in advance. Even though we asked quite late for a late check-out, it was made possible with fast responses.

We can highly recommend this place for your stay in New York!
Show more
Molly
October 2019
great location! great apartment!
Scott
September 2019
Amazing location and access to Citibikes and subway. Great communication and the apartment was nicely set-up with a small but very functional kitchen and good refrigerator and freezer. Great stay and would highly recommend it - the location is awesome if you want to enjoy nyc in a different way away from the lights of Times Square.
Show more
Roy
September 2019
Great apartment in great a location, just few meters from "freinds" apartment, awesome restaurants and bars, quick walk to all main stations.
Quick walk to Soho center, little Italy, Chelsea market and a lot more.
Highly recommended!

Thank u so much Gaia and Pietro!

listing_type: ['Private room in rental unit hosted by Kyle\n1 guest · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 shared bath']
review:
["Eugenia
June 2021
place is as described and very conveniently located. it's a bit loud at night being above a bar, and room is clean but small. overall a good place to stay if you're planning to be out most of the day and just need a place to store your things and sleep.
Show more", 'Cameron
May 2021
I really enjoyed my stay at Kyle and gave it 4 stars.
The location was BEYOND amazing. so close to everything and there was a deli right downstairs!
The room is small but they use the space well so there is room for storage and your things.

I took one star off because I don't think it' s mentioned in the listing but the room is over a bar Taboo with a backyard area that can become very noisy. The bar shut down the backyard at 11pm on weekdays 12 midnight on weekends.
I don't know if that is set in stone or a response to de Blasio's pandemic guidelines but the fact is you can easily hear voices scream-singing "happy birthday" even 6 floors up.

If you are deeply sensive to noise you might want to consider bringing ear plugs or a white noise machine.
Show more', 'Suraj
July 2020
Very nice place and location. Super clean and the AC rocks.

Great price for a month stay.
Show more']

Located right in the heart of Manhattan, Midtown area. It's the most strategic spot to be in with bus terminal and train/subway stations just a few minutes walk.

Walking distance to:
Penn Station/Madison Square Garden – (right outside 1min)
Port Authority Bus Terminal- 10 mins on foot
Time Square - 12 mins on foot
The Vessel – 12 mins on foot
Empire State Building - 13 mins on foot


Apartment has 2 bedrooms. Living room is turned into a shared space facility with 3 guests currently staying long term. You won't have access to the living room and balcony area. Accessible areas only include the kitchen and bathroom.
=====================================
Completely safe tourist area, the apartment has a doorman surveilling the area 24 hours and the building has an elevator. It’s located on the 5th floor.

It has amazing views from the balcony overlooking the Hudson Yards. Wifi included and a full kitchen that consists of stove, microwave, coffee maker, refrigerator, water dispenser, pots and utensils.

Laundry room is located at the basement which costs about $5 total

place is as described and very conveniently located. it's a bit loud at night being above a bar, and room is clean but small. overall a good place to stay if you're planning to be out most of the day and just need a place to store your things and sleep.
Show more
Cameron
May 2021
I really enjoyed my stay at Kyle and gave it 4 stars.
The location was BEYOND amazing. so close to everything and there was a deli right downstairs!
The room is small but they use the space well so there is room for storage and your things.

I took one star off because I don't think it' s mentioned in the listing but the room is over a bar Taboo with a backyard area that can become very noisy. The bar shut down the backyard at 11pm on weekdays 12 midnight on weekends.
I don't know if that is set in stone or a response to de Blasio's pandemic guidelines but the fact is you can easily hear voices scream-singing "happy birthday" even 6 floors up.

If you are deeply sensive to noise you might want to consider bringing ear plugs or a white noise machine.

July 2020
Very nice place and location. Super clean and the AC rocks.

Great price for a month stay.

review:
["Jenn
October 2021
We recently just got home from staying at Jase's place; if you are looking for a great location that's accessible to a lot, this is the place! The location is very close to Times Square and next to quite a few subway stops that are easy to access. The apartment overall was very cozy and comfortable and worked well for two people, and Jase was very good at communicating back and forth. The only two cons I would say are that the door to get in the building can be a little finicky (we had to jiggle the door/latch a few times, but then other times it would open no problem), and it can get a little loud at night due to the hustle and bustle of the area, but other than that we greatly enjoyed our stay!

September 2021
Nice place! Incredibly clean. Conveniently located. Be sure to arrive before 9pm in order to check in successfully.', 'Gabrielle

September 2021

September 2021
I would not rent this apartment until Jase has new keys that actually work. It's a real pain to be praying for success as you gently jiggle the key to get it to work. It is a very noisy location, so, if you're not city folks, bring ear plugs. On the positive side, Jase is very good at communication. Jenn
October 2021
We recently just got home from staying at Jase's place; if you are looking for a great location that's accessible to a lot, this is the place! The location is very close to Times Square and next to quite a few subway stops that are easy to access. The apartment overall was very cozy and comfortable and worked well for two people, and Jase was very good at communicating back and forth. The only two cons I would say are that the door to get in the building can be a little finicky (we had to jiggle the door/latch a few times, but then other times it would open no problem), and it can get a little loud at night due to the hustle and bustle of the area, but other than that we greatly enjoyed our stay!
Show more
Stephen
September 2021
Nice place! Incredibly clean. Conveniently located. Be sure to arrive before 9pm in order to check in successfully.
Gabrielle
September 2021
Exceptionally clean !!! Only stayed one night but was pleasantly surprised with the top notch cleanliness.
Kathryn
September 2021
Great location for the price! Jase was also super responsive and helpful and had a hand dandy notebook with the lowdown on the apartment as well as happenings close by. Would definitely stay here again. Thanks for the great time in NYC!
Show more
Herb Brosbe
September 2021
I would not rent this apartment until Jase has new keys that actually work. It's a real pain to be praying for success as you gently jiggle the key to get it to work. Meanwhile other tenants enter seamlessly with their keys. The building is very old and with a lot of "delayed maintenance ". It's a 4 story walk up with narrow steep steps, so pack lightly. It is a very noisy location, so, if you're not city folks, bring ear plugs. On the positive side, Jase is very good at communication. It's a cozy nest for two and a great location if you like to walk and enjoy the people watching.
Show more

August 2021

Where you’ll be
New York, United States
This neighborhood is called: Chelsea. 
     There are literally hundreds of small unique restaurants, shops, book stores, galleries, theaters and pubs in Chelsea.  You will find, gently-strolling, pedestrian traffic at all hours of the day of evening.
   Chelsea is not a dark, or dangerous area.   It's a neighborhood that's full of life.
      Many artists, musicians, writers, actors, FIT students, other graduate students, similar intelligentsia, and creative people live in Chelsea.  I think you'll like it here.
     You can get anywhere in New York City quickly and easily from here.
       The subway station is two blocks away (a two minute walk).
Midtown Manhattan is very central and safe. Police station 2 blocks away. We're located within walking distance of Theater District, Penn Station, FIT, Madison Square Garden, High Line Park

Come experience unmatched luxury and hospitality at Aum. The space was designed by an award winning ex-WeWork interior designer with focus on holistic living which includes memory foam mattress bed, ergonomically designed workspace, Smart TV, high speed internet, fully loaded kitchen, free breakfast, lavish shared bathroom, 2 minutes from subway and steps away from riverside park and Hudson river.


Relax:

· Highest Quality Memory foam mattress

· Finest cotton linens, plush pillows, and blankets to ensure you sleep like a baby. We also provide complimentary ear plugs to keep out New York City noise

Work:

· AumWorkspace designed workspace which includes top of the line ergonomic chair, spacious table with storage, naturally elements such as paintings and plants to make the space lively and spark creativity

· Ultra-high-speed optical fiber internet

Play:

owner_details:
["Cozy Art Room with Cat
4.88
(76 reviews)
·
Brooklyn, New York, United States
Share
Save
Show all photos
Private room in rental unit hosted by Yang
1 guest · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 private bath
Great location
90% of recent guests gave the location a 5-star rating.
Great check-in experience
95% of recent guests gave the check-in process a 5-star rating.
Highly rated Host
Yang has received 5-star ratings from 90% of recent guests.
Cozy room with a single bed 1 block from the J train. The bathroom and kitchen are shared. I paint and pole dance in the living room area and you're welcome to try out the pole! There's a cute kitty cat named Monkey who lives here, so please do not book the room if you are allergic to or dislike cats. My apartment is conveniently located by the Kosiascko J, which takes you to downtown Manhattan in 20 minutes. Tons of cafes, bars, clubs, and restaurants nearby.


The apt is on a 3rd floor walk up and we have roof access one floor up. We have lots of cooking utensils, fast wifi, art and books, projector, and an Xpole 45mm spin dance pole in the living room.

Tastefully furnished and fully equipped studio in Harlem, one of the hubs of New York City. In this large sunny space, you will be just one or two city blocks from main subway (metro) lines on the Eastside (4, 5 & 6 trains) and on the Westside (2& 3 ) trains. Just steps away from great shopping on 125th Street, including Bed Bath & Beyond, Victoria's Secret, The Gap, Banana Republic, etc. It is also a food and club lovers haven, with many restaurants and bars to meet any taste or budget.


A lovely, spacious and sunny studio apartment for your exclusive use. A fully equipped kitchen where you may cook your own meals to save money. It is like having your second home in the heart of Harlem.

listing_type: ['Entire rental unit hosted by Bah\n2 guests · Studio · 1 bed · 1 bath']
review:
["Lynn
October 2021
Bah's place is a nice, small apartment with plenty of windows, a room that combines the sleeping area and the living/workspace area, a detached kitchen with many amenities, a bathroom, a guest closet, and good WiFi. I stayed for a couple of weeknights and appreciated walking to and from the neighborhood and its proximity to Flatbush Ave, a big grocery store and take-out affordable Caribbean food restaurants, the B41 route, and the B & Q lines. With work and family commitments and visiting when the COVID-19 vaccination rate in Brooklyn was about 65% and there was substantial transmission, I did not get to know anything about indoor public spaces or night life in the neighborhood. Most people I passed in the streets wore masks. One of the best aspects of staying there was that Bah kindly let me check in early after a red-eye flight.
Show more", 'Paul
October 2021
Great stay nice quiet cozy place . I recommend for a getaway.', 'Kelsey
October 2021
This place is simple and perfect for your needs. Bah includes little touches to make it feel like a home with good kitchen supplies and plants. Good for the value!', 'Perez
October 2021
Amazing host. All beautiful and clean, she had amazing books, a nice tub for immersion bath and even a yoga mat!
Any detail missed. I even got
Parking close the property!
Show more', 'Kathy
October 2021
This is a great little studio apartment, and Bah is a great hostess. She went out of her way to make sure our stay was comfortable. The location was perfect for us, and the price was very reasonable. We feel fortunate to have found the place!
Show more', 'Andrea
October 2021
This is a great place for the price you are paying. It was super clean and Bah was an amazing host. Very close to the subway lines as well.']

Lynn
October 2021
Bah's place is a nice, small apartment with plenty of windows, a room that combines the sleeping area and the living/workspace area, a detached kitchen with many amenities, a bathroom, a guest closet, and good WiFi. I stayed for a couple of weeknights and appreciated walking to and from the neighborhood and its proximity to Flatbush Ave, a big grocery store and take-out affordable Caribbean food restaurants, the B41 route, and the B & Q lines. With work and family commitments and visiting when the COVID-19 vaccination rate in Brooklyn was about 65% and there was substantial transmission, I did not get to know anything about indoor public spaces or night life in the neighborhood. Most people I passed in the streets wore masks. One of the best aspects of staying there was that Bah kindly let me check in early after a red-eye flight.
Show more

review:

Alan's place is very clean and the bed was extremely comfortable. Check-in was easy and Alan was friendly and amenable when I asked for flexibility with check-in times.

October 2021

The place itself is comfortable, clean, and has a really fun, engaging vibe. Pro Tip: if you’re not used to sleeping with City sounds, – personally, I had no problem even though I’m from a quieter neighborhood – earplugs and/or turning on the bathroom fan for some white noise should do the trick.

Perfect little getaway for a dream stay in Manhattan's Lower East Side neighborhood!

A prewar walkup – 2nd floor don't worry :) – our apartment is right in the heart of one of the best areas in NYC, with amazing restaurants and cafes/bars, the best shopping, walking tours and museums, and many beautiful landmarks and points of interest all nearby / walking distance.

We are very responsive and can give you recommendations in the hopes that you will fall in love with the LES as much as we have.


All the essentials for a landing pad in NYC. The bedroom window faces the historic Orchard Street (where street vendors used to pack the street), gets plenty of sunlight during the day and is nice and dark in the evening.

We have a cute little living room table where you can have your morning coffee before you start exploring downtown Manhattan.

Also, we are very responsive. If there is anything you need or are missing, we will do our best to accommodate you.

One note, it can get a little noisy on the weekend given that it's such a popular destination for locals and tourists alike.

Where you’ll be
New York, United States
The Lower East Side of Manhattan is full of history and culture, so suffice it to say it’s one of the most interesting parts of NYC for a weekend of wandering. Historically a Jewish and immigrant neighborhood, it was known as a center for anarchism and radical politics throughout the 20th century, and has now been fully gentrified and packed with hipster-baiting cafes, galleries, and shops on every corner. Despite this polished progression, however, the artistic and bohemian spirit that characterized the neighborhood persists, and everything from the coffee shops to the bars has a unique and creative edge. There are endless things to do and see here, so if you’ve got a full day or more, this is the part of NYC where you should do it. (Adapted from Culture Trip)

Our place isn't just all about the LES, however. Within 10-15 minutes, you can find yourself in SoHo, The East Village, Chinatown, and several other amazing neighborhoods with a vast history of their own.

owner_details:
['Private Park Slope Brooklyn Hideaway
4.59
(224 reviews)
·
Brooklyn, New York, United States
Share
Save

Entire rental unit hosted by Andrew
2 guests · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
Entire home
You’ll have the apartment to yourself.
Enhanced Clean
This Host committed to Airbnb's 5-step enhanced cleaning process. Show more
Self check-in
Check yourself in with the keypad.
Great communication
90% of recent guests rated Andrew 5-star in communication.
A completely private hideaway in gorgeous Park Slope. Includes a separate entrance, private bathroom, spacious studio, and a backyard patio garden.

A cost-effective basement studio in a beautiful Brooklyn neighborhood. Includes air conditioning and climate controlled heating. Steps from gourmet restaurants, Prospect Park, and the subway.

Perfect for 2 out-and-about guests! It's a great landing spot in an accessible, cute, and safe neighborhood.


A beautiful basement hideaway in an historic brick townhouse in gorgeous Park Slope.

Your completely private space includes a separate front entrance and access to our backyard patio and garden. The backyard patio includes a dining table with 6 seats, a bench loveseat underneath a flowering Japanese maple, and a growing garden in the spring, summer, and fall.

The large, fully furnished basement includes a queen bed for 2 guests. In addition, there is a stylishly appointed full bathroom with a comfortable standing shower.

There is no full kitchen. However, for your convenience, we have provided a mini-refrigerator to store food and beverages, a microwave to heat up leftovers, and a toaster oven for simple meals.

This is a perfect flat for a value-conscious couple. A quiet, private place in a top neighborhood at a great value. The 4th Avenue - 9th Street subway station is only steps away.

Where you’ll be
Brooklyn, New York, United States
Park Slope is a beautiful, landmark neighborhood, including tree lined streets, gourmet restaurants, easy access to transportation, and Prospect Park - the largest public park in Brooklyn.

In 2010, New York Magazine selected Park Slope as the finest neighborhood in New York City, citing its overall safety, fine dining, eclectic nightlife, local shopping, and close proximity to public transit, green space, quality housing, and creative capital. In 2007, Park Slope was named one of the "Greatest Neighborhoods in America" by the American Planning Association "for its architectural and historical features and its diverse mix of residents and businesses". And in December 2006, Natural Home magazine named Park Slope one of America's ten best neighborhoods, citing area greenspaces, neighborhood gathering spaces, local farmer's markets, strong public transportation, and interesting locally owned businesses.

Great location
90% of recent guests gave the location a 5-star rating.
This apartment is a 1-minute walk from 3 major subway lines, and centrally-located between midtown and downtown - offering easy access to most of NYC’s tourist attractions. It is situated on the border between the young and stylish East Village and Lower East Side neighborhoods, surrounded by affordable restaurants, cafes, bars, galleries and shops. and a street-facing window. The rest of the apartment is yours to enjoy as well, welcome!


* To book, you can book instantly and please tell me a little bit about yourself and your arrival/departure time. I'm also happy to answer any questions you may have. I look forward to hearing from you! Best, Jackie *

Situated in a recently-renovated two-bedroom apartment, your private room is furnished with brand-new amenities, including a desk, ultra-comfortable full-size Hybrid Innerspring Mattress, and soft towels.

Your room has a east-facing window with lots of light and a blackout shade. It overlooks a park cross the street. Earplugs are provided in your side table for your comfort. The room has its own air conditioning during the summer and its own heater during winter.
