Great location
100% of recent guests gave the location a 5-star rating.
- Beautiful sunny apartment near by Gramercy Park. Cozy, comfortable, got everything you need. Full size bed & a sofa bed can into bed.
- You have PRIVATE KITCHEN, enjoy your private.
- Free WI-Fi
- Work Space
- My street allows FREE PARKING.
- Old Building but Great Location, only 2 blocks from N,Q,R,W,4,5,6,L subway lines & Union Square , few minutes walk to East & West Villages & so much more. stores, restaurants, bars,


Who do you recommend? What kind of room?

The space
--Recommended for--
• Want to enjoy sightseeing, shopping, and gourmet food
(one of the central areas of Manhattan with convenient transportation)
• Want to save money on food by cooking for yourself
• Want to save on accommodation costs with minimal facilities.
• Go out during the day or night and only need a place to sleep.
• Want to enjoy a 100-year-old building.

--Room--
• Twin Over Full Bunk Bed + Sofa bed
• Private Kitchen
-Plates, bowls, cutlery, cutting boards, knives, pots, pans available
-No seasoning
• Bedrooms are 100% private
• Linens, bath towels, hairdryer available.
• Shower and toilet are in a shared hallway
• Please prepare your own shampoo, conditioner, and toothbrush.

If you book for one person, the sofa bed will be prepared as a sofa. Also Top of Bunk Bed won't be set. Please let me know if you want use Top one.

If you have any questions, please feel free to contact me !

great spot, in a fantastic location!', 'Ginger
May 2021
This place feels very open even though it’s a studio- the layout is really well thought out. The back deck is really nice with greenery all around. The neighborhood is beautiful and lively- lots of popular restaurants just a block away. There’s lots of shops 5 min walk. I had weekly appointments at Mt Sinai, and it’s about a 35 minute walk thru Central Park to 98th st, which was lovely. The desk is a really good size and a great study/work spot. The wifi is fast and reliable. The ladder up to the bed is a bit of a pain in the butt, but the mattress is so comfortable, like a cloud. Definitely a great deal!
Show more', 'Matt
April 2021
Awesome!', 'Tequira

March 2020

February 2020

Charming Studio with a private patio in a Harlem Brownstone. Ideal for couples visiting Manhattan - easy access to midtown (15 minutes) and downtown Manhattan (20-30 minutes). Subway 2 or 3 (red line) is just 5 blocks and one avenue away. Studio unit is in the first floor/ street level of a 2 family Harlem brownstone townhouse. We live on the second floor of the townhouse. We are present in the building during your stay making us conform with city ordinances. Contact-free check-in via code.


Independent studio apartment with your own private patio. Kitchen is fully equipped for cooking. There is ample storage for your belongings. Free Wifi and Cable TV. Also has an umbrella, iron, an ironing board and a hair dryer. The whole space is yours to enjoy!

October 2021
Clean and nice staff! :)', 'Madison

October 2021

Where you’ll be
New York, United States
This neighborhood is called: Chelsea. 
     There are literally hundreds of small unique restaurants, shops, book stores, galleries, theaters and pubs in Chelsea.  You will find, gently-strolling, pedestrian traffic at all hours of the day of evening.
   Chelsea is not a dark, or dangerous area.   It's a neighborhood that's full of life.
      Many artists, musicians, writers, actors, FIT students, other graduate students, similar intelligentsia, and creative people live in Chelsea.  I think you'll like it here.
     You can get anywhere in New York City quickly and easily from here.
       The subway station is two blocks away (a two minute walk).
Midtown Manhattan is very central and safe. Police station 2 blocks away. We're located within walking distance of Theater District, Penn Station, FIT, Madison Square Garden, High Line Park

listing_type: ['Entire rental unit hosted by Jeniffer\n2 guests · Studio · 1 bed · 1 bath']
review:
["Robin
September 2021
When checking in, the lockbox was not ready for me as instructed, and the room was not clean since the previous guest. Both were taken care of relatively quickly after calling the company's customer service, as the cleaning staff was still in the building. However if this was later in the day, it would have been a bigger issue and longer to resolve.

I locked myself out early in my stay. This was around 8pm, and all of the building staff left for the day. I attempted to call the hosting company, but received their answering machine. I left multiple messages with a number to contact me at, as well as via email but never heard back from them. I had to wait until the next day for someone on the maintenance staff to let me back in.

I put in a work order once when the toilet clogged. They confirmed receiving the support request, but after waiting half of the day, I bought a plunger and fixed it myself.

I tried to ask about extending my reservation for a day. My first email went unanswered. When I called support, they asked me to send an email to Jeniffer, which I did twice and they both went unanswered.
Show more", 'Jacqueline
August 2021
Beautiful space, very clean, great location. 10/10.', 'Jaclyn
July 2021
Easy check-in. Great location. Very clean.', 'Verena
August 2020
Great space. Has everything you need and more. Location is perfect for a Manhattan stay. Close to everything.', 'Sadja
July 2020
Thank you so much for having us, i had an amazing experience and I look forward to staying here again. It was so much more then I expected and the host communicated with me very well. Once again thank you.
Show more', 'Errol
June 2020
Great location']

Robin
September 2021
When checking in, the lockbox was not ready for me as instructed, and the room was not clean since the previous guest. Both were taken care of relatively quickly after calling the company's customer service, as the cleaning staff was still in the building. However if this was later in the day, it would have been a bigger issue and longer to resolve.

I locked myself out early in my stay. This was around 8pm, and all of the building staff left for the day. I attempted to call the hosting company, but received their answering machine. I left multiple messages with a number to contact me at, as well as via email but never heard back from them. I had to wait until the next day for someone on the maintenance staff to let me back in.

I put in a work order once when the toilet clogged. They confirmed receiving the support request, but after waiting half of the day, I bought a plunger and fixed it myself.

I tried to ask about extending my reservation for a day. My first email went unanswered. When I called support, they asked me to send an email to Jeniffer, which I did twice and they both went unanswered.

listing_name: ['Lovely Room in a PRIME AREA near Central Park']
listing_type: ['Private room in rental unit hosted by Kay\n2 guests · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 shared bath']
review:
['Chris
August 2021
Kay was an excellent host and the place was perfect for my needs. Very close to Central Park and Morningside Park as well as two subway stops. Great restaurants in the area. May made me feel right at home made me feel welcome in NYC. Would definitely stay there again Five stars!!!
Show more', 'Tweety
August 2021
Very helpful and nice !', 'Megumi
July 2021
The location is great—right near the B/C and the room is lovely, it gets lots of natural light and has AC. Kay is a very friendly and accommodating host who was quick to respond and help if I needed anything.
Show more', 'Luciana
November 2021
The best host ever! The apartment is great, excellent location, public transportation really close, I recommend it!
El host muy bueno, el departamento también, excelente ubicación, súper cerca el transporte público, lo recomiendo!
Show more', 'Adriana
September 2021
El lugar está muy bien ubicado, cerca del metro en el uptown. tiene cocina y baño. La habitación es pequeña si llevas maletas grandes puede resultar incómodo. Kay responde a cualquier inquietud
Show more', 'Santiago Medardo
September 2021

["Radha Budget Cozy Private Room (fights NYC Hunger)
4.28
(69 reviews)
·
New York, United States
Share
Save
Show all photos
Private room in rental unit hosted by Annie & Lee
2 guests · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 shared bath
Enhanced Clean
This Host committed to Airbnb's 5-step enhanced cleaning process. Show more
Live in the heart of the East Village. We are a few steps away from the famous bars, fine dining, shopping, galleries, entertainment & more. Only 3 mins to the subway station with major buses across the street. The area has street parking. We are a vegetarian, & smoke-free establishment.
Profit generated from the guest rooms is used to distribute free meals to homeless people. By staying here you are supporting the program and if you like, you are most welcome to volunteer for the same.


Your room has a comfy double bed & big empty closet for storage. It has all the amenities including iron, ironing board, toiletries, hair dryer, tissues, night lamp, hypoallergenic linen & towels. The apartment has 2 full baths.

The room has a big window, thus is well ventilated and has plenty of natural light.

We are following all cleaning protocols( such as checking temperature, sanitizing the place, washing sheets at highest heat setting, keeping the apartment ventilated etc) to keep our guests safe during the pandemic.

Krithika

Location is great. So many restaurants nearby and the accessibility to their place is also good. Though the room receives good sunlight and air (air conditioner), the room size is too small and it felt stuffy (later we learned that majority of the east village homes are tiny). So, we changed our plan and stayed at friends place upon our friend's request. After making a request to change the dates from 4 nights to two nights, they refused to accept the change since it is last minute. It is an okay place to me, so I would have definitely given them 4 star if it's for accepting our change request.
Also, it would have really helped if it is clearly mentioned that the room size is small or even better the dimensions of the room. We cannot tell the size of the room by seeing picture.
Show more
Aziz
October 2021
Highly recommend this place
Jessica
October 2021
Overall, it's was a great experience. Clean apartment and authentic experience of what is to be expected in NY. The size of the rooms did come as a culture shock, especially since we were coming from Texas where everything is big. But the hosts were great, check in was a breeze, and every question/concern was answered.
Show more

September 2021

Washington Square Park, IFC Theater, Cherry Lane Theater and the Chelsea Market plus exclusive clubs in the Meatpacking District like Marquee, 1OAK, Avenue, Tao and Lavo are close also. The best jazz in the city is at your doorstep at historic places like Village Vanguard, Smalls, 55 Bar, Blue Note, Bar Next Door & Fat Cat. The best brunches, The Whitney Museum, The Highline, Hudson River Park, Pier 45, Mamoun's Falafel's, Waverly Diner and the World Famous Magnolia Bakery are all here. Where you’ll be
New York, United States
This neighborhood is called: Chelsea. 
     There are literally hundreds of small unique restaurants, shops, book stores, galleries, theaters and pubs in Chelsea.  You will find, gently-strolling, pedestrian traffic at all hours of the day of evening.
   Chelsea is not a dark, or dangerous area.   It's a neighborhood that's full of life.
      Many artists, musicians, writers, actors, FIT students, other graduate students, similar intelligentsia, and creative people live in Chelsea.  I think you'll like it here.
     You can get anywhere in New York City quickly and easily from here.
       The subway station is two blocks away (a two minute walk).
Midtown Manhattan is very central and safe. Police station 2 blocks away. We're located within walking distance of Theater District, Penn Station, FIT, Madison Square Garden, High Line Park 
JKF Airport, Newark Airport, and La Guardia Airport all offer fast, direct, public transportation to Penn Station in Manhattan. Penn Station is a three minute walk from here.
Show more

review:
['Tyler
May 2021
Great location- close to shops, restaurants and subway. Good if on a budget.', "Shonda
May 2021
Thanks again for the wonderful stay! Cozy apartment, great proximity to the Brooklyn Museum, Botanical Gardens, the eclectic Franklin St. eateries, esp. Ras Ethiopian vegan eatery, and Savvy's Restaurant with live (Covid-safe) music, and the laundry option WAS AWESOME! I loved staying at Frank's and will be back!
Show more", 'Semira
March 2021
Frank’s place is definitely a home way from home. You get the entire place to yourself. Great location, close to most subway lines and there are tons of stores around to get groceries and shop. I highly recommend Frank’s place! Would definitely book again anytime i am in the city.
Show more', 'Natasha
February 2021
Frank is a great host, his apartment is a great location within walking distance of transportation and restaurants. The building and neighborhood is safe and I would book again in future.
Show more', "Nessa
January 2021
Franks place was an excellent choice for my long term stay. Amenities were excellent, everything you could need was there. Home was comfortable and in a mostly quiet location (it's New York so of course there is some noise). Location was fantastic, right around the corner from the 2,3,4,5 train. The neighborhood itself has lots of restaurants and bars. I definitely would recommend to anyone looking for a place to stay.
Show more", "Ufjfb
July 2020
We stayed for four months in Frank's apartment. The location is fantastic. They have multiple restaurants within walking distance, especially the Chinese restaurant around the corner. Also, the apartment is nearby Prospect Park, Brooklyn Botanical Gardens, nearby Manhattan. You can travel using CitiBike, bus or train. The amenities are great, fast wifi, TV and a kitchen if you like to cook. Also, Frank answer fast if you have any questions. We love the apartment that we extended for an additional month. Enjoy all the things Brooklyn has to offer! Blessings Frank!
Show more"]

The Apt is located in a pre-war building , in a great location within Crown Heights. Very close to shops, markets, churches, museums, cafes, restaurants and many more. Very ideal for quick access to public transportation into the city or elsewhere within the 5 boroughs. A bustling neighborhood, a safe neighborhood and a neighborhood on the rise. The space is freshly decorated eclectic style with a new kitchen and bathroom.


Guests that use this space have full access to everything in the apt. Fully stocked kitchen with everything you would need to prepare meals. Towels and bed linen provided. Cable tv, Netflix movies and internet. Business guests can use a wired connection if needed. There is no washing machine on the premises but laundry can be picked up and taken care of for you , for a small fee and a hassle-free stay. Otherwise coins can be provided to you with your stay if you decide to do it yourself.(free).

One Queen-sized bed. Comfortable usually for two persons but can accommodate three if they don't mind. This room is bright and clean bigger than one,suitable for 2-3 people,preferably 2 . 2min walk to Central Park and Subway, 10 min to Columbia University. The apartment is a two flight walk-up in a crowded street with many restaurants.


Room includes bed and space for your stuff. The room is relatively small, but comfortable.

Very convenient to the subways, central park, Columbia University without the hassles of crowded streets. Very relaxed setting while still in Manhattan.

There are many small grocery shops nearby, a 24 hour pharmacy, two beer gardens, nail salons, restaurants such as Vinateria, Zoma, Lido, Savann, Jado Sushi, Harlem Rooster, and many more are right around the corner.

Jaleh is super sweet and accommodating. She was willing to work around her schedule to accommodate my check in, and my short stay here was super convenient. I would recommend this place for sure.

Amazing loft located in Chinatown / Lower east side. Great place to stay for couples who wants to be in a New York loft experience. new bathroom, kitchen with a small fridge. We use it as our photo studio and rent out the space as a living environment when we travel beautiful and very spacious. 1500sqf make dining table with chairs, Wi-Fi, buzzer, utensils, plates, cups and glasses.


**** Different rates apply if you are requesting for photo shoot during the day only.

fifth floor walkup.

review:
["Diana
October 2021
This AirBnb is a room inside a 2 br apartment but the actual space is quite roomy (photos are accurate!). I did not use the pull-out futon, but the bed and desk/chair were just enough for me to sleep and do some light work on my laptop. I would recommend bringing a bathrobe and slippers for the shared restroom. Room and restroom are easily locked behind you, as well (so make sure to remember your br key!).
Jackie was a very accommodating yet hands-off host. He affords his guests their own space while cohabitating in this apt.
This AirBnb is in very convenient location--very close to Little Italy and Chinatown, and laughably close to Delancey st, where there's a wealth of entertainment and dining options.
Show more", "Annie
October 2021
Jack's apartment was such a convenient and comfortable stay. It is located near a ton of bars, restaurants, coffee shops, and most importantly a subway station (only 5min walking distance). The room itself is very cozy and nicely decorated. Plenty of space for two people.

Communication with Jack couldn't have gone better. He gave us clear instructions for self check-in with pictures, and I was not confused at all. He even provided us with instructions for transportation to and from JFK and a list of recommendations for restaurants and other things nearby, and his recs were on point. Although check-out was at 11AM, he even let us keep our luggages past check-out time because our flight left late afternoon. Overall, great stay and I would recommend this place for any friends that want to stay in NYC.
Show more", 'Kyle
October 2021
Perfect location! Cozy spot and Jack made it very simple for us :)', 'Laura
October 2021
Great place! Was a great spot near the F train. Good spot to just crash in while spending the day visiting the city', 'Kate
October 2021
Overall, we enjoyed our stay and really loved the recommendation guide that Jackie provided. The location was walking distance from a ton of bars and restaurants and accessible to the subway too. The only imperfection was that the shower/bathroom wasn’t super clean and the building itself is pretty old and a little rundown, but not out of character for the funky, older area. Generally, decent value. We like cats, so Luke was a nice touch. He’s definitely a visitor whenever possible, so be prepared to provide pets! We would stay again.
Show more', 'Robert
October 2021

-It is a walk-up building so be prepared if you are bringing a large suitcase
-A very communicative host
-Easy check-in process
- Comfortable bed
-A very human affectionate cat named Luke

Freshly renovated room in walk up building 4th FL, 3 mins walk from F subway line, and centrally-located between midtown and downtown - offering easy access to most of NYC’s tourist attractions. It is situated on the border between the young and stylish East Village and Lower East Side neighborhoods, surrounded by affordable restaurants, cafes, bars, galleries and shops. The room features a full size spring memory foam bed.

*cat live on property


To book, please tell me your arrival and departure time as well as a little bit about yourself. Check in time is after 2pm, and check out time is 11am. If you need to book early check-in, please book extra date, and I will offer you half day rate.

*cat live on property

I'm also happy to answer any questions you may have. I look forward to hearing from you!

Your private room is furnished with brand-new amenities, including ultra-comfortable Full-size Innerspring Hybrid Mattresses, soft towels. A renovated bathroom is shared. The room has its own air conditioning during the summer and its own heater during winter.

Diana
October 2021
This AirBnb is a room inside a 2 br apartment but the actual space is quite roomy (photos are accurate!). I did not use the pull-out futon, but the bed and desk/chair were just enough for me to sleep and do some light work on my laptop. I would recommend bringing a bathrobe and slippers for the shared restroom. Room and restroom are easily locked behind you, as well (so make sure to remember your br key!).
Jackie was a very accommodating yet hands-off host. He affords his guests their own space while cohabitating in this apt.
This AirBnb is in very convenient location--very close to Little Italy and Chinatown, and laughably close to Delancey st, where there's a wealth of entertainment and dining options.
Show more
Annie
October 2021
Jack's apartment was such a convenient and comfortable stay. It is located near a ton of bars, restaurants, coffee shops, and most importantly a subway station (only 5min walking distance). The room itself is very cozy and nicely decorated. Plenty of space for two people.

Communication with Jack couldn't have gone better. He gave us clear instructions for self check-in with pictures, and I was not confused at all. He even provided us with instructions for transportation to and from JFK and a list of recommendations for restaurants and other things nearby, and his recs were on point. Although check-out was at 11AM, he even let us keep our luggages past check-out time because our flight left late afternoon. Overall, great stay and I would recommend this place for any friends that want to stay in NYC.
Show more
Kyle
October 2021
Perfect location! Cozy spot and Jack made it very simple for us :)
Laura
October 2021
Great place! Was a great spot near the F train. Good spot to just crash in while spending the day visiting the city
Kate
October 2021
Overall, we enjoyed our stay and really loved the recommendation guide that Jackie provided. The location was walking distance from a ton of bars and restaurants and accessible to the subway too. The only imperfection was that the shower/bathroom wasn’t super clean and the building itself is pretty old and a little rundown, but not out of character for the funky, older area. Generally, decent value. We like cats, so Luke was a nice touch. He’s definitely a visitor whenever possible, so be prepared to provide pets! We would stay again.
Show more
Robert
October 2021
What You Can Expect:
-Conveniently located near the subway
-It is a walk-up building so be prepared if you are bringing a large suitcase
-A very communicative host
-Easy check-in process
- Comfortable bed
-A very human affectionate cat named Luke
Show more
Show all 127 reviews
Where you’ll be
New York, United States
We are lucky to live in a great neighborhood. We are located on Henry Street, close to all tourists attractions so you won't even need to take a train to see the city's best.

It is：
30mins subway to Times Square,
25mins train to Herald Square,
20mins walk to Brooklyn Bridge, 9/11 Memorial, Statue of Liberty Ferry and
20mins walk from SoHo with tons of shops and boutiques (shopaholics - stay away!).

You will never need to go back to the same place to eat, because this area is loaded with restaurants, bars and clubs. This is the part of city where New York's history started, glorious and famous. It is not Carrie Bradshaw's New York. It is rather artistic and informal than glamorous. It is rapidly changing too. This is the place where you will feel a real New York atmosphere.

They say New York is the city that never sleeps so don't miss it's nightlife. It's happening just a couple blocks away. On Friday and Saturday you can be bar hopping all night and not even leave the neighborhood. There are places to dance as well. Just go out and feel the transformation.
Show more

A Private Bedroom & Full-Size Bed in a brand new apartment just a few steps to Central Park and very close to all major museums. Trains to downtown are one block away.

Great travel tips from a native New Yorker. Perfect if you are looking to have a comfortable place to sleep at night and start your day


This is a Six-Bedroom Apartment. You will have a private room with a full-size bed. There are three shared bathrooms.

The apartment is cleaned, organized, and maintained regularly. Wifi, Fresh linens, and towels will be provided to you.

The kitchen is a common area shared by other guests. Cooking is not allowed but please feel free to use the microwave, hot water kettle, and refrigerator.

The main apartment door is controlled by an electronic that our staff uses. You will have a key lock for your private room. The apartment common areas are monitored 24/7 for your safety and security.

Because this is a shared space we ask that you keep noise in the apartment to a minimum.

Cozy room with a single bed 1 block from the J train. The bathroom and kitchen are shared. I paint and pole dance in the living room area and you're welcome to try out the pole! There's a cute kitty cat named Monkey who lives here, so please do not book the room if you are allergic to or dislike cats. My apartment is conveniently located by the Kosiascko J, which takes you to downtown Manhattan in 20 minutes. Tons of cafes, bars, clubs, and restaurants nearby.


The apt is on a 3rd floor walk up and we have roof access one floor up. We have lots of cooking utensils, fast wifi, art and books, projector, and an Xpole 45mm spin dance pole in the living room.

review:
['Luís
November 2021
For anyone reading this, let me first say that this place was served me for about 3 months or so, so maybe what I'm going to say does not matter to you! Again, if you are staying only for a few days, go for it!

If you plan on staying a little longer, then keep on reading:

The host is great, nothing to worry about that. As for the apartment, there's a caveat: If you need to stay more than a week here, do yourself a HUGE favor and request one of the apartments with a window.

My room faced a black wall. At first, I thought the window had been covered with a black shutter, but no, it's the next building. As you can imagine, waking up and having no sunlight was not fun, really. In fact, it slowly took a hit on me since I had to balance some work/study from home: the result was that I would get "home" to a place that I didn't really enjoy.

Again, this review should only matter for folks who are either staying more than a week and need to stay inside the apartment for whatever reason. The place served its purpose, but the "no-window" situation was definitely a burden.

Do I recommend this place?

For folks staying for a week or so: 100%
For those staying for longer: 100% assuming that you were able to confirm you'll have a room with a window.

Hope this helps a little!

owner_details:
['Cozy Flat in the Heart of the Upper West Side
4.45
(77 reviews)
·
New York, United States
Share

Entire rental unit hosted by Ignacio
1 guest · Studio · 1 bed · 1 bath
Entire home
You’ll have the apartment to yourself.
Enhanced Clean
This Host committed to Airbnb's 5-step enhanced cleaning process. Show more
Great location
90% of recent guests gave the location a 5-star rating.
Location, location, location! This is NYC Living.
Our cozy studio apartment located inside a historic NYC brownstone nestled in one of Manhattan's most central neighborhoods, the Upper West Side. The apartment is small but well designed to maximize the usage of the space.
The unit is equipped with a private bathroom, a comfortable bed, Cable TV, a desk/dinning table, a fully loaded micro-kitchen, and open closet space. The perfect place for students and young professionals in NYC.


Our studio apartment offers our guests the perfect solution to all of New York City's lodging hassles... Price, Location, & privacy. With us you can have your own place, in a Manhattan's upscale and central location, at an affordable price!

The Apartment
The unit is small (which NYC apartment isn't right?) but well equipped with all the amenities needed for a comfortable long stay. The Micro-Kitchen may be tiny but it is fully loaded to bring the inner chef out of you.
The comfortable bed will guarantee a good night sleep after a long day out on the city. We provide free Wi-Fi and basic cable to work, study, and stay connected and a nicely remodeled private bathroom and drawers to keep your apartment tidy and organized.

The building
Our unit is located in a beautiful 1900's historic building that will provide you with a true New York experience. So please keep in mind that this classic building, which is a better word for older, is well maintained but lacks certain amenities that became more popular years after its creation. Stairs are a must, as there is not an elevator in the building and the A/C's are located on the windows. The building is located on one of New York busiest Corners, and it has a bar right underneath it.

The Neighborhood
One of the best features of our studio is its location. Step out of the door and enjoy the beautiful architecture, bustling businesses and young feel of the Upper West side. With plenty of cute cafes, restaurants, bars, and local shops to suit any needs you may have. This great neighborhood is perfect for young professionals and students looking for their own private oasis in a city that never sleeps. Our building puts you less than a few steps away from Central Park, Universities, restaurants, Bars, Riverside Park, Lincoln Center, Museums, and much more!

The host is great, nothing to worry about that. As for the apartment, there's a caveat: If you need to stay more than a week here, do yourself a HUGE favor and request one of the apartments with a window.

My room faced a black wall. At first, I thought the window had been covered with a black shutter, but no, it's the next building. As you can imagine, waking up and having no sunlight was not fun, really. In fact, it slowly took a hit on me since I had to balance some work/study from home: the result was that I would get "home" to a place that I didn't really enjoy.

Again, this review should only matter for folks who are either staying more than a week and need to stay inside the apartment for whatever reason. The place served its purpose, but the "no-window" situation was definitely a burden.

Do I recommend this place?

For folks staying for a week or so: 100%
For those staying for longer: 100% assuming that you were able to confirm you'll have a room with a window.

Hope this helps a little!

If you're looking for an affordable place to stay in the Big Apple right in the center of Manhattan then welcome to my home! This cozy queen size private bedroom has a true city feeling, only a few minutes walk to the Empire State Building! The apartment is right in the heart of Manhattan, near Grand Central, Korea Town, Murray Hill, Madison Square Park and much more. (PLEASE kindly read the entire description of the place before messaging host)


This is a private room in a shared apartment. The apartment is in the center of New York City, near the subway station and near the empire state, lots of restaurants and shops around. Two people per room, but if there's more than two then I can offer sleeping bags ($30 per extra person), the room may be big enough to fit more; or they can sleep in the living room if needed. I also rent other extra rooms on this platform, same apartment. (Check my profile for a link in case you need to bring an extra friend).

2nd floor New York style pre-war walk-up apartment 3-minute walk from F train subway line and centrally-located between midtown and downtown - offering easy access to most of NYC’s tourist attractions. It is situated on the border between the young and stylish East Village and Lower East Side neighborhoods, surrounded by affordable restaurants, cafes, bars, galleries, and shops. The room features a full-size bed with 8-inch Mattresses, air condition, and steam heater


2nd floor New York style pre-war walk-up apartment with hardwood floors, exposed brick, and a fully equipped kitchen with gas stove, full-size bed & optional second futon bed. And we are equipped with a Rain-head shower, Air Condition, and Steam Heater. It is clean and well kept and I'll be able to help you find anything you need in the city.

Steve

Jackie’s home was a great find. From check in to check out, everything went about as smoothly as I could have asked for. I will definitely stay here again next time I’m in New York City!
Show more
Show all 308 reviews
Where you’ll be
New York, United States
We are lucky to live in a great neighborhood. We are located on Henry Street, close to all tourists attractions so you won't even need to take a train to see the city's best.

It is：
30mins subway to Times Square,
25mins train to Herald Square,
20mins walk to Brooklyn Bridge, 9/11 Memorial, Statue of Liberty Ferry and
20mins walk from SoHo with tons of shops and boutiques (shopaholics - stay away!).

You will never need to go back to the same place to eat, because this area is loaded with restaurants, bars and clubs. This is the part of city where New York's history started, glorious and famous. It is not Carrie Bradshaw's New York. It is rather artistic and informal than glamorous. It is rapidly changing too. This is the place where you will feel a real New York atmosphere.

They say New York is the city that never sleeps so don't miss it's nightlife. It's happening just a couple blocks away. On Friday and Saturday you can be bar hopping all night and not even leave the neighborhood. There are places to dance as well. Just go out and feel the transformation.

P.S. I spent some time to add a Guidebook to my profile so don't forget to check it out for some suggestions. I hope it will help you to plan your visit.
Show more

['Small room with private half-bath

Private room in rental unit hosted by Steph
1 guest · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1.5 baths
Fast wifi
At 206 Mbps, you can take video calls and stream videos for your whole group.
Great check-in experience
100% of recent guests gave the check-in process a 5-star rating.
Highly rated Host
Steph has received 5-star ratings from 100% of recent guests.
This room measures 6'5" by 9'4" (1.95 metres by 2.84 meters). In addition, you have the half-bath with toilet and hand basin.

It is perfect for one person.

COVID: We are fully vaccinated and we require our guests to be fully vaccinated before arrival, also. Please note, this means you must have received your final dose 2 weeks prior to your check-in.

There could be as many as 6 people sharing the apartment.

Must love cats! We have three.


We are in a landmarked building in the heart of Harlem, commissioned by William Waldorf Astor as a luxury apartment house and built from 1899–1901. It was designated a New York City landmark in 1984.

Graham Court is regularly used as a filming location - so you might get to see a day of shooting and meet some stars as filming recommences.

We have been featured in films and TV shows like, “American Gangster”, “Jungle Fever”, “New Jack City”, “Sugar Hill,” "Mozart in the Jungle", "Instinct", "Black List", and recently some new cop show with Tony Danza playing Josh Groban's father... that was a weird thing to see.

review:
['Crystal
November 2021
Jack had a great apartment. Bedroom was bigger than other ones I’ve stayed in, and the bathroom was more spacious as well. The shower had fast hot water, and everything was stocked nicely. Close to the F train subway and easy to get anywhere in the city, only 1 stop from Brooklyn so it was convenient to go into the dumbo neighborhood, which I highly recommend.
Show more', 'Soren
November 2021
Easy check-in process and clean room. I would definitely stay again.', 'Rick
October 2021
I really enjoyed my time at Jackie’s. He’s really accessible and a great host.

I’ve been wanting to work from home from NYC. So this review is for a week-long stay.

As for the apartment itself. The room was amazing. Spacious, clean, aesthetically pleasing, large bed, and plenty of cabinet space. The particular room I stayed had a desk and chair. I was able to work comfortably and without any issues. Wifi worked perfectly fine.

Location: accessible to the F line (which practically takes you anywhere—subject to a few transfers). You’re in NYC—walk. Walking distance to the bars in LES. Walking distance to Manhattan and Brooklyn bridge. Walking distance to East River Park. Major points for being close to Target and Trader Joe’s.

Check-in process: very thorough and easy to follow. No issues whatsoever.

The one thing I’d flag is that this is a 3-bedroom, 1 shared bathroom apartment. Though I never had any issues, I was under the impression this was a two-bedroom apt. Also, no microwave.

With all of that, I’d recommend Jackie’s place for a short and somewhat long term stay.
Show more', 'Veronica
October 2021
Very clean, nice room and private too. The bed was very comfortable, fresh towels. This fit the bill for me when I needed a place to crash after attending an event.', 'Stephan
October 2021
Interesting space. The room was really nice and I love the area.', 'Ashley
October 2021
Jack was a wonderful host. This listing is one of three rooms in the apartment with a shared bathroom for all guests. There is a cleaning lady that comes regularly and needed items are always stocked. The apartment is on the LES and near the F train ( east Broadway stop) the neighborhood is within walking distance to many great restaurants and bars and Jack is an attentive, prompt host giving detailed check-in instructions, a thorough listing of local attractions and readily available to answer all questions. You can expect street noise and construction sounds in the a.m. and at night ( hello NYC) Overall, a good stay for the price.
Show more']

This Host committed to Airbnb's 5-step enhanced cleaning process. Show more
Self check-in

Great check-in experience
100% of recent guests gave the check-in process a 5-star rating.
Freshly renovated room, 3 mins walk from F subway line, and centrally-located between midtown and downtown - offering easy access to most of NYC’s tourist attractions. It is situated on the border between the young and stylish East Village and Lower East Side neighborhoods, surrounded by affordable restaurants, cafes, bars, galleries and shops. The room features a spring + memory-foam bed, and a far street-facing window(which mean it got views but not noise).


To book, please tell me your arrival and departure time as well as a little bit about yourself. Check in time is after 2pm, and check out time is 11am. If you need early check in or late checkout, please book extra date, and I will offer you half day rate.

I'm also happy to answer any questions you may have. I look forward to hearing from you! Best, Jackie *

Your private room is furnished with brand-new amenities, including a desk, ultra-comfortable Full-size Innerspring Hybrid Mattresses, soft towels. A renovated bathroom is shared. The room has its own air conditioning during the summer and its own heater during winter.

Crystal
November 2021
Jack had a great apartment. Bedroom was bigger than other ones I’ve stayed in, and the bathroom was more spacious as well. The shower had fast hot water, and everything was stocked nicely. Close to the F train subway and easy to get anywhere in the city, only 1 stop from Brooklyn so it was convenient to go into the dumbo neighborhood, which I highly recommend.
Show more
Soren
November 2021
Easy check-in process and clean room. I would definitely stay again.
Rick
October 2021
I really enjoyed my time at Jackie’s. He’s really accessible and a great host.

I’ve been wanting to work from home from NYC. So this review is for a week-long stay.

As for the apartment itself. The room was amazing. Spacious, clean, aesthetically pleasing, large bed, and plenty of cabinet space. The particular room I stayed had a desk and chair. I was able to work comfortably and without any issues. Wifi worked perfectly fine.

Location: accessible to the F line (which practically takes you anywhere—subject to a few transfers). You’re in NYC—walk. Walking distance to the bars in LES. Walking distance to Manhattan and Brooklyn bridge. Walking distance to East River Park. Major points for being close to Target and Trader Joe’s.

Check-in process: very thorough and easy to follow. No issues whatsoever.

The one thing I’d flag is that this is a 3-bedroom, 1 shared bathroom apartment. Though I never had any issues, I was under the impression this was a two-bedroom apt. Also, no microwave.

With all of that, I’d recommend Jackie’s place for a short and somewhat long term stay.
Show more
Veronica
October 2021
Very clean, nice room and private too. The bed was very comfortable, fresh towels. This fit the bill for me when I needed a place to crash after attending an event.
Stephan
October 2021
Interesting space. The room was really nice and I love the area.
Ashley
October 2021
Jack was a wonderful host. This listing is one of three rooms in the apartment with a shared bathroom for all guests. There is a cleaning lady that comes regularly and needed items are always stocked. The apartment is on the LES and near the F train ( east Broadway stop) the neighborhood is within walking distance to many great restaurants and bars and Jack is an attentive, prompt host giving detailed check-in instructions, a thorough listing of local attractions and readily available to answer all questions. You can expect street noise and construction sounds in the a.m. and at night ( hello NYC) Overall, a good stay for the price.

owner_details:
["Cute, Bright Private Attic loft in Brooklyn Home
4.70
(148 reviews)
·
Brooklyn, New York, United States
Share
Save
Show all photos
Entire loft hosted by Ken
2 guests · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · Half-bath
Entire home
You’ll have the loft to yourself.
Self check-in
Check yourself in with the lockbox.
Great check-in experience
95% of recent guests gave the check-in process a 5-star rating.
Great communication
100% of recent guests rated Ken 5-star in communication.
This is a very cute attic loft with a private entrance in a 2-story home on a beautiful, calm residential street in Brooklyn.

We are half a block from an express bus that gets you into Manhattan in 20 minutes. It's a 10 minute walk to the subway train into the city. Prospect Park is also in walking distance where you will find a lovely place to jog, ride bikes, ice skate and more.

At the end of the block you will find an abundance of hip restaurants and bars to choose from.


After entering through a common front door, you will find two separate doors, one leads to the private entrance to the attic apartment at the top of the stairs. On sunny days, light pours in through the 5 skylights and in the evening you can look up at the stars from your bed. The space is all yours.

The attic features:
*comfortable bed
*private half bath
*your own microwave, refrigerator, toaster and frenchpress
*clean linens, towels, and wash cloths
*kitchen table and chairs
*tons of space
*clothes bar for hanging your fancy duds.
Sitting area with couch and lounge chair
HVAC heater/air conditioner

You will have your own key and absolute privacy.

review:
['Taylor
October 2021
I loved this place so much, definitely going to be my go to stay when I travel back to NY. The people both staying here and that work here are very kind and helpful, I was able to leave my bags while I explored the city. My room was super cozy and just overall comforting but I also am accustomed to hostels and love cute little stays like this however this place was particularly thoughtful and felt very safe. Peaceful even. I’ll definitely be back.
Show more', 'Mohamad
October 2021
Great place in the middle of Chelsea!', 'Giovanni
October 2021
Good location. Small rooms but to be expected.', 'Roger
October 2021
A wonderful space!', 'Alice
October 2021
Read reviews & descriptions.', "Gillian
October 2021
As most reviews say, the rooms are tiny. They more like pods, so if you struggle with claustrophobia this place is not for you. As someone who camps semi-regularly, it was perfect and the size didn't bother me. The pods do have some shelving and space underneath the mattress for storage. There was a shared common area with food and drinks available. They provide bath towels for the shared bathrooms and showers. If you're looking for comfort and some privacy, this is not the place for you. If you're looking for a hostel/communal style place and are on a budget, this is a perfect spot for a short-term stay in a great location in the city.

Where you’ll be
New York, United States
This neighborhood is called: Chelsea. 
     There are literally hundreds of small unique restaurants, shops, book stores, galleries, theaters and pubs in Chelsea.  You will find, gently-strolling, pedestrian traffic at all hours of the day of evening.
   Chelsea is not a dark, or dangerous area.   It's a neighborhood that's full of life.
      Many artists, musicians, writers, actors, FIT students, other graduate students, similar intelligentsia, and creative people live in Chelsea.  I think you'll like it here.
     You can get anywhere in New York City quickly and easily from here.
       The subway station is two blocks away (a two minute walk).
Midtown Manhattan is very central and safe. Police station 2 blocks away. We're located within walking distance of Theater District, Penn Station, FIT, Madison Square Garden, High Line Park

There are a few other people living at the apartment, but I rarely saw them, and I never had issues with the shared spaces like the kitchen and bathrooms. I didn't see Chip much, but I occasionally saw his wife Kathy, who went above and beyond to make sure I was comfortable and my needs were met. The apartment is located right by beautiful Riverside Park, which is a great spot for a picnic or a run. It is also a 10-15 minute walk to the 1 train and the ABCD trains. 5 stars! Great price, great room. Guests describe this as a private apartment— spacious and secluded (solid plaster walls in a prewar building). Work from home, study, or just relax watching Netflix in this huge (240 sq ft), bright, fully furnished, comfortable, private room. Great for a long-term student or solo adventurer. Price includes: electricity, wifi, cable tv/Netflix, air conditioner in summer, mini fridge, microwave, extra pillows and linens, washer/dryer, cleaning of common areas.


Great price, great room. Move right in—everything is included! This huge, bright room is gorgeous: it is furnished with a queen futon sofa bed, couch, coffee table, work / dining table and chairs, armoire with plenty of hangers, chest of drawers, full length mirror, air conditioning, cable tv, fan, microwave and mini-fridge. It is spacious and has 11-foot ceilings, wood floors, indirect lighting, sun-block drapery, and original art. Facing south, its double window captures the afternoon sunlight. The bustling, trendy neighborhood has a wide variety of excellent restaurants and hangouts. Very conveniently located near public transportation.

Jennifer
August 2021
Chip and Kathy were such wonderful hosts! they were always quick to respond to me and were so friendly. they even went out of their way to buy a brand new AC unit for the room during a heat wave, which was beyond sweet of them. the room has everything you could need (mini fridge, microwave, TV, closet, desk, couch/extra futon) and is perfect for longer stays (but of course for short stays too). I stayed for the entire summer and was so happy with this choice. definitely recommend!
Show more
Keevin
February 2021
Very nice place to stay
Julie
July 2019
I am a graduate student, and I stayed at Chip's place for the summer while working at a summer internship. The apartment was great for a long-term stay. There are a few other people living at the apartment, but I rarely saw them, and I never had issues with the shared spaces like the kitchen and bathrooms. I didn't see Chip much, but I occasionally saw his wife Kathy, who went above and beyond to make sure I was comfortable and my needs were met. The apartment is located right by beautiful Riverside Park, which is a great spot for a picnic or a run. It is also a 10-15 minute walk to the 1 train and the ABCD trains. I would definitely recommend Chip and Kathy's place!
Show more
Kevin
January 2018
Chip's place was great for what I was looking for. I stayed for a month while looking for my own apt. While there are other guests I never found the space to be loud, dirty, or difficult to share amenities. Most of the other guests were young (students). The room had an empty wardrobe & dresser, microwave and mini fridge which were very helpful considering the length of the stay. The location was great because the neighborhood was quiet but also had everything we needed including some fun restaurants and bars. The location on the 1 train is perfect for getting into Midtown/Downtown.
Show more
Victoria
December 2017
Chip was great! He always responded quickly and fixed all issues in a timely manner. (Like helping us work the heater at 6 in the morning.) It was a very private space with easy access to the subway. You can catch the 1 line to head into downtown Manhattan. Overall a great expenience. Would defintiely reccomend to anyone visiting NYC for a few days.

As a side note: Chip does smoke, but the room is in the front of the house so the smell isn't as strong. I have asthma, so we just kept the door shut and the window open and I was good.
Show more
Tammy
December 2017
Chip was an excellent host. Our room was very spacious and cozy. I would highly recommend Chips place when you need reservations. You won't be disappointed and Chip is very quick to accommodate his guest. I'd definitely stay here again if I needed a place.
Show more

Near Columbia University, City College, and Columbia Presbyterian Hospital. Riverside Drive is a gorgeously bucolic space. A 1-block walk gets you up to busy Broadway. Safe and friendly neighborhood. Bodegas are open 24 hours! There's a variety of great new restaurants and hangouts within walking distance, in addition to the more traditional local ones. Many convenient transportation options.

While there are other guests I never found the space to be loud, dirty, or difficult to share amenities. Most of the other guests were young (students). The room had an empty wardrobe & dresser, microwave and mini fridge which were very helpful considering the length of the stay. The location was great because the neighborhood was quiet but also had everything we needed including some fun restaurants and bars. The location on the 1 train is perfect for getting into Midtown/Downtown.
Show more
Victoria
December 2017
Chip was great! He always responded quickly and fixed all issues in a timely manner. (Like helping us work the heater at 6 in the morning.) It was a very private space with easy access to the subway. You can catch the 1 line to head into downtown Manhattan. Overall a great expenience. Would defintiely reccomend to anyone visiting NYC for a few days.

As a side note: Chip does smoke, but the room is in the front of the house so the smell isn't as strong. I have asthma, so we just kept the door shut and the window open and I was good.
Show more
Tammy
December 2017
Chip was an excellent host. Our room was very spacious and cozy. I would highly recommend Chips place when you need reservations. You won't be disappointed and Chip is very quick to accommodate his guest. I'd definitely stay here again if I needed a place.

listing_type: ['Private room in rental unit hosted by Zen\n2 guests · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 shared bath']
review:
['Sarah
October 2021
Zen is a fantastic host! Great communication and knows everything about NYC. perfect Manhattan location for business or pleasure :)', "Derek
October 2021
This is truly a great location for anyone who wants to spend a few days exploring New York. Zen was a very nice host, and helped me carry my luggage upstairs. I got a small private room, as advertised, but the rest of the apartment is very much a shared space, so be sure you're comfortable with that. The other guests were young, cool, and easy to get along with.
Show more", 'Clara
October 2021
I would recommend this place if you’re just looking for a convenient location that’s also lively, with anything you might need and exciting nightlife. The host is friendly and even offered my husband some food when he first arrived, also the check in was easy and simple. My issue here was with overall safety and cleanliness. This room has a glass door and only a sheer curtain to cover it, and there was no lock. We didn’t feel like we had any privacy or safety and couldn’t leave our computers there (there are several other guests in the apartment and both the building and the apartment were unlocked). If I was alone as a woman I don’t think I would have stayed since anyone could get in, but my husband was there. The room is a walk-in closet size that fits only the bed and small coffee table, only one of us could stand and get dressed at a time. Also no windows or smoke detector. The floor was dusty and the bathroom was also not clean, but that’s to be expected with so many guests and 1 bathroom. Zen is however a very responsive host who understood our concerns and worked with us and the platform to make things better.
Show more']

Sarah
October 2021
Zen is a fantastic host! Great communication and knows everything about NYC. perfect Manhattan location for business or pleasure :)
Derek
October 2021
This is truly a great location for anyone who wants to spend a few days exploring New York. Zen was a very nice host, and helped me carry my luggage upstairs. I got a small private room, as advertised, but the rest of the apartment is very much a shared space, so be sure you're comfortable with that. The other guests were young, cool, and easy to get along with.
Show more
Clara
October 2021
I would recommend this place if you’re just looking for a convenient location that’s also lively, with anything you might need and exciting nightlife. The host is friendly and even offered my husband some food when he first arrived, also the check in was easy and simple. My issue here was with overall safety and cleanliness. This room has a glass door and only a sheer curtain to cover it, and there was no lock. We didn’t feel like we had any privacy or safety and couldn’t leave our computers there (there are several other guests in the apartment and both the building and the apartment were unlocked). If I was alone as a woman I don’t think I would have stayed since anyone could get in, but my husband was there. The room is a walk-in closet size that fits only the bed and small coffee table, only one of us could stand and get dressed at a time. Also no windows or smoke detector. The floor was dusty and the bathroom was also not clean, but that’s to be expected with so many guests and 1 bathroom. Zen is however a very responsive host who understood our concerns and worked with us and the platform to make things better.

listing_name: ['RARE LUX. Private. Elevator Outdoor space Apt. 5']
listing_type: ['Entire condominium (condo) hosted by Daniel\n6 guests · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 2 baths']
review:
["Lauri
August 2021
Gorgeous, spacious New York City apartment with rooftop deck, very clean, perfectly furnished, quiet, better than described, highly worth it. Daniel is an amazing host, which included hosting a wonderful July 4th cookout. He was always available if needed, and extremely helpful. Best experience ever! Can't recommend highly enough.
Show more", 'Rachel
May 2021
Daniel’s place was perfect for a month of work in New York. The neighborhood is so convenient to the best restaurants and beautiful East River and bridge runs. The private elevator, roof deck, walk in closet, bathrooms, and kitchen are such a luxury. The mornings are so quiet that you can hear the birds chirping. Highly recommend!
Show more', 'Rick
October 2021
We had a great stay in Daniels apartment. It is as the pictures depict, modern, clean, private and tastefully decorated. Despite being in a busy neighbourhood and city this place is really quiet especially with the bedrooms facing the back, we slept really well on the comfortable beds. The location is very easy access to lots of good grocery shopping, (Trader Joes and Chinatown) and food options and the F train is a block and a half away to get you anywhere else in NYC. There are lots of really good restaurants just a short walk away if you don’t want to cook in the high end kitchen. It was nice to come home after a day of exploring the city and enjoy the space.
Daniel was a great host and went out of his way to make our stay even better than it was.
Show more']

listing_name: ['Beautiful Brownstone Just Steps From Central Park']

review:
["Paul
October 2021
Kind of a small place that's much further away from the main Manhattan bubble, but it was just enough space and very quiet. It's tucked away in a brownstone building in between a lot of schools (which I didn't expect), but overall it was a great stay.
Show more", 'Sharon
October 2021
This Brownstone was perfect for our short adventure to NYC. Located near the subway, next to Central Park with garage parking and good restaurants nearby. Appreciated the nice bottle of wine and a well stocked kitchen to prepare a few meals.
Show more', "Justin
October 2021
Exactly as advertised, great location, amazing space, and on top of that Mark and his team are really wonderful. Couldn't recommend this place highly enough!", 'Donna
October 2021
The apartment was awesome and the location was unbelievable! Very roomy considering it’s NYC
and I am notorious for traveling with too much stuff, so this uncharacteristically gave me the space I needed.

All website info and pics on this website were 100% descriptive…. Kudos to Mark for being a great host!
Show more', "Leslie
October 2021
This place is small but perfectly set-up and the location can't be beat. I love being close to the park, the Metropolitan Museum, and to various subway options which can get you anywhere in the city. The immediate neighborhood is quiet, which I like. Broadway is 2 blocks away. The apartment was spotless, bright, and well set-up for visitors. I will definitely stay here again when I go back to NY.
Show more", 'Misty
September 2021
Great area! Beautiful apartment right by Central Park:)']

This apartment is professionally managed by Furnished Quarters, the largest independently owned and operated supplier of short-term furnished housing with over 20 years of experience in the industry. The walkup building is pet-friendly and features on-site laundry facilities. The surrounding Upper East Side neighborhood is quaint and residential, with prime proximity to Central Park and the city’s best museums, including the Metropolitan Museum of Art. The 4, 6, N, Q and R subway lines are nearby for easy travel throughout the city.


This one-bedroom apartment is located in a turn-of-the-century walkup on a beautiful residential block on Manhattan's Upper East Side. The pet-friendly apartment features hardwood floors, and the building features on-site laundry facilities. The bed provided is full size, fitted with plush linens and pillows. All Furnished Quarters apartments include: • Fully equipped kitchen • HDTV with cable service • Utilities and domestic phone • Complimentary WiFi • 24/7 guest service

We’re here to help your trip go smoothly. Every reservation is covered by Airbnb’s Guest Refund Policy.
Where you’ll be
New York, United States
The Upper East Side is synonymous with luxury, elegance and opulence. This highly sought after neighborhood is home to some of the city’s premier museums and cultural landmarks. Fifth Avenue from 82nd to 105th Street is known as Museum Mile, containing the Metropolitan Museum of Art, the Smithsonian Institution, the Solomon R. Guggenheim Museum, the Jewish Museum, the Museum of the City of New York, El Museo del Barrio and more. While others are hustling and bustling about in the surrounding areas, the serene nature of the Upper East Side will provide a sense of much-needed peace and quiet. Visit Central Park and explore all of the attractions and activities this landmark has to offer such as the Central Park Zoo, the Mall and Literary Walk, the Loeb Boathouse and the Jacqueline Kennedy Onassis Reservoir. Take a stroll down Lexington, Park, Madison or 5th Ave and navigate the endless shops, lavish buildings, and delightful restaurants. The Upper East Side’s restaurant scene is incredibly diverse. Whatever you’re craving after a day of museum-hopping or exploring Central Park, you’ll find it here. Try the iconic burger at JG Melon, get dressed up for a fancy French meal at Daniel or slurp noodles at Xi'an Famous Foods. The neighborhood offers a combination of both natural and commercial pleasure.
Show more

review:
['Joshua
October 2021
My wife and I enjoyed setting up our home base here for our visit to Manhattan. It’s prime selling-point was that it’s right in the middle of everything Manhattan has to offer, without the exorbitant price tag that accompanies most other places in the area. It lived up to that perfectly, and set us up for a fun, simple taste of NY life.

Now that said, the place is exactly what this listing says it is: a small, unadorned studio, no more and no less. The size is perfect for two people to sleep in and maybe have a meal or two, but I wouldn’t expect more than that. It’s a wonderful place to crash after active days around town, but if you’re looking for somewhere to set up an inviting home-away-from-home, you might consider something at a higher price point.

It’s also worth noting that David (the host) is great. He communicated with us clearly from start to finish and had straightforward systems and expectations set in place. Not a complaint there at all.
Show more', 'Yoichiro
October 2021
Great location in Chelsea, Manhattan! Just 10minutes walk to the High Line.', 'Scott
October 2021
The location is great. You get what you pay for.', 'Andreas
October 2021
Small studio, but great location on a quiet street. 10 minutes by foot from restaurants and jazz clubs in W Village. Room was clean and bed was comfortable. Good communication from David, the host. A couple of small details need fixing, if you want to get nitpicky, but nothing important. Overall a good value, and I would stay here again.
Show more', 'Amber
October 2021
This is the best gem of an AirBnB in Chelsea. The location is perfect, it’s an authentic NYC pad, and it was clean. We will be back, for sure.', 'Joah
September 2021
Great little space - centrally located, and gets you done what you need to! Small, but exactly what you pay for - worth the price 100%!']

Entire home

Enhanced Clean

Self check-in
Check yourself in with the lockbox.
Great location
90% of recent guests gave the location a 5-star rating.
Clean private studio-style apartment/flat with private kitchen, full-size bathroom, and washer/dryer (laundry) in kitchen.
Also has a futon/convertible sofa to accommodate two (2) additional guests or a total of four (4) guests. (see pictures)

The space
Clean private apartment/flat with private bath, kitchen, and washer/dryer. (see pics).

Unit is on the fourth (4th Floor) and there is no elevator. If you are unable to walk up/down four (4) flights of stairs do not reserve this unit.

This is a private residence not shared by any other guests or occupants.
The unit has an open floor plan, plenty of natural light, and gleaming hardwood floors.

Located in desirable Chelsea area of Manhattan, NY in a quiet neighborhood with tree-lined street. 1 Block from Subway's (A, C, E). Only 10 blocks (5min taxi) from Penn Station.

Has a washer/dryer in kitchen and a small table with 2 chairs.

Bed is a queen-size memory foam mattress, 2 pillows, 1 set of sheets, pillowcases, and blankets.

There is futon/sofa which can sleep an additional two (2) adults.

Kitchen Amenities Include:
Coffee-maker, blender, microwave, cooking utensils, pot, pans, and drinking glasses.

Bathroom supplies include a set of fresh towels and hairdryer.

Price includes heat, electric, water, and WiFi internet.

A quiet tree-lined street with plenty of cafes and restaurants located within walking distance.

One block from the subway.

Building:
• Clean
• Private
• Secured access
• Intercom system.

Television:
• 37" Vizio LCD Smart TV (can be used as computer monitor)
• Wifi Connected
• Download Vizio Remote app for IOS or Android
• Use Pluto or other apps to screen cast to the TV

Main Bed/Mattress:
• BioPEDIC Memory Foam Mattress (queen size)
• Hypoallergenic & Naturally antimicrobial
• Provides deeper, more restful sleep!

Queen-sized pull-out/convertible Futon/Sofa (see pictures)

Kitchen:
• Washer/Dryer
• Refrigerator
• Gas-burner stove and oven
• Microwave
• Coffee Maker
• Blender/mixer, pots, pans, drinking glasses, and cooking utensils.

Private Bathroom:
• Full stand-up shower
• Full bathtub
• Private toilet
• Hairdryer
• Fresh Clean Towels and Facial cloths

General/Miscellaneous
• Wifi (wireless internet)

Transporation
MTA Subway Station A-C is one (1) block away.

CitiBike (bike rental) station located on W 22nd St between 8th and 9th Ave (1 block away).

Express Deli offers great sandwiches at an affordable rate. They also sell beer and other items you may have forgot to pack (soap, tissue paper, etc) and they are open 24hrs.

4.4', 'Joshua
October 2021
My wife and I enjoyed setting up our home base here for our visit to Manhattan. It’s prime selling-point was that it’s right in the middle of everything Manhattan has to offer, without the exorbitant price tag that accompanies most other places in the area. It lived up to that perfectly, and set us up for a fun, simple taste of NY life.

Now that said, the place is exactly what this listing says it is: a small, unadorned studio, no more and no less. The size is perfect for two people to sleep in and maybe have a meal or two, but I wouldn’t expect more than that. It’s a wonderful place to crash after active days around town, but if you’re looking for somewhere to set up an inviting home-away-from-home, you might consider something at a higher price point.

It’s also worth noting that David (the host) is great. He communicated with us clearly from start to finish and had straightforward systems and expectations set in place. Not a complaint there at all.
Show more
Yoichiro
October 2021
Great location in Chelsea, Manhattan! Just 10minutes walk to the High Line.
Scott
October 2021
The location is great. You get what you pay for.
Andreas
October 2021
Small studio, but great location on a quiet street. 10 minutes by foot from restaurants and jazz clubs in W Village. Room was clean and bed was comfortable. Good communication from David, the host. A couple of small details need fixing, if you want to get nitpicky, but nothing important. Overall a good value, and I would stay here again.
Show more
Amber
October 2021
This is the best gem of an AirBnB in Chelsea. The location is perfect, it’s an authentic NYC pad, and it was clean. We will be back, for sure.
Joah
September 2021

Fred
December 2020
Teresa's place was perfect, the location is unbeatable, and she was super responsive as a host. I would definitely stay here again
Adam
November 2017
The host canceled this reservation 9 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.
Andrew
March 2017
I travel constantly for work, and have stayed in more Airbnbs than I'd like to admit. This stands out as my favorite ever. So cozy, right near lots of great stuff, and not drenched in the exact same Ikea furniture I see everywhere else!
Show more
Eddie
July 2016
I would like to start by saying, our stay in New York was amazing! I was there with my teenage son and daughter for a week and we truly had a wonderful time.
My first impression of Teresa's place was somewhat disappointing. It definitely does not live up to the pictures that are shown. No crisp white walls or cute decor to be found. The apartment is small and most areas are packed with the owners belongings. This leaves very little space for suitcases, especially if you have 3 or 4 people. The kitchen has no microwave or coffee maker and is minimally equipped for cooking. It has a three flight narrow stairwell that should be considered. The walk to the subway for us was 0.4 miles. Laundromat and food market close by.
All this being said, the neighborhood is very active and energetic. We never felt unsafe and there is an endless supply of restaurants and bars to visit. My son and daughter really felt like they were part of the New York life. All said and done, we had a great time.
Show more
Flash
January 2016
My wife and I were delighted with our stay here; the hostess left the place in fine condition, and even left us the makings for breakfast our first morning. The apartment is quite pleasant, and the location is wonderful, in a very trendy part of town. It’s right above a very good restaurant which was conveniently open late, even for our arrival late Christmas night.

    I’m an ex-New-Yorker, so I knew what to expect from a vintage building in a fashionable location, and was if anything pleasantly surprised. But there were a few things that might have surprised an out-of-towner. The flat is arranged linearly, so if you need to unfold the futon in the center room, walking around it to get to the main bedroom might be a bit tricky. The bathroom was big enough for me (I’m a bit under six feet), but if you’re taller than about 6'4" you might find it a bit cramped. The control on the radiator doesn’t work very well; even if it did, some heat is provided by hot-water pipes, so you may need to open the interior windows to regulate the temperature. The neighborhood is busy; it’s not particularly noisy by New York standards, but a couple of times there were drunkards or lunatics arguing vociferously on the street—we habitually wear earplugs, so this was not a problem for us.

    Overall it was a comfortable and pleasant stay; we would happily stay there the next time we’re visiting.
Show more
Mark
December 2015
Teresa was very accessible and communicative leading up to our visit. The check-in and check-out process was very simple. Her neighborhood is bustling with all sorts of restaurants and bars just below you so it's in an ideal location if you want easy access to all that the East Village has to offer. Her apartment was quaint but clean, which is all you can ask for in the neighborhood. She also had a nice, large comfy bed, which is great for anyone who is tall like myself.
Show more

Our apartment share is quiet, clean and respectful. Great location, easy to get to Manhattan on subway, car or bus. Your room is confortable with closet, dresser, a compact refrigerator and a queen size bed.

The space

Surai

This was an excellent find! It was really close to a subway station which made getting around NYC very easy and it meant we could also stay out late in other burrows and come back without any safety concerns given how close the station was. This airbnb is also in a safe area with a fire house and other first responder personal just across the street. There's a wonderful little bakery just down the street called Los Angeles Bakery that was tasty and perfect for a quick bite before a long day of touring around NYC. Luis and Victor are very friendly and it was easy to share space with them. Stay here and save a little money to use around NYC's amazing restaurants!
Show more
Fatima And Silvia
July 2021
If you are staying in New York, Luis & Victor’s place is perfect! The apartment is in a quiet area of Brooklyn and is easily accessible to the subway and bus. There is free street parking if you do drive, and stores and dining within walking distance.

The room is really nice and spacious, with big windows for lots of sunlight, and everything from the listing is accurate. There are also usb charging ports and plenty of outlets. We were provided with towels, toiletries, and even masks and hand sanitizer. There is also cable tv and wifi.

Luis & Victor made sure to take extra precautions to prevent the spread of COVID-19 and were very informative about the rules in NYC and available resources. They kept in contact with us leading up to and throughout our trip. This wasn’t our first trip to New York, but we believe that if it was, they would have helped with any questions we had about the city.

This was definitely one of the best Airbnb experiences we’ve had and we would definitely stay here again if given the chance!
Show more
Clément
July 2021

Located in Bowery – historically the most unique streetscape of New York with over 400 years of history and culture – this place is right around the corner of Grand St subway. Super convenient as you can be anywhere in Manhattan in just a few minutes. Steps away from SoHo, NoHo and major subway lines (6,J,Z,N,Q,B,D). Its unbeatable location puts the best of downtown.


Modern unit in an elevator building. This unit is illuminated by floor to ceiling industrial style windows, flooding the home with brilliant light. The room has a hot plate, mini fridge, microwave, closet, spacious bathroom, smart TV and heat/air conditioning.

["Laxmi Budget Cozy Private Room (fights NYC Hunger)

New York, United States

2 guests · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 2 shared baths
Enhanced Clean
This Host committed to Airbnb's 5-step enhanced cleaning process. Show more
Great location
90% of recent guests gave the location a 5-star rating.
Great check-in experience
95% of recent guests gave the check-in process a 5-star rating.
Live in the heart of the East Village. We are a few steps away from the famous bars, fine dining, shopping, galleries, entertainment & more. Only 3 mins to the subway station with major buses across the street. The area has street parking. We are a vegetarian, & smoke-free establishment.
Profit generated from the guest rooms is used to distribute free meals to homeless people. By staying here you are supporting the program and if you like, you are most welcome to volunteer for the same.


Your room has a comfy double bed & big empty closet for storage. It has all the amenities including iron, ironing board, toiletries, hair dryer, tissues, night lamp, hypoallergenic linen & towels.
The room has a big window, thus is well ventilated and has plenty of natural light. Not to mention, the window directly looks at 1st avenue.
The apartment has 2 full baths. The kitchen is fitted with modern stainless steel appliances and silverware, kettle toaster, microwave & coffee maker. You can also enjoy our mini library.
We are following all cleaning protocols( such as checking temperature, sanitising the place, washing sheets at highest heat setting, keeping the apartment ventilated etc) to keep our guests safe during the pandemic.

This apartment is professionally managed by Furnished Quarters, the largest independently owned and operated supplier of short-term furnished housing with over 20 years of experience in the industry. The four-story walkup building is pet-friendly and includes laundry facilities. Located on the Upper West Side, the building is right off Broadway and Amsterdam Avenue, full of great shops, restaurants and bars. It’s also just two avenues from Central Park and Riverside Park, respectively, and three blocks from the American Museum of Natural History. The nearest subway stop is just two blocks away – a 2-minute walk.


This studio apartment in a four-story walkup building offers quintessential uptown charm, with proximity to everything for which the Upper West Side is beloved. The bed provided is queen size, fitted with plush linen sheets and pillows. All Furnished Quarters apartments include: • Fully equipped kitchen • HDTV with cable service • Utilities and domestic phone • Complimentary WiFi • 24/7 guest service

Where you’ll be
New York, United States
The Upper West Side is an inviting neighborhood, rich in culture, exceptional restaurants, outdoor cafés, upscale shops and designer boutiques. Quiet, peaceful and residential, this neighborhood is teeming with a vast array of pre-war architecture and brownstones on tree-lined streets. It’s also home to many college campuses, including Columbia University and Juilliard. Take a walk through picturesque Central Park, visit the famous Museum of Natural History, see a ballet at Lincoln Center or enjoy an opera at the Met. This opulent neighborhood is a cultural and intellectual hub, as it is the home of various museums, performing arts centers, Barnard College and Columbia University. The American Museum of Natural History, American Folk Art Museum, Metropolitan Opera, Lincoln Center for the Performing Arts and Beacon Theater are all located in this area. With so much to explore and discover, this neighborhood is sure to impress. The famous Amsterdam and Columbus Avenues are reliable destinations for numerous bars, cafes, delicatessens, bakeries, brunch spots and more. It is impossible to go hungry in this neighborhood. The Upper West Side is bordered by Central Park to the east, with proximity to points of interest within the park like Sheep Meadow, Strawberry Fields, Cherry Hill and Belvedere Castle. To the west along the Hudson River is Riverside Park, a 4-mile long waterfront park full of jogging trails, playgrounds, concessions, dog runs and recreational facilities. The Upper West Side is an ideal location, teaming with incredible landmarks, delectable restaurants and stunning architecture.

This apartment is professionally managed by Furnished Quarters, the largest independently owned and operated supplier of short-term furnished housing with over 20 years of experience in the industry. The four-story walkup building is pet-friendly and includes laundry facilities. Located on the Upper West Side, the building is right off Broadway and Amsterdam Avenue, full of great shops, restaurants and bars. It’s also just two avenues from Central Park and Riverside Park, respectively, and three blocks from the American Museum of Natural History. The nearest subway stop is just two blocks away – a 2-minute walk.


This studio apartment in a four-story walkup building offers quintessential uptown charm, with proximity to everything for which the Upper West Side is beloved. The bed provided is queen size, fitted with plush linen sheets and pillows. All Furnished Quarters apartments include: • Fully equipped kitchen • HDTV with cable service • Utilities and domestic phone • Complimentary WiFi • 24/7 guest service
