Where you’ll be
New York, United States
The Upper West Side is an inviting neighborhood, rich in culture, exceptional restaurants, outdoor cafés, upscale shops and designer boutiques. Quiet, peaceful and residential, this neighborhood is teeming with a vast array of pre-war architecture and brownstones on tree-lined streets. It’s also home to many college campuses, including Columbia University and Juilliard. Take a walk through picturesque Central Park, visit the famous Museum of Natural History, see a ballet at Lincoln Center or enjoy an opera at the Met. This opulent neighborhood is a cultural and intellectual hub, as it is the home of various museums, performing arts centers, Barnard College and Columbia University. The American Museum of Natural History, American Folk Art Museum, Metropolitan Opera, Lincoln Center for the Performing Arts and Beacon Theater are all located in this area. With so much to explore and discover, this neighborhood is sure to impress. The famous Amsterdam and Columbus Avenues are reliable destinations for numerous bars, cafes, delicatessens, bakeries, brunch spots and more. It is impossible to go hungry in this neighborhood. The Upper West Side is bordered by Central Park to the east, with proximity to points of interest within the park like Sheep Meadow, Strawberry Fields, Cherry Hill and Belvedere Castle. To the west along the Hudson River is Riverside Park, a 4-mile long waterfront park full of jogging trails, playgrounds, concessions, dog runs and recreational facilities. The Upper West Side is an ideal location, teaming with incredible landmarks, delectable restaurants and stunning architecture.

Welcome to your Downtown Hideaway!
Located in the heart of the financial district along the seaport on wall street, everything that the city has to offer is located footsteps away. Our Somewhere Silk Suite offers everything you need for a nice trip to visit the city or long term work stays for our members. We are in the main central hub minutes away from the world trade center and footsteps away from Pier 17 and all your coastal views. Comfortable cozy and chic for a premium stay.

review:
['Rebecca
October 2021
Henry’s place was fantastic! The room was large with a comfortable bed and pillow, a writing desk, and a closet. The weather was lovely so I had a window that opened but there is an air conditioner and heater if needed. The apartment was clean and there is a kitchen to use. The apartment is close to the subway station and to Central Park West. I will definitely stay with Henry again on my next visit.
Show more', 'Laura
October 2021
Great location, private room, clean and comfortable. Henry was very accommodating. Will stay again!', "Elizabeth
October 2021
Henry's place was lovely. Check-in was quick and easy, and the room was clean, cute, and had a lot of light, a desk, and A/C. Because the room was on the opposite side of the apt as Henry's, it afforded relative privacy!
Show more", "Betsy
October 2021
This was one of the best places I have ever stayed. Clean, welcoming, convenient, and easy to get anywhere from. Henry was so kind, yet unobtrusive. Anything I needed he offered me. I hate to give such a good review because I want to make sure it's available when I want to go to NYC again!
Show more", "Jazmine
October 2021
I absolutely loved staying at Henry's, he went above and beyond to accommodate my partner and I. his place is super close to central park and near 103st train entrance which makes it nice. on our last night my iPhone charger broke and he was able to find one for us to use. Shower water pressure was awesome! you get a real feel of the City, If you're looking for a place to stay definitely stay here, I highly recommend his place! thanks for the hospitality

September 2021
Very good communication, clean and accommodating. Was helpful with suggestions and made me feel at home.

Rebecca
October 2021
Henry’s place was fantastic! The room was large with a comfortable bed and pillow, a writing desk, and a closet. Laura
October 2021
Great location, private room, clean and comfortable. Henry was very accommodating. Will stay again!
Elizabeth
October 2021
Henry's place was lovely. Check-in was quick and easy, and the room was clean, cute, and had a lot of light, a desk, and A/C. Because the room was on the opposite side of the apt as Henry's, it afforded relative privacy!
Show more
Betsy
October 2021
This was one of the best places I have ever stayed. Clean, welcoming, convenient, and easy to get anywhere from. Henry was so kind, yet unobtrusive. Anything I needed he offered me. I hate to give such a good review because I want to make sure it's available when I want to go to NYC again!
Show more
Jazmine
October 2021
I absolutely loved staying at Henry's, he went above and beyond to accommodate my partner and I. his place is super close to central park and near 103st train entrance which makes it nice. on our last night my iPhone charger broke and he was able to find one for us to use. Shower water pressure was awesome! you get a real feel of the City, If you're looking for a place to stay definitely stay here, I highly recommend his place! thanks for the hospitality

Shane

Room is as advertised. Clean and a great location.

November 2021
This stay was fantastic!! The bed was comfy, the location was perfect, the hosts were friendly, and it was exactly like what you see on the listing. If I ever come back to New York I wouldn’t want to stay anywhere else. This place made my trip to New York 100X better!

October 2021
The home is lovely just as pictured. The host is wonderful and communicates promptly. I want to be some where closer in the city right off the Metro. We enjoyed our stay. I wish we could have had access to the coffee maker and appliances.
Show more', 'Abigail Elizabeth
October 2021
Magaly and Ricardo are great hosts and they provided exactly the lodging my sister and I needed while we were in NYC. The house was beautiful, immaculate, comfortable, and felt very safe. You can take the Q33 bus to and from LaGuardia Airport, and the Q49 to the subway station easily. There’s a bake shop (Parva) about a 10 min walk away for bagels and coffee if you’re wanting a convenient breakfast in the morning, too. Thanks again Magaly and Ricardo!

Pase su tiempo en la ciudad relajándose en una cómoda habitación en el corazón de uno de los vencidarios más geniales de Nueva York. Disfrute del fácil y rápido acceso a las mejores partes de la ciudad desde este agradable lugar. Ubicado a 5 min del aeropuerto La Guardia, con diversas rutas de buses y tren a menos de 5 min caminando, es una zona segura y a pocos pasos encontrará diversidad de restaurantes, farmacias, supermercados y mucho más.


Es una habitación simple y elegante que cuenta con todo lo que necesita para una estadía maravillosa. Cuando se hospeda con nosotros no se limita al pequeño espacio de los típicos micro apartamentos de Nueva York. Aquí tendrá todo lo esencial para comenzar su viaje.

listing_type: ['Entire rental unit hosted by Mukaram\n4 guests · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 1 bath']
review:
['Sarah
July 2021
This was a pretty good airbnb stay.

Pros: modern, renovated space with high ceilings, great central AC, good natural night, and, a futon couch for any guests that may stay with you. Also the host and his assistant Pierre were great at communication. Also a great grocery store around the corner with wine, fresh produce, and fun snacks.

Cons: pretty unsafe location that was unfit for two girls in their 20s- requiring that we uber once it was dark and feel anxiety most of the time on our block (crackheads and dealers nearby). Not AT ALL the fault of the hosts -- place itself it wonderful-- but if you decide to stay here, would recommend to men/couples/groups and be aware of your surroundings! <3
Show more', 'Mauricio
October 2021

review:
['Alyssa
October 2021
Comfortable and spacious apartment. Good location. Andres is nice and great communicator.', "Julie
October 2021
This spot is great for a solo traveler. I stayed at Andres' apartment for a long weekend and it worked out great. His instructions for finding the key were super clear and he was very quick to respond whenever I had questions. The location is great! It's within walking distance to landmarks such as the Empire State building, the Chrysler building, Grand Central Station, and more. My only tip is that you shouldn't stay here if you have problems with walking up flights of stairs. There's about 4 flights of stairs between the ground level and his floor. Overall this stay met my needs and was a great option for a long weekend on my own
Show more", 'Allen
October 2021
Beautiful, clean, and quiet. Everything you see in the pictures. Excellent communication by the host. Groceries, bars and restaurants literally around the corner. Could not have asked for more.

listing_name: ['LUXURY APT w PRIVATE GARDEN NYC UES']
listing_type: ['Entire rental unit hosted by Gregory\n3 guests · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath']
review:
['Casey
October 2021
Perfect place to stay on the UES! Located in a fantastic area, a peaceful outside garden area, and all the amenities you could need. Highly recommend.', 'Bill
October 2021
The unit is very well located and for New York it is really quiet. The bed is comfortable and the apartment is spacious. However, it needs a good cleaning, paint and at least the couch replaced. The outdoor patio is a great addition however, because of mosquitos (in October) it is not useable.
Show more', 'Morgan
October 2021
Great location and space, it is a nice sized apartment with garden and a block from the Q train. Linens were clean (sheets and towels), bed was very comfortable, apartment was quiet, AC worked so temperature was good, bathroom was pretty clean. Check in and out was a total breeze and we appreciated that check in was at 2pm and not later so we were able to get settled earlier. I agree with past reviews in that the apartment needs some TLC and freshening up - a deep clean and a fresh coat of paint. The sofa and carpet should also be replaced. If we were a long term rental, I would have spent a little time scrubbing. Overall, a lot of positives with a few key things that could be done to make it feel truly luxurious.
Show more', 'Eugene
October 2021
We have used apartment many times! Excellent location, cleanliness, and communication.
Recommend it highly.', "Yiselys
October 2021
I want to begin by saying that this place is in an amazing location, has a nice living room and garden area, and suited our minimal needs of having somewhere to shower and rest. I was a little disillusioned, maybe because this was my first time in New York but based on the pictures of this listing, I was convinced that the Airbnb we were staying at was the brownstone itself. That and the upper east side location is why I was willing to shell out the money it cost for a 3-night stay here, but in reality, we stayed in the lower basement apartment that while as I mentioned suited our needs and has a bedroom, kitchenette and nice garden/living room, it needs some serious renovation, painting, and new furniture. The Tv remote had its batteries taped in, and the TV itself stopped working from one day to the next, even though we only used it before bed or as background noise before leaving. Also, because it was on basement level, I could hear every car, bike, person, and dogs that would pass by at night and I would often be awoken by noise as early as 6 AM.

Overall I had minor grievances but I'm still happy with our stay, even though we likely would get a hotel instead next time.
Show more", 'Nancy
September 2021
Elegant brownstone on a quiet residential street close to major museums and Central Park. Very comfortable furnishings.']

This spacious, 600sq. ft. 1 bedroom apt has a large living room and a separate full kitchen and a large bedroom with a queen size bed. Enjoy your own private entrance and direct access to an additional 350 sq ft private statue garden equipped with a grill and plenty of room for outdoor entertaining. The apartment is on the ground level of a historically landmarked townhouse, nestled in the center of a row of brownstones, located on a beautiful tree-lined block of Manhattan's upper east side.


This spacious, 600sq. ft. 1 bedroom apt has a large living room and a separate full kitchen and a large bedroom with a queen size bed. Enjoy your own private entrance and direct access to an additional 350 sq ft private statue garden equipped with a grill and plenty of room for outdoor entertaining. The apartment is on the ground level of a historically landmarked townhouse, nestled in the center of a row of brownstones, located on a beautiful tree-lined block of Manhattan's upper east side. The kitchen and bathroom boast new marble tile and countertops as well as all new appliances. While the bedroom and livingroom are newly furnished and equipped with HD televisions. Fresh linens and towels are kept fully stocked and daily cleaning service is available. There is also a building superintendent that lives nearby who is available 24 hours a day. Located only 5 blocks from Central Park and seconds away from some of the worlds greatest shopping, attractions, museums and restaurants, as well as easy access to the 4,5,6,N,R,7 subway lines, this magnificent apartment will cater perfectly for anyone looking to enjoy a safe and fun New York Vacation, as well as those who may choose to stay for a longer period of time. May all your travels be grand!!

I was a little disillusioned, maybe because this was my first time in New York but based on the pictures of this listing, I was convinced that the Airbnb we were staying at was the brownstone itself. That and the upper east side location is why I was willing to shell out the money it cost for a 3-night stay here, but in reality, we stayed in the lower basement apartment that while as I mentioned suited our needs and has a bedroom, kitchenette and nice garden/living room, it needs some serious renovation, painting, and new furniture. The Tv remote had its batteries taped in, and the TV itself stopped working from one day to the next, even though we only used it before bed or as background noise before leaving. Also, because it was on basement level, I could hear every car, bike, person, and dogs that would pass by at night and I would often be awoken by noise as early as 6 AM.

Overall I had minor grievances but I'm still happy with our stay, even though we likely would get a hotel instead next time.
Show more
Nancy
September 2021
Elegant brownstone on a quiet residential street close to major museums and Central Park. Very comfortable furnishings.

Great location and space, it is a nice sized apartment with garden and a block from the Q train. I agree with past reviews in that the apartment needs some TLC and freshening up - a deep clean and a fresh coat of paint. The sofa and carpet should also be replaced. This neighborhood is called: Chelsea. 
     There are literally hundreds of small unique restaurants, shops, book stores, galleries, theaters and pubs in Chelsea.  You will find, gently-strolling, pedestrian traffic at all hours of the day of evening.
   Chelsea is not a dark, or dangerous area.   It's a neighborhood that's full of life.
      Many artists, musicians, writers, actors, FIT students, other graduate students, similar intelligentsia, and creative people live in Chelsea.  I think you'll like it here.
     You can get anywhere in New York City quickly and easily from here.
       The subway station is two blocks away (a two minute walk).
Midtown Manhattan is very central and safe. Police station 2 blocks away. We're located within walking distance of Theater District, Penn Station, FIT, Madison Square Garden, High Line Park  
     JKF Airport, Newark Airport, and La Guardia Airport all offer fast, direct, public transportation to Penn Station in Manhattan.  Penn Station is a three minute walk from here.

listing_type: ['Entire rental unit hosted by Jeniffer\n2 guests · Studio · 1 bed · 1 bath']
review:
['Juan Carlos
May 2021
The apartment is well located, you can really see so many things in nyc from the location, even the view from the roof at night is amazing to see the skyline. 20 mins to the highline, the Whitney, the Statue of Liberty etc. The apartment says its an equipped kitchen but realistically it is not, there are two hot plates two forks two knives etc, the hot plates easily set off the fire alarm also. Cooking in the apartment is not really ideal. The fire alarm is sensitive (which is great for safety) but no good if you are trying to make a meal. So be prepared to be eating out for 95% of your meals.
The bed was really comfortable to sleep in, but the floors in the apartment were dirty, I found a couple of fingernails/toenails which weren’t mine and the bath matt/towel was filthy when I had stepped on it after walking around barefoot, few extra hairs in the tub etc. The floors needed to be swept and mopped properly, laundry is a bit confusing to get to but its very handy to have, the street is loud but it’s NyC what do you expect maybe grab some earplugs.
The building is very safe. The hosts could have been a bit better communicating with me about stuff, but not a bad stay.
If you arrive late and are hungry, go to Empanada Mamas on Allen street for Empanadas, they are incredible.
Show more', 'AnaCristina
April 2021
Minimalist clean room and strategic location easy to get various places within walking distance.', 'Shason
March 2021
Great stay at this place in an amazing, accessible, and safe location. Had a lot of fun staying here for 2 weeks.', 'Bernadet
February 2021
A great little space, super walkable to Soho, Nolita, LES, Little Italy, China town. Simple, cool, and clean! Will stay here again!', 'Melissa
February 2021
Very nice place to stay. Easy check in, and very clean room', 'Jennifer
January 2021
This place was perfect for just my boyfriend and me! Super clean and cozy place.']

review:
['Tyler
October 2021
Great value in a great Manhattan location', "Kelly
October 2021
The location is everything, just pretty loud and could've used a heads up (to bring earplugs).", 'Natalie
October 2021
Great location, beautiful apartment, loved our stay!', 'Emily
October 2021
The location is awesome for tons of shopping and food just steps away. Checking in was a breeze. Just be aware that it’s a four flights of stairs up!', 'Tai
October 2021
Centrally located studio in an old school NY apartment building. All the basics you would need and countless stores, bars and restaurants anywhere you walk within 5 blocks. Fantastic value as it also includes A/C and a full kitchen!
Show more', 'Trang
October 2021
We just had a wonderful stay over at this Airbnb. It is conveniently located near both Chinatown and Little Italy.
It’s a wonderful space atop a 4 floor walk up with generous available light. At night, the intersection was very calm -with so much available within walking distance. The unit itself is beautifully and simply kept. Very quiet during our stay. A generous kitchen space opens to the living area along one wall, and the bedroom is located in the back, and was very comfortable. Both the furnishings in the living area and bedroom are generous, simple, and cozy.

All utilities worked fine from shower to stove, and it was a very relaxing stay.

The location makes it easy to access and the neighborhood was wonderful. Some nice local sandwich and convenience shops along with unique boutiques and fine dining.

We really had a wonderful stay and very good trip.

No problems securing the key upon exiting.

Overall, excellent communication and a wonderful stay that makes us look forward to returning.

review:
['Willow
July 2021
A great studio with a lot of potential. Michael was very helpful. The area is close to great restaurants. There is no elevator so make sure you know what floor you’ll be on if you choose to stay here. You might end up on the 5th floor. So, pack light.
Show more', 'Arthur
September 2018
If you want to live in very old old building, with wet and smalls maybe is yours destination. But when i booked this apartment for 4 month and saw that - after 5 day i moved from this place. Its old building with 5 floor, each with 4 apartment , without elevator. This apartment on 5 floor. When in NYC sunshine and 78-95 F. apartment is warm up. AC to small and not powerful enough for that space. Its not good apartment! Be careful and do not make my mistakes. 100% true without false and decorated.
Show more', 'Collin
August 2018
Michael was an amazing host. He was very responsive with messages often making an effort to stop by the same day that you ask for something. He was always asking if I needed anything for the place and how the stay was going.

The location is really good, plenty of close places to eat/drink. Rooftop bars around, a short walk to the high line park, easy access to subways, etc. Also a safe area, I never felt uneasy walking home at night. There is a rooftop (furnitureless) on the building with a really beautiful view of the Empire State.

There is also a live in building keeper who takes care of the building itself and keeps the entryway clean, very friendly guy.

I would highly recommend this place to anyone coming to work in/visit the city. Great price, location and host. I would stay here again in a heartbeat.
Show more', 'Maria
August 2017
Michaels place was very well located in Chelsea. Close to shopping and public transport. Quiet residential building made us feel at home even though we were away. Would definitely recommend and stay again in the future.
Show more', "Andy
May 2020
I stayed in Michael's Airbnb for about 5 months. It is in a super convenient location, and Michael is a great host. For my purposes, I was able to go to anywhere I want in Manhattan within around 20 minutes, except for maybe the upper west side, and lower east side. I was worried about noise being an issue before I moved in, but the neighborhood was rather quiet so that wasn't a problem at all. Michael himself is a great host, and if you have any problems with your apartment, he won't hesitate to solve them as long as you communicate them with him. Would recommend a stay here as long as you're sure the space of the studio fits your needs. It was enough space for one person for sure.
Show more", 'Fernanda
December 2017
The place is well located but I wouldn’t say it’s located in Chelsea. It’s more in the midtown west of manhattan. The place is a little sketchy at night and the building always smells like tobacco. When I told michale if there was anything we could do to stop the smell, he said that he couldn’t do much ( I don’t know why because he is the owner of the whole building) . There are cockroaches ( but it’s a common thing in the city). The door doesn’t have a proper doorknob which made me afraid that someone was gonna break i (Website hidden by Airbnb) ( thankfully nothing happened). Despite all of these I was planning to extend my stay because it is very well located but when I approached Michael to tell him my plans he was really rude about it. I would suggest this place for someone that it is staying just for a couple of days.
Show more']

This sunny south facing apartment is around the corner from Madison Square Garden and a short walk to Fashion Institute of Technology, Penn Station, N.J. Transit, the A, C and E and #1 subway trains. You get a Newly Renovated private bath, your own new LG washer/dryer, Newly upgraded Kitchenette with dishes, stove, utensils, refrigerator, microwave, pots, pans, coffee maker, flat screen TV and Free WiFi.
New Double pane windows, New large efficient sleeve air conditioner, new queen size bed.


Very sunny apartment with open city/sky views, new Hard Wood Floors, new appliances and flat screen TV, high ceilings and great southern exposure. There is a table and chairs, WASHER/DRYER and Free WiFi!
The large new supermarket is on the corner and laundry drop off service is 2 short blocks away. Many restaurants, theaters, nightclubs and galleries are within walking distance in this vibrant Chelsea neighborhood.

Willow
July 2021
A great studio with a lot of potential. Michael was very helpful. The area is close to great restaurants. There is no elevator so make sure you know what floor you’ll be on if you choose to stay here. You might end up on the 5th floor. So, pack light.
Show more
Arthur
September 2018
If you want to live in very old old building, with wet and smalls maybe is yours destination. But when i booked this apartment for 4 month and saw that - after 5 day i moved from this place. Its old building with 5 floor, each with 4 apartment , without elevator. This apartment on 5 floor. When in NYC sunshine and 78-95 F. apartment is warm up. AC to small and not powerful enough for that space. Its not good apartment! Be careful and do not make my mistakes. 100% true without false and decorated.
Show more
Collin
August 2018
Michael was an amazing host. He was very responsive with messages often making an effort to stop by the same day that you ask for something. He was always asking if I needed anything for the place and how the stay was going.

The location is really good, plenty of close places to eat/drink. Rooftop bars around, a short walk to the high line park, easy access to subways, etc. Also a safe area, I never felt uneasy walking home at night. There is a rooftop (furnitureless) on the building with a really beautiful view of the Empire State.

There is also a live in building keeper who takes care of the building itself and keeps the entryway clean, very friendly guy.

I would highly recommend this place to anyone coming to work in/visit the city. Great price, location and host. I would stay here again in a heartbeat.
Show more
Maria
August 2017
Michaels place was very well located in Chelsea. Close to shopping and public transport. Quiet residential building made us feel at home even though we were away. Would definitely recommend and stay again in the future.
Show more
Andy
May 2020
I stayed in Michael's Airbnb for about 5 months. It is in a super convenient location, and Michael is a great host. For my purposes, I was able to go to anywhere I want in Manhattan within around 20 minutes, except for maybe the upper west side, and lower east side. I was worried about noise being an issue before I moved in, but the neighborhood was rather quiet so that wasn't a problem at all. Michael himself is a great host, and if you have any problems with your apartment, he won't hesitate to solve them as long as you communicate them with him. Would recommend a stay here as long as you're sure the space of the studio fits your needs. It was enough space for one person for sure.
Show more
Fernanda
December 2017
The place is well located but I wouldn’t say it’s located in Chelsea. It’s more in the midtown west of manhattan. The place is a little sketchy at night and the building always smells like tobacco. When I told michale if there was anything we could do to stop the smell, he said that he couldn’t do much ( I don’t know why because he is the owner of the whole building) . There are cockroaches ( but it’s a common thing in the city). The door doesn’t have a proper doorknob which made me afraid that someone was gonna break i (Website hidden by Airbnb) ( thankfully nothing happened). Despite all of these I was planning to extend my stay because it is very well located but when I approached Michael to tell him my plans he was really rude about it. I would suggest this place for someone that it is staying just for a couple of days.
Show more

The High Line is 2 blocks to the West. Times Square is one subway stop to the North. West Village/ Meatpacking District is 2 subway stops south.

review:
['Dante
October 2021
Great place great value !', 'Eric
October 2021
Good:
1. Overall room and bathroom clean
2. Pretty good location many buses pretty close to go to Manhattan
3. Price is good

Bad:
1. REALLY bad rotten smell in the room, my clothes and luggage still smell like it and it’s been 3 days since I checked out
2. The WiFi was very weak and slow. Had to pretty much use my 5G the whole time.
3. Communication with the host was slow. Reported above and agreed to transfer me to a new room. But never happened and never contacted me again.

I end up changed my reservation and checked out early. Not bad price and location. But had issues.
Show more', 'Omoya
October 2021
Overall, it was a pleasant stay. The host was easy to communicate with (fast response). I’d suggest some earplugs (passing cars tend to blast music). The check in and check out process was a breeze.
Show more', 'Jorge
September 2021
Thanks great stay', 'John
September 2021
The Good:
- Location: decently quiet neighborhood right by a main bus stop
- Communication: the host was very responsive and answered all of my questions in a timely manner
- Cleanliness: the room itself was clean and neat, and there is a daily cleaning crew. Bathrooms also clean.

The No-So-Good:
- Check-In: The provided check-in instructions were not clear; it was ambiguous as to which exact key to take from the lockbox. Additionally, a key that was supposed to be there was missing, which I soon found out was because another guest mistakenly took occupancy in my room. I talked with that guest and she showed me her message with the host which also listed the same room. I was soon put in a room a floor above. This was a stressful inconvenience that should not happen.
- Stairs: not a huge con, but you should be aware that the stairs here are narrow and thin, meaning you have to watch every step. Additionally, some of the steps had broken tule requiring blue tape.
- Windows: the blinds on my windows were broken in a spot meaning that people outside had visibility into my room which invaded my privacy. The room was small enough such that no matter where I went there was still an angle to peek into the room.
Show more', 'Adrian
September 2021
A very clean atmosphere, no nonsense, and definitely a good hotel to stay at if you are someone who can get by with essentials and a little extra.']

owner_details:
["$49 a night. $280 weekly. Free WiFi
4.41
(51 reviews)
·
Union City, New Jersey, United States
Share
Save
Show all photos
Private room hosted by Kevin
1 guest · 1 bedroom · 1 shared bath
Enhanced Clean
This Host committed to Airbnb's 5-step enhanced cleaning process. Show more
Self check-in
Check yourself in with the lockbox.
She-Fah Hotel is a nice quite place to stay. What is really great about our place is how convenient we are to New York City. Just a short walk to the bus stop you can get to NYC within minutes. We are the most affordable hotel in the whole area.

The space
We are a town Hotel and we have been open for about 30 years. We have 35 guest rooms and we have a full private/shareable bathroom for the guest rooms that do not have a bathroom. We keep the bathrooms clean daily and we clean the rooms once a week. We also provide Free wifi, Regular HD channels and fresh towels and lines. What makes our Hotel special is the prime location, it truly dose not get any better than where we are. With a short walk to the bus stops you can take a shuttle bus that will cost you only $3 dollars. Within minutes you will arrive to New York City Port authority on 42nd street. From there you can walk a block or two to see the famous Times Square in NYC or many other options to choose from. When you visit New York City there are unlimited places to visit and experience for the first time. Another reason why its best to book with us is that we are the most affordable Hotel in the area. Only $39 a night compared to $79 a night and your 1 mile further than New York City which isn't a good idea, especially with traffic. October 2021
Great place great value !
Eric
October 2021
Good:
1. Overall room and bathroom clean
2. Pretty good location many buses pretty close to go to Manhattan
3. Price is good

Bad:
1. REALLY bad rotten smell in the room, my clothes and luggage still smell like it and it’s been 3 days since I checked out
2. The WiFi was very weak and slow. Had to pretty much use my 5G the whole time.
3. Communication with the host was slow. Reported above and agreed to transfer me to a new room. But never happened and never contacted me again.

I end up changed my reservation and checked out early. Not bad price and location. But had issues.
Show more
Omoya
October 2021
Overall, it was a pleasant stay. The host was easy to communicate with (fast response). I’d suggest some earplugs (passing cars tend to blast music). The check in and check out process was a breeze.
Show more
Jorge
September 2021
Thanks great stay
John
September 2021
The Good:
- Location: decently quiet neighborhood right by a main bus stop
- Communication: the host was very responsive and answered all of my questions in a timely manner
- Cleanliness: the room itself was clean and neat, and there is a daily cleaning crew. Bathrooms also clean.

The No-So-Good:
- Check-In: The provided check-in instructions were not clear; it was ambiguous as to which exact key to take from the lockbox. Additionally, a key that was supposed to be there was missing, which I soon found out was because another guest mistakenly took occupancy in my room. I talked with that guest and she showed me her message with the host which also listed the same room. I was soon put in a room a floor above. This was a stressful inconvenience that should not happen.
- Stairs: not a huge con, but you should be aware that the stairs here are narrow and thin, meaning you have to watch every step. Additionally, some of the steps had broken tule requiring blue tape.
- Windows: the blinds on my windows were broken in a spot meaning that people outside had visibility into my room which invaded my privacy. The room was small enough such that no matter where I went there was still an angle to peek into the room.
Show more
Adrian
September 2021
A very clean atmosphere, no nonsense, and definitely a good hotel to stay at if you are someone who can get by with essentials and a little extra.

Enhanced Clean

This one-bedroom apartment in a 3 family house built in 1920, located in the Bushwick neighborhood in Brooklyn, NY.
This is a gem for travelers wanting to experience the vibrant atmosphere of Bushwick and be conveniently close to the city! Close to restaurants, stunning murals, grocery, coffee shops, and many interesting places to wonder around. On top of that, this small family house is conveniently located around the block from the L subway to downtown Manhattan (20 min ride)


This is an entire one-bedroom apartment.
Enjoy your privacy while you experience a railroad apartment-style home at NY!

Great value for the money and very accurate description. You can’t beat the location, with easy access to metro, sights, and close proximity to restaurants/cafes. Marina
October 2021
Great value for the money and very accurate description. You can’t beat the location, with easy access to metro, sights, and close proximity to restaurants/cafes. The room is very spacious and though it can get warm you can quickly cool it off with the provided fan and/or AC. The dark thick curtains are also good to keep the light out. The bed is comfy and there is plenty of closet space (and clothes hangers!). Great water pressure in the shower too. I did not get to meet Guillermo but his communication was great and his friend Mario was there for check-in and check-out, and it was a breeze. Would stay here again for sure!
Show more
Gabriel
October 2021
My wife and I had a wonderful stay. Very convenient location with lots of good food nearby and close subway stops. It could be quite noisy at night and in the morning when we had the window open. Not a glamorous place, but nice and roomy and met all our needs. Guillermo was accommodating but kept to himself and gave us space to come and go as we pleased. The ideal practical stay for roaming the city.
Show more
Mat
September 2021
No bad experiences with location
Robert
September 2021
Even though the host was absent he had a friend there to let me in. The host checked in daily to make sure things were going good. Highly recommend
Bryan
September 2021
The location of this room is ideal for touring NYC. You are a short walk from 3 subway lines, several bagel shops, and lots of restaurants and a very conveniently located 7/11 for those late night snacks.. Guillermo and George were very kind and checked on us often to make sure we where doing ok. The room is large esp for NYC, but the bed is a full size bed. It was comfortable but a little small for me and my husband. I would highly recommend this place and would stay with Guillermo and George again in the future.

A private room in a shared apartment located in one of the most central and desirable neighborhoods in Hell's Kitchen/Manhattan. You will be within walking distance to Times Square(where you can reach ALL METRO lines), Central Park, Hudson River Park, Lincoln Center, Port Authority Bus Terminal, Javits Center, Rockefeller Center, and Penn Station. Surrounded by many restaurants, 24-hour mini markets, and pharmacies, bars, pubs. You’ll love my place because of the location!

owner_details:
['Stretch out in your Private Queen Suite - NYC
4.44
(18 reviews)
·
New York, United States
Share

Room in boutique hotel hosted by Matthew
4 guests · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 private bath
Enhanced Clean
This Host committed to Airbnb's 5-step enhanced cleaning process. Show more
Self check-in
You can check in with the doorman.
A spacious, well-appointed room in a boutique Manhattan hotel that puts every New York City studio apartment to shame! In "the city that never sleeps", this dynamic NYC neighborhood called the Fashion District is bustling during the day before transforming into a quiet residential community in the evening. Floor to ceiling windows and bespoke furniture fused with sophisticated style, with every modern amenity you’d want!

Rates listed are inclusive of taxes
$10 Daily Amenity Fee due at check in


Our studio suite with queen bed offer separate living and sleeping areas with a double sofabed. The suites with floor to ceiling windows and 9-foot high ceilings come with sumptuous bed and plush bedding including custom designed furniture. Our bathrooms are adorned with marble countertops individual bath products for your safety. Plus, two 43-inch flat screen TVs with cable, mini fridge, spacious work desk, audio docking station, cordless bedside phone, Keurig coffee maker, bathrobes, hairdryer, electronic safe.

This apartment is a 1-minute walk from 3 major subway lines, and centrally-located between midtown and downtown - offering easy access to most of NYC’s tourist attractions. It is situated on the border between the young and stylish East Village and Lower East Side neighborhoods, surrounded by inexpensive restaurants, cafes, bars, galleries and shops. The room features a spring + memory-foam bed, and a street-facing window. The rest of the apartment is yours to share and enjoy as well, welcome!


* To book, you can book instantly and please tell me a little bit about yourself and your arrival/departure time. I'm also happy to answer any questions you may have. I look forward to hearing from you! Best, Jackie *

Situated in a recently-renovated two-bedroom apartment, your private room is furnished with brand-new amenities, including a desk, ultra-comfortable full-size Hybrid Innerspring Mattress, and soft towels.

Your room has a east-facing window with lots of light and a blackout shade. It overlooks a park cross the street. Earplugs are provided in your side table for your comfort. The room has its own air conditioning during the summer and its own heater during winter.

Come experience unmatched luxury and hospitality at Aum. The space was designed by an award winning ex-WeWork interior designer with focus on holistic living which includes memory foam mattress bed, ergonomically designed workspace, Smart TV, high speed internet, fully loaded kitchen, free breakfast, lavish shared bathroom, 2 minutes from subway and steps away from riverside park and Hudson river.


Relax:

· Highest Quality Memory foam mattress

· Finest cotton linens, plush pillows, and blankets to ensure you sleep like a baby. We also provide complimentary ear plugs to keep out New York City noise

Work:

· AumWorkspace designed workspace which includes top of the line ergonomic chair, spacious table with storage, naturally elements such as paintings and plants to make the space lively and spark creativity

· Ultra-high-speed optical fiber internet

Play:

· Big Screen Smart TV with optimal placement in the room for effortless binge watching from the comfort of your bed

· FREE continental breakfast, tea and coffee

Communal:

· Well equipped kitchen with spacious dinning space. All essential utensils, spices, oils, etc. available for free if you wish to cook.

· Fully renovated restroom with high pressure shower, wooden toilet seat for temperature control, hair dryer

· Complimentary organic shampoo, conditioner, and body wash

· Washer and dryer in the basement of the building (charges apply)

Extras:

· Large closet in the room to store your luggage, belongings and more, leaving the room space free of clutter

· Body length mirror to make sure you check out your outfit and get ready to vow New York City

Self check-in

Mini Studio with small private bathroom and small private kitchen with full bed. 15 minutes away from John F. Kennedy (JFK) Airport. Closest train is the J (Cypress Hills stop, 3 blocks), MTA Transit Buses: Q56 1 block and B13 3 blocks. Restaurants (American, Dominican, Chinese) 2, 3, 4 blocks. Supermarkets 3, 4, 5 blocks. Grocery Stores 1, 2, 3 blocks. Laundry 1 block.

The room is a little narrow it is 5.5 feet (66 Inches or 167cm) wide and 10 feet (120 Inches or 304cm) long. Has 2 windows.


JFK Airport 15 minutes away. Multiple restaurants, supermarkets, train station (subway), buses, liquor stores, bars, laundromats, banks, and stores all at walking distance (from 1 to 5 blocks away).

Parking is free on the streets. It is on a first come first served basis. It is very difficult to find parking specially at night (from 5PM to 9AM). For a better exerience I do not recommend that you come driving your own vehicle. If you come driving your own vehicle you may have to drive around and may have to park far away from the house (if you are able to find parking at all).

["Traveller's Flat – Hell's Kitchen
4.91

Entire home

Enhanced Clean
This Host committed to Airbnb's 5-step enhanced cleaning process. Show more
Self check-in
Check yourself in with the lockbox.
Great location
95% of recent guests gave the location a 5-star rating.
A charming one bedroom apartment in the heart of New York City with a large living room. On the ground floor (floor zero). Perfect for families, groups of friends or even for couples looking for a complete stay. Surrounded by numerous restaurants, 24H stores and pharmacies, multiple train (metro) stations – and a short walk from Times Square, Central Park and Rockefeller Plaza!

An authentic New York experience, a real bed, and the best neighborhood in the city.


This recently renovated, cozy, and quiet Midtown Manhattan-one bedroom flat (complete apartment) in the heart of New York is a typical, traditional and authentic feel for how New Yorkers live. I welcome all guests to stay at this place during their visit of New York.

The apartment (flat) is convenient for all guests, fitted with a kitchen, small dining area and the bedroom – couples will find this accommodation welcoming and cozy queen-size bed, whilst groups of friends will find their trip to New York perfect with this accommodation.

The apartment has a cozy living room; the sofa unfolds into a large two person bed; a dinning table and large space to prepare meals. With large windows there is plenty of natural lighting and breeze. The place has heating, and air conditioning is fitted during the hotter months.

For groups of six persons, please note that the third bed is large and memory foam roll-up mattress. For stays with more than six persons, please contact me to properly accommodate.

Nicole
October 2021
Loved our stay-it was just me and my hubby and the space was just perfect and just big enough for the two of us. Great location (near a bunch of restaurants, delis and markets) the area was safe and the place was super clean- the floors literally shone!
Show more
Margaret
October 2021
This was the quietest and best equipped airbnb in NYC that we have ever stayed in and we come a lot. The place had toilet paper, coffee, filters, napkins, ample silverware, plates and cups, and a huge refrigerator. It was very clean and quiet and the bed was so comfortable. We had a great time there and you will too.
Note that if you are taking public transportation, the M50 bus goes east on 50th Street and west on 49th, so very handy. Unlimited bus and subway is only $33 per week. We used buses a lot. The Mll goes north on the corner near the flat. I highly recommend this airbnb apartment.
Show more
Morgan
October 2021
Marco's place was very clean and cozy. It was in a great location and just far away enough from the main roads you couldn't hear all the noises when trying to go to sleep. It was close to so many great restaurants and sites. It had a lot of amenities to satisfy our stay. Overall, I would definitely recommend this place to anyone going to New York.
Show more
Jeffrey
August 2021
Great
Jackie

Quiet, comfy, and clean apartment for our family of 4. Would stay here again.
Ambrose
August 2021
Marco's place was just what I needed and the AC was ice cold!
Show all 193 reviews
Where you’ll be
New York, United States
Hell's Kitchen is the pinnacle example of what New York is: There are hundreds, maybe even a thousand different types of restaurants in this neighborhood, you expect anything from Afghan to Zimbabwean. Do expect to hear at least one hundred different languages spoken, and to see people of all shapes, sizes and color.

Times Square is at most an 8 min walk from the accommodation, numerous train (metro) stations are within walking distance and even Central Park is only a 10-15 minute walk.

Surrounded by many great Italian, Greek, Turkish, Japanese, Mexican, Thai restaurants and American dinners.

Bars and pubs, 24-hour stores, pharmacies and open-late restaurants. There are even some discotheques nearby.
Show more

My place is close to La Guardia Airport, MET Stadium, The 7 train, US Open. You’ll love my place because of the comfy bed, the light, all sport, movie and Spanish channels. Private room with lock and keys. Close to the city. Lots of restaurants and stores near by. . My place is good for solo adventurers and business travelers.

The space
The house is a block away from the 7 Train (90th street stop) and it takes 15 minutes to get to midtown manhattan. The 7 train can take you to Citi Field - Mets Stadium, Queens Museum, Time Square and Arthur Ashe Stadium for U.S.Tennis Open, LaGuardia Airport is very close. It's a great location to stay if you are participating in the ING NYC Marathon, Other close places from our house include 42nd Street for Broadway shows, Grand Central Station, Bryant Park, Central Park, 5th Ave shopping area, Rockefeller Center, Radio City Hall, NBC studios, Columbus Circle, Long Island City with a Manhattan skyline view at the Pier, MoMa Museum, PS 1 Museum , the museum of Natural History, the Guggenheim Museum and the Art & Design Museum.

Where you’ll be
Queens, New York, United States
Just about every language on Earth is spoken somewhere in Queens, and a stroll around the neighborhood of Jackson Heights might make you think that almost every type of food in the world is served here, too. An influx of immigrants, especially from South Asia and Latin America, arrived in the area in recent years, bringing recipes and distinctive preparations with them. Stuffed Tibetan dumplings, fruity Colombian beverages, spicy Indian chaat and other delicious edibles and drinkables may be had from street carts and established restaurants—even out of the back of a cell phone store. But Jackson Heights offers more than palate-pleasing, belly-bursting food. Every summer it hosts the Queens Pride Parade and Multicultural Festival, and serves as the borough's center of gay culture year-round. Much of the neighborhood is a designated historic district, in recognition of its characteristic garden apartments and urban design. The inventor of Scrabble lived in Jackson Heights; he is memorialized via a Scrabble-esque street sign. Only a few stops on the subway from Midtown Manhattan, this largely residential neighborhood welcomes visitors, priding itself on being the kind of place where people from elsewhere can feel at home, much like New York City itself.

['Genevieve
October 2021
Great location, all necessary amenities, clean, easy check-in, and wonderful communication. Thank you for a great visit!', 'Boaz
October 2021
Remember wc and shower are communal and in the hallway. You get a studio with kitchenette full-size appliances and double bed', "Drew
October 2021
Yuki's AirBnB was the perfect spot for a trip to NYC. The location and ease of access was incredible. Communal bathrooms/shower were no problem. We had no issues throughout our stay.
Show more", 'Skylar
October 2021
Great location and good communication.', 'Karlyn
October 2021
Lovely place to stay. Great location with lots of places in walking distance. Yuki was very kind and friendly and gave clear instructions for check-in/check-out. Would stay here again!
Show more', "Kurt
September 2021
Street # part of the address is 140; Yuki will send you the apt. # closer to your stay. Turn the key the other way if you can't get the door unlocked/locked. As others have said, great location...safe & about 2 blocks away from 2 diff lines' subway stops. Grocery stores & restaurants are even closer. Bring earplugs (the guests in the other 6 apts on the floor can tend to be door slammers) & flip flops/slides for the shower room. Bummer that it takes so long for the shower hot water to come. But the bathrooms were pretty clean and maintained by blgd staff. Bring your own bar soap & shampoo. Before my stay, Yuki sometimes took quite a while or didn't respond to messages. I messaged then didnt hear back and had to text her about a problem w/ her availability calendar I had when I tried to reschedule my dates. She didn't get back to me in time, then the alt dates I wanted got booked by others. She was communicative via text just before my trip and at the end—before, sending detailed check in info and my last day, checking in. Overall, the perfect place if you're not looking for anything fancy or posh & need something well priced and close to lots of stuff.
Show more"]

listing_type: ['Entire condominium (condo) hosted by Andrea\n4 guests · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath']
review:
['Abigail
November 2021
Loved our time here! Came for a week for work and it was the perfect location - easy to get around, next to lots of great restaurants/bars. Loved the aesthetic and feel of the place. Picking up keys blocks away wasn’t ideal but we didn’t have any problems with it.
Show more', 'Abby
October 2021
This space was perfect for a short stay in NYC! It was clean, quiet and had a lovely little private patio that was perfect for lounging and enjoying the sounds of the city.', 'Catherine
October 2021
Good location', 'Ashley
October 2021
Incredible spot', "Suzanne
October 2021
Andrea's place feels cozy in the best way possible. Everything you need is provided. I think my favorite bit is the variety of lighting options. There is strong overhead lighting when you want it bright, and a range of lamps for more of a chill mood. The outside space is lovely. I enjoyed working on my laptop and enjoying the lovely weather. It's right around the corner from the subway, which made getting around the city convenient. There are nearby bars, grocery, and eateries that kept me in the neighborhood too. I was thrilled that it was walking distance to Russ & Daughters. Yum. I would definitely recommend if you are staying in LES.
Show more", 'Joseph
October 2021
Nice slice of Manhattan living; this is the NYC apartment that I wished I could afford in my 20s. For me, this was a real Airbnb experience. Walked to Whole Foods, made breakfast and coffee with the French-press, then hit the streets feeling like a king. The lower east side can be noisy, but it was surprisingly quite inside the unit; at the end of the day, it’s just the thing. Leather couch, plenty of room to hang clothes, nice shower. I would use it again!
Show more']

It's right around the corner from the subway, which made getting around the city convenient. There are nearby bars, grocery, and eateries that kept me in the neighborhood too. I was thrilled that it was walking distance to Russ & Daughters. Yum. I would definitely recommend if you are staying in LES.
Show more
Joseph
October 2021
Nice slice of Manhattan living; this is the NYC apartment that I wished I could afford in my 20s. For me, this was a real Airbnb experience. Walked to Whole Foods, made breakfast and coffee with the French-press, then hit the streets feeling like a king. The lower east side can be noisy, but it was surprisingly quite inside the unit; at the end of the day, it’s just the thing. Leather couch, plenty of room to hang clothes, nice shower. I would use it again!
Show more

owner_details:
["Private Room in Manhattan 15 min. from Midtown!
4.90
(80 reviews)
·
\U000f0003
Superhost
·
New York, United States
Share

Private room in townhouse hosted by Benat
1 guest · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 shared bath
Enhanced Clean
This Host committed to Airbnb's 5-step enhanced cleaning process. Show more
Self check-in
Check yourself in with the lockbox.
Great location
92% of recent guests gave the location a 5-star rating.
Beautifully renovated Brownstone that keeps many of the original features, so you can feel its history. The House is located in Central Harlem, a safe and vibrant neighborhood. Conveniently located 4 blocks away from the subway that will take you into midtown Manhattan in 10-15 minutes. 5 blocks away from Whole foods supermarket and 125th street, where you will find all the stores, and a wide variety of restaurants and cafes.
Right next to Marcus Garvey Park and 10 blocks away from Central Park!


We live in the 3rd floor and The Guest Room is located in the top floor(4th floor), which has beautiful skylights all throughout. You have an access to the bathroom and small kitchenette on your floor (4th floor). In the big bathroom there are two sets of toilets, showers and sinks so you will be using on the LEFT side of everything by yourself.
There are another 3 rooms from which 2 of them are used as art studio spaces on the same floor but most likely you won’t get to see the artists(a female figurative artist and myself) since they barely come to work so only if you are lucky you will get to meet them and see their art!), that to be said, you will find that the top floor very quiet and private.
.

I’m a solo female traveler, while the block itself this Airbnb sits on was a seemingly safe residential block, the surrounding blocks were a little sketchy at night. I biked on the citibikes, so had to walk a couple blocks each night after I returned the bike to the bike stand. Men congregate on the sidewalks and catcall the women as they walk by… just a heads up to my other solo travelers! I also used uber during my stay to get dropped off on the same block as the Airbnb. I felt safer doing this, but the bikes were more economical.
Show more
Diana
October 2021
I thoroughly enjoyed my stay at Beñat’s home! It was in a very convenient location, only a few blocks away from the 2/3 station. The room was clean and comfortable, as was the bathroom. Even though there were other people living in the home, you have a lot of privacy since the listing is on the top floor. The home itself is beautiful, with lots of art and photos on the walls. Beñat was very communicative and provided helpful information about parking on the street. I would definitely recommend staying here—it’s a really great value for all that you get!
Show more

October 2021

["Beautiful Private Room with Laundry - Williamsburg
4.62

Private room in rental unit hosted by Yousef & Ivy
2 guests · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 2 shared baths
Enhanced Clean
This Host committed to Airbnb's 5-step enhanced cleaning process. Show more
Self check-in
Check yourself in with the lockbox.
Welcome to our humble abode in the Southside of Williamsburg. My place is fully equipped with high speed internet along with a fully equipped kitchen and ample living room space to relax after a long day. There are 5 bedrooms and 2 full bathrooms along with washer and dryer. You will share the common areas other fellow travelers and have your own room


Your room has a double/full sized bed, pillow top micro coil mattresses. You have your own radiator and air conditioner, and a hair dryer for your room. There is also a full closet and a small side table, in addition to the couch and dining seating in the common area. There is a fully equipped kitchen with an oven, stove, microwave, coffee maker (bring your own grounds etc.), toaster, and electric kettle in addition to pots/pans and utensils at your disposal. The lounge/kitchen space and 2 bathrooms are shared with myself and other guests of this air b&b. Clean sheets/ towels are provided. Washer and Dryer in the unit.

Show more', "Marco

Susan is a beautiful person with a beautiful smile and a cool house to stay in.
Room
is so wide compared with other Nyc style rooms, clean and neat

Susan’s place is easy to find and great value if you are looking for a short term place to stay.', 'Mashama
September 2021
Cozy, quiet and friendly host.', 'Daniel
August 2021
This place was amazing, especially for the price! Susan’s son was extremely welcoming and helpful. He communicated effectively and waited outside of the house to make it easier for me to find it. The entire house was very clean and quiet. Even though I don’t think towels were listed in the amenities (unless I missed that part) there were bath and hand towels laid out on the bed which was a very pleasant surprise! This is a great cozy option that’s well-priced in a nice neighborhood in Brooklyn. The bedroom was spacious and very comfy, a/c worked very well and although there is no ceiling light in the room there is a pretty bright lamp which you only really need if you’re up at night (the daylight lights the room right up!). The house is a little far from the train station but that is the only downside, and with everything else you’re getting it‘a definitely worth it. This place lives up to the “Villa” title, I would highly recommend it! Would for sure come again! :))

August 2021

July 2021

Gorgeous Fully furnished/equipped midtown 1 bedroom + living room 1st floor apartment, sleep 3. Steps to Time Square - right by the subway.
The apt has a full kitchen, cable TV, A.C. and WI-FI connection. We provide guests with dish soap, sponge, shower gel, shampoo, towels, sheets, blankets, silverware pots,pans and kitchen utensils.


Fully furnished/equipped 1 bedroom 1st floor apartment, sleep 3. The apt has a full kitchen, cable TV, A.C. and W-IFI Internet connection. We provide guests with towels, sheets, blankets, silverware, pots,pans and kitchen utensils. The building stands in the Heart of NYC!! ********Walk to SUBWAY (40 feet - 10 meters) "A-C-E-1-2-3-7-N-Q-R-S" lines. Why pay $250/280 for a two/three stars hotel room when you can have your own fully equipped apartment **** WITH KITCHEN***** for half of that rate?????

Jennifer
November 2021
This place was great! Location can’t be beat. It’s right next to the subway which makes it very easy to get around. There was quite a bit of street and neighbor noise, but that’s to be expected. Only complaint was there were no paper towels and no extra blankets for the futon which seemed weird but we made it work. I’d definitely stay here again!
Show more
Michael
October 2021
There were many issues with this AirBnB experience. First, Ez did not respond to any of my messages from booking to check in; non-existent communication. Second, upon arrival the space was not furnished as pictured. Most importantly, the couch shown in the pictures of the living room was not in the space. Due to this, we attempted to cancel the reservation, which was denied by Ez. Ez subsequently called me and took an aggressive and lecturing tone. I then had to take the dispute to AirBnB who were helpful and cancelled the booking. Lastly, one roll of toilet paper is not enough for two people and a five day stay.
Show more
Jerry
October 2021
This location was ideal...easy walk to TSquare and a subway stop in the block. The space was OK, but we did have some issues with our stay.
1. We told them in advance that we were planning to cook. There was no spatula, salt, pepper, paper towels.
2. It got chilly while we were there and the heat didn't come on (radiator). We contacted them and they promised to fix it...never happened.
3. We were left with 1 roll of toilet paper for 2 adults for 5 days. Had to get our own.
As long as you're planning to crash here for rest, then head back out to NYC, you'll love it. Keep in mind, this is mid-town NYC so there will be noise outside during the nite...people, trucks, etc.
Show more
Alonzo
October 2021
Thank you! Truly appreciated the experience
Becky
October 2021
Wonderful place to stay and near Time Square.
Andrew
October 2021
Great location. Good communication. Only note is lack of paper towels/tissues.

Bedroom in the heart of the trendiest neighborhood on Manhattan. Buzzing with life from bars, restaurants and boutiques giving a real New Yorker experience along with easy subway transit minutes away to all tourist attractions.

The space
East Village double bedroom in gay friendly and social walk up apartment. We have a clean bright and very quiet true NY apartment in the center of the East Village with tons of bars, restaurants, boutiques and Tompkin Sq Park/Union Sq just outside the door. A fully functional kitchen as well as toiletries and towels included for the shower(just bring your toothbrush!). Two Blocks from the L-train that will take you to both the west side and trendy Willamsburg.

We have a lot of knowledge of the area and the city for activities and nightlife. The apartment can be social or as private as you wish and we love meeting new people and sharing our NYC experience. Occasionally work from home but for the most part the apartment will seem like your own. We are very easy going and will accommodate the best we can with your traveling schedule and any needs you may have when you arrive.

Enhanced Clean

Great communication
100% of recent guests rated Nicholas 5-star in communication.
Home of biggie smalls this studio is in the heart of Brooklyn known for its beautiful brownstone architect and amazing local Caribbean cuisines. Ten minutes away from Barclay center this area is full of night life festivities. Bus stop directly across the street from your stay to take you to popular Williamsburg or you have the option to take the train two blocks away for a 15min commute to Manhattan. Gated community, laundry in the basement, indoor parking for additional cost.


It’s not a normal tiny studio like most. You have a big gap from your bed and the kitchen. The kitchen has its own space. Your bed is overlooking a beautiful scenic manhattan views with 3 massive windows bringing in a cool breeze during the day. Relax on the balcony with friends and enjoy your stay

owner_details:
["Sunny Private Room at Central Park!
4.82
(250 reviews)
·
\U000f0003
Superhost
·
New York, United States
Share
Save
Show all photos
Private room in rental unit hosted by Saint
3 guests · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1 shared bath
Enhanced Clean
This Host committed to Airbnb's 5-step enhanced cleaning process. Show more
Self check-in
Check yourself in with the smartlock.
Great location
94% of recent guests gave the location a 5-star rating.
Large, comfortable private bedroom in a spacious apartment with great sun light, and lots of room. Only seconds away from Central Park, is 15mins to Times Square. All major subway and bus lines, great restaurants, and museums. NYC fully vaccinated is a must. Welcome home!

The space
Central Park made simple. You can jog in Central Park each morning or walk along Museum Mile. Apartment is close to the Metropolitan Museum of Art, The Conservatory Gardens, El Museo del Barrio.

There is a sunny, large furnished room waiting for you in a 2-bedroom apartment just seconds from Central Park.

The apartment has hardwood floors, and an elevator. A place to have your laundry done is just on the corner.

This apartment is also very sunny with lots of light and windows. The bedroom is private and just adjacent to a wonderful and spacious Moroccan living room which also doubles as an extra bedroom for relaxing.

Stainless steel kitchen sink and coutertops and tiled bathroom (shared).
The room has a Queen size bed, flat screen television, Hi-Speed internet with wifi, and closets.

The plush Moroccan living room is authentic, gorgeous and entirely relaxing giving you the feeling of peace and tranquility. The Sofa in Moroccan Living Room also converts to large, comfortable bed which sleeps an extra 2 persons.

NEARBY:
Mt Sinai Hospital
Terrence Cardinal Cooke Health Care Center
MUSEUM OF THE CITY OF NY
MUSEO DEL BARRIO

FRICK COLLECTION

JEWISH MUSEUM
COOPER HEWITT
WHITNEY MUSEUM OF AMERICAN ART
NATIONAL ACADEMY MUSEUM
CONSERVATORY GARDENS

Towels, bed linens and blow dryers for the hair are provided, just bring your suitcase.

No smokers / no pets please

Show all 164 reviews
Where you’ll be
New York, United States
We are lucky to live in a great neighborhood. We are located on Henry Street, close to all tourists attractions so you won't even need to take a train to see the city's best.

It is：
30mins subway to Times Square,
25mins train to Herald Square,
20mins walk to Brooklyn Bridge, 9/11 Memorial, Statue of Liberty Ferry and
20mins walk from SoHo with tons of shops and boutiques (shopaholics - stay away!).

You will never need to go back to the same place to eat, because this area is loaded with restaurants, bars and clubs. This is the part of city where New York's history started, glorious and famous. It is not Carrie Bradshaw's New York. It is rather artistic and informal than glamorous. It is rapidly changing too. This is the place where you will feel a real New York atmosphere.

They say New York is the city that never sleeps so don't miss it's nightlife. It's happening just a couple blocks away. On Friday and Saturday you can be bar hopping all night and not even leave the neighborhood. There are places to dance as well. Just go out and feel the transformation.

P.S. I spent some time to add a Guidebook to my profile so don't forget to check it out for some suggestions. I hope it will help you to plan your visit.

Where you’ll be
New York, United States
The Upper West Side is a neighborhood in the borough of Manhattan in New York City. It is bounded by Central Park on the east, the Hudson River on the west, West 59th Street to the south, and West 110th Street to the north.
The Upper West Side is an affluent, primarily residential area with many of its residents working in commercial areas of Midtown and Lower Manhattan. Similarly to the Museum Mile district on the Upper East Side, the Upper West Side is considered one of Manhattan's cultural and intellectual hubs, with Columbia University and Barnard College located just to the north of the neighborhood, and Lincoln Center for the Performing Arts and Fiorello H. LaGuardia High School located at the south end.

Two New York City Subway corridors serve the Upper West Side. The IRT Broadway–Seventh Avenue Line (1, 2, and 3 trains) runs along Broadway. The IND Eighth Avenue Line (A, B, C, and D trains) runs along Central Park West.

There are five bus routes – M5, M7, M10, M11, M104 buses – that go up and down the Upper West Side, and the M57 goes up West End Avenue for 15 blocks in the neighborhood. Additionally, crosstown routes include the M66, M72, M79 SBS, M86 SBS, M96 and M106. The north–south M20 terminates at Lincoln Center

The Upper West Side has been a setting for many films and television shows because of its pre-War architecture, colorful community and rich cultural life. Ever since Edward R. Murrow went "Person-to-Person" live, the length of Central Park West in the 1950s, West Siders scarcely pause to gape at on-site trailers, and jump their skateboards over coaxial cables. At one time it seemed that one or another of the various Law & Order shows took up all the available parking spaces in the neighborhood. Woody Allen's film Hannah and Her Sisters captures that quintessential Upper West Side flavor of rambling high-ceilinged apartments, bursting at the seams with books and other cultural artifacts

["UES Beautiful Blue Room
4.88
(234 reviews)
·
New York, United States
Share

Private room in rental unit hosted by Cyn
1 guest · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 shared bath
Enhanced Clean
This Host committed to Airbnb's 5-step enhanced cleaning process. Show more
Highly rated Host
Cyn has received 5-star ratings from 100% of recent guests.
Great communication
100% of recent guests rated Cyn 5-star in communication.
Beautiful peaceful healthy home

The space
Home is fun healthy.
Your Night’s Sleep: 100% cotton sheets and a fluffy down comforter.
Just pack your favorite comfy shoes and bring your empty suitcases to fill.

The Blue room has a twin bed built on the legs of a piano from the 1800's. There is a dresser and a nice size closet for all your clothes. Hairdryer, bedding and towels are provided in your room. The room is sound proof, no street noise, perfect for jet-lag recovery.
I feel that if my guests have a good nights sleep, they are full of energy for their adventures, then my guests are happy.

The Common Space: approximately 500 square feet, features an Eat-in kitchen, living room and bathroom, to share. There is never more than 2 guests here at a time, this way there is enough space for each of us to get lost in, if we need too.

WIFi, and Netflix,

The home front is a work of art in constant change.


Please book online, because I cannot hold your requested days...
Also I can only host singles...

Constanţa
July 2021
I lived at Cynthia's place for a month in June 2021. The apartment is cozy, the location is perfect and it is easy to get to Central Park and anywhere in the city. For me, the best part was getting to know Cynthia. She is kind, funny, and caring - always jumping to help with anything she can. We became family the first day I met her. She is truly awesome. I hope you all get a chance to meet her.
Show more
Tanya
September 2018
Cynthia is an amazing host. During my month long stay, she made sure that I had clean sheets, fresh pillows and towels, and even made smoothies and dinners for me and the other guests during our stay! Her place is beautiful, eclectic and cozy. Great location as well as it is one block away from the 6 subway line, a few blocks away from Central Park, and close to many grocery stores, places to eat and a 24 hour pharmacy. Would not highly recommend more for a great and convenient place to stay in New York!!
Show more
Terri
December 2017
Cyn's place is amazing. She is friendly, courteous, helpful and a great hostess with the mostess!
Carol
December 2017
Cyn Is a photographer and artist. Her home has been an ongoing art project for about 20 years. It is beautiful, comfortable, and every detail has been thought through. Committed to her guests’ comfort, she happily oriented me to the neighborhood and gave me ideas for what to see in Manhattan. I had a great time —and a much better time than had I stayed In a hotel. Thank you so much, Cyn!
Show more
Rosalind
November 2017
I had a wonderful stay! The apartment is beautifully furnished and decorated and the neighborhood has great shops and restaurants and so close to Central Park! And course the subway. Cynthia is a fantastic host and her smoothies are amazing! Would thoroughly recommend staying here
Show more
Seema
September 2017
The bed was very comfortable

Show all 234 reviews
Where you’ll be
New York, United States
Location: Five minutes to Central Park, Museum Mile (Guggenheim Museum, Metropolitan Museum, Whitney Museum, The Cooper Hewitt Museum, The Frick Collection and many more. Movie Stars pepper the hood and the area is considered “The New Downtown”. Today’s hipsters moved uptown to escape the over gentrified neighborhoods, such as the LES, the Village and now Chelsea.

Shopping: Many cool consignment shops to get your Haute couture, such as the famous Encore.

Food: Around the corner, Gourmet Garage, Japanese, French, Mexican, Health food bars, and Joy Burgers

Laundry: There is a laundry service on the corner, drop before 10am and pickup after 5pm, washed, dried and folded for $11. You will not miss a beat on your venture and you can still look good.
Show more

Joined in May 2009

You’ll love my place because of My two tail waggers that will greet you at the door! I have two dogs that rule the roost. They do not have access to your room, but they live here and are my children. They are absolutely adorable and love people!. My place is good for couples, solo adventurers, and business travelers who don't mind dogs!


My apartment is a large cozy apartment that will be perfect for you to rest in and call home while you are away from yours. The building has a 24hr doorman and the building is quiet and totally suitable for the working professional or the vacationing folks. Your room is private and I ask that you just keep the door closed as the dogs will end up sleeping with you if you don't!!
